loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 36 years old man and is the father of two children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Marwan has a bakery. This is the second time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy a fridge for his business.

loans.use: To buy a fridge for his bakery.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39 years old man. He is the father of three children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Ali is an electrician. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. With it, he wants to buy a compressor for his business.

loans.use: To  buy a compressor.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 21 years old man, the father of one child. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Nabatieh.

Alaa is a baker. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy equipment and invest in the decoration of his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and decorate his business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina Q. is a chop bar operator. She is married and has 2 children. She needs financial assistance to increase her capital and expand her business.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: As additional capital for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. is a trader who deals in lady's items, like bags. She is married and has one child. She is working very hard to support her husband meet the needs of the family. She wants to increase her income by increasing sales.

She is asking for $725.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Sara's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sara is 50 years old and is married with five children, ages 7 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Sara owns a small animal stock, a business she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Zabira, Pudensia and Monica, who have businesses in fruits sales.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sara's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Sara is 50 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 7 to 18 years old. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Sara owns a small animal stock, a business she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth, Zabira, Pudensia, and Monica, who have businesses dealing in fruits sales.

loans.use: To buy more animals to increase her stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Asha's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is married with one 10-month-old child. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 12 years. Asha owns a small stock of animals, a business she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rehema, who has her own business.

loans.use: To increase her animal stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Asha's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is married with 1 child, age 10 months. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 12 years. Asha owns a small stock of animals. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rehema, who has her own business.

loans.use: To increase her animal stock.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mwantumu

texts.en:
Mwantumu is married with 6 children, ages 15 to 31 years old. Mwantumu is a charcoal and firewood seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  and firewood for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 39 years old woman. She has three children. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs.

Souad is a tailor. This is the second time she applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, she wants to buy electrical scissors for her business.

loans.use: To buy electrical scissors for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Takia

texts.en:
Takia is 28 years old and is married with 2 children. Takia is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en: Ihab is a 29 years old man. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ihab provides transportation. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. The credit will help him continue paying for his vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for his vehicle.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Abed Al Nabi

texts.en:
Abed Al Nabi is a 28 years old man with one child. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Abed Al Nabi sells CDs and computer related products. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 41 years old man who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Khalil has a chicken shop. This is the fourth time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy provisions to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To develop his chicken shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 42 years old man. He has four children. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs.

Fadel is a car painter. This is the first time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To develop his car painting business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 42 years old man. He has six children. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Ali is a car mechanic. This is the sixth time he applies for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to open up a flower shop.

loans.use: To open up a flower shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 66 years old man with five children. He works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. Mahmoud makes house products with iron. This is the fifth time he applies for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy materiA. to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy materials for his house products business.

loans.name: Sophia's Mwamboni Seleboss Group

texts.en:
Sophia is 34 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 10 and 14 years. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 92 years old. Sophia owns a small beauty salon and she is a hair dresser. She started her business in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (hair conditioner and hair treatment weaving, for instance) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rose and Joyce, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items (hair conditioner, hair treatment, weaving) for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema's Mwamboni B Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 25 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 13, 9, and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Rehema is a clothes seller, she startedher business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 6:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sauda, Amina, and Mariam, who have businesses in food vending and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 27 years old. She is a single woman with 1child, age 6 years old. Mary is a clothes seller who started her business in 2006. Everyday she works from 8am to 4pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is 30 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 6 months and 8 years old. Mishi is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce S. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is married and has three children. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $825.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Tima's Minchi Sokoni Group

texts.en:
Tima is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 6 years old. Tima is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaasha, Kibibi, and Mwanapwani, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 38 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 8, 3, and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 50 and 68 years old. Asha owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 1999. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar K. is a trader who sells iced fish. She is married and has four children. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. She is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s financial needs. She wants to increase her sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose C. is a trader who owns a provision store. She is the single mother of child. Her income is not sufficient to meet her and her child's financial needs. She wants to increase her income by increasing sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina Q. is a trader who sells cooking utensils and provisions. She is married and has four children. Demand for her goods has increased but her current capital can not buy enough goods to meet the customer demand.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 26 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 10 years. Hadija owns a small shop, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items(bags, shoes, clothes) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items (bags, shoes, clothes) for her shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 39 years old and is married with 3 children. Fatuma is a clothes seller. She started the business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $711. from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny K. M. is a trader who sells building materials. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Fanny is working very hard to support her husband. She wants to expand her business but lacks capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital for the expansion of the business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Saydali

texts.ru:
Saydali K. lives in Rudaki district. He is 47 and has a secondary school education. He and his wife have five children. Saydali has a business bringing animals into Rudaki from faraway villages, where he can purchase them cheaply. Then he re-sells the animals in his hometown and in nearby Dushanbe, the capital of Tajikistan. His business gives him an income that can support his big family. Saydali is applying for a loan in order to increase his sales volume. This will increase his family's income. Saydali plans to repay his loan within ten months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Косимов Сайдали житель района рудаки. Ему 47 лет. Он и его жена имеет 5 детей . Образование среднее. Занимается бизнесом. Привозит из дальних кишлаков мелко-рогатый скот , где покупает по более низкой цене. А затем продает в своем районе и в городе Душанбе.( так как Рудаки находится рядом с городом Душанбе).Его бизнес дает доход , который позволяет обеспечивать его большую семью. Сайдали планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить доход , который необходим для его семьи. Погасить кредит Сайдали планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Увеличить товарооборот.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha Q. is a cold store operator. She is married and has four children. Business is going very well and she wants to increase sales. She is facing a problem of insufficient capital.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru:
Marhamat T. lives in the Rudaki region. She sews women's clothing and Tajik national dresses. She has a big family, but two of her sons are disabled. She has to work a lot to be able to care after her children. Marhamat is 52 years old. In spite her children being sick they all help one another. The season for her business is here and this is why she wants to increase commodity turnaround by buying new fabrics. This will allow her to increase family income. The local residents will also be able to have a wider selection options and buy modern clothing. She wants to receive a loan for US$725 and pay it off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошматова Мархамат жительница района Рудаки.Занимается пошивом одежды для женщин. Шьет национальные платья. У нее большая семья , но двое сыновей инвалиды. Поэтому ей приходится много работать , чтобы лечить детей. Мархамат 52 года. Не смотря на то , что дети болеют они все вместе помогают друг другу. Сейчас наступил сезон ее бизнеса. Поэтому она хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем закупки нового материала. Это поможет ей увеличить доходы семьи. Кроме того население . которое пользуется ее услугами сможет иметь выбор и покупать модные платья. Для этого она хочет получить кредит в размере 725 долларов США. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. prepares doughnuts for sale. She is married and has six children. The price of the flour, which is the major raw material for the preparation of doughnuts, has increased and it is affecting her income.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to offset the cost of increased flour prices.

loans.use: Additional capital to offset the cost of increased flour prices

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat M. lives in the Rudaki region with her family. She is married and has two children. She is 45 years old and has a specialized secondary education. She finished a medical school, but is earning money by sewing national Tajik dresses and selling them. She has been in this business for about ten years. She buys fabrics, sews dresses and sells them on the market "Kovron" in the city of Dushanbe. Her daughter is helping her with the business and they sew clothing together. Mamlakat wants to increase the selection of fabrics and needs a loan. It will help increase her commodity turnover and income for her family. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Мамлакат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и у нее двое детей.Ей 45 лет. Мамлакат имеет средне-специальное образование .Закунчила она медицинское училище. Но зарабатывает деньги, шитьем национальных платьев и их реализацией.Занимается этим видом бизнеса около10 лет. Она закупает материал , шьет платья и продает на рынке « Корвон» города Душанбе.В ее бизнесе ей помогает ее дочь. Они вместе шьют одежду. Сейчас Мамлакат хочет увеличить ассортимент материала, поэтому хочет получить кредит. Он поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и доход семьи. А погасить кредит сможет втечении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina K. is a trader who sells sewing items. She is married and has three children. Business is booming and she wants to increase her stock to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Aadditional capital to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia S. is a trader who sells used clothing. She is married and has three children. She travels to Accra to buy clothing to sell. The cost of transportation absorbs the majority of her income.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to offset the cost of transportation.

loans.use: Additional capital to to offset the cost of transportation

loans.name: Hayniso

texts.ru:
Hayniso Y. lives in the region of Vahdat. She is 50 years old, married and has seven children. She has secondary education and is in the retail business selling shoes on the local market of Vahdat. She has been in this business for the past ten years. Hayniso's sons went to Russia to find work, but they are sending money to her very rarely. She has to support her family on her own. The income from her business lets her buy the necessary groceries and some clothes for the family.

At this time, Hayniso wants to purchase seasonal clothing and increase the variety of her merchandise. She needs the money and decided to apply for a loan. The loan will help improve the quality of life of her family. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ерова Хайнисо жительница района Вахдат.Ей 50 лет .Хайнисо замужем, имеет 7 детей.Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается купле продажей обуви.Хайнисо торгует на местном рынке города Вахдат. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 10 лет . Сыновья Хайнисо уехали в Россию на заработки, но посылают деньги очень редко. Поэтому клиентка сама содержит свою семью. Прибыль от торговли позволяет ей покупать необходимые продукты питания и кое что из одежды для ее семьи.

Сейчас Хайнисо хочет закупить сезонную одежду и увеличить ассортимент товара. Для этого ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит. Кредит поможет ей улучшить качество жизни ее семьи. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Sumangul

texts.ru:
Sumangul Abdulloevna D. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. Sumangul has been in the clothing retail business for the past 9 years. She has a vendor space on the market in Vahdat. Her small business profits allow her to support and take care of her children. At this time, she wants to buy seasonal clothing and needs a loan. By increasing the variety of her merchandise, she will have better profits. She will also provide the residents with a quality and inexpensive merchandise. Sumangul plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатова Сумангул Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Сумангул уже 9 лет занимается купле продажей одежды. На рынке города Вахдат она имеет торговую точку. От прибыли , которую приносит ее небольшой бизнес Сумангул может воспитывать и растить своих детей. В данное время клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду и поэтому решила взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент товара Сумангул может получить хорошую прибыль.Тем самым предоставит жителям Вахдата качественную и не дорогую продукцию. Сумангул планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Sumangul.

texts.ru: Давлатова Сумангул  Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года, замужем, имеет  3 детей.Образование среднее. Сумангул уже 9 лет занимается купле продажей одежды. На рынке города Вахдат она имеет торговую точку. От прибыли , которую приносит ее небольшой бизнес Сумангул может воспитывать и растить своих детей. В данное время клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду и поэтому решила взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент товара Сумангул может получить хорошую прибыль.Тем самым предоставит  жителям  Вахдата качественную и не дорогую продукцию. Сумангул планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: увеличить ассортимент товара

loans.name: Kumrihon

texts.ru:
Kumrihon Abdumalikovna H. lives in the region of Vahdat. She is 38 years old, married and has five children. She has secondary education and has been selling women's and children's clothing on the local Vahdat market for the past 15 years. Kumrihon's husband is currently unemployed and this is why the retail business is the only source of income for her big family. Three of her children go to school. Kumrihon wants to purchase seasonal clothing and she needs the money so she decided to apply for a loan. By receiving a loan she will be able to fully support her family and satisfy the needs of the residents with quality merchandise. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Холикова Кумрихон Абдумаликовна жительница района Вахдат.Ей 38 лет .Кумрихон замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее .Клиентка уже 15 лет торгует на местном рынке города Вахдат женской и детской одеждой. Муж Кумрихон временно не работает.Поэтому торговля является единственным источником ее большой семьи.Трое детей Кумрихон ходят в среднюю школу. Клиентка хочет закупить новую сезонную одежду. Для этого ей нужны денежные средства и она решила получить кредит. Получив кредит, она сможет лучше содержать свою семью и удовлетворить потребности местного населения качественным товаром. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Raeli

texts.en:
Raeli is 23 years old and is married. Raeli sells clothes, a business she started in 2007. She works every day from 10 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Salma's Usagara Muheza Group

texts.en:
Salma is 40 years old and is married with 7 children, aged 13-25. Salma owns a small shop, which she started in 2001. She works every day from 9 am to 5 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (sugar, kerosene, rice, cooking oil) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Somoe, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy more items (sugar, rice, kerosene, cooking oil) for her shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is single with 1 child, aged 5. Mariam sells clothes, a business she started in 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanamiraji

texts.en:
Mwanamiraji is married with 8 children, aged 14-30. Mwanamiraji sells chickens, a business that she began in 2007. She works every day from 7 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business.

loans.name: Hamida's Shapu Group

texts.en:
Hamida is 40 years old and is married with 4 children, aged 20, 17, 12 and 7. Hamida is a clothes seller, which she started doing in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Biasha, who has a clothing sales business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married and she and her husband take care of a 50 year old person. Nuru sells clothes, which she began doing in 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $47 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is married with 4 children, aged 22, 19, 15 and 5. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, who is 70 years old. Teresia sells clothes, which she began doing in 2005. She works every day from 10 am to 2 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 32 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 10, 8, and 4. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, aged 13. Fatuma sells clothes, a business that she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 32 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages10,8, and 4 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 13 years old. Fatuma is a clothes seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mwanahamis's Sana Tu Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 45 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 30, 27 and 15. Mwanahamis owns a small shop, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (shoes and clothes) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma and Isana, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and firewood sales, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (shoes and clothes) for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Darine

texts.en: Darine is a 49 years old woman with 5 children. She works and lives in Aley. Darine is a products agent and this is the fifth time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 64 year old woman. She has 2 children. She works and lives in Aley. Fadwa knits and makes other handicrafts. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hadija's Sana Tu Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 39 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 9-15.Hadija sells clothes, a business that she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatime, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Elissar

texts.en: Elissar is 39 years old, and has one child. She works and lives in Aley. Elissar crochets clothing, and sells her products. This is her first loan, and she would like it to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 33 year old woman who lives in Aley. Fadia sells towels, clothes etc. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at A. Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mwajuma's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 37 years old and is divorced with 2 children, aged 10 and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children. Mwajuma sells fish, a business which she started in 2002. She works every day from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanajumaa and Neema, who have businesses dealing in vegetable sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand a restaurant

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 47 year old mother of 4 children. She works and lives in Aley, Lebanon. Mona is the owner of a locA. embroidery business, and will use the loan to buy materials and develop her business. She is a reliable entrepreneur, having already paid back a loan before.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is 48 years old and married with two children. Her children are 20 and 15 years old. Mwanahawa is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm at her business every day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ramzieh

texts.en: Ramzieh is 61 years old, and has 6 children. She works and lives in Aley. Ramzieh sells a variety of products. This will be her first loan, and she would like to purchase new merchandise to further expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Elham

texts.en: Elham is a 57 year old woman.  She has 7 children, and she works and lives in Aley. Elham does crochet work. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She plans to use the loan to buy materials for her business.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Mwansiti

texts.en:
Mwansiti is 33 years old and is married with 5 children. Mwansiti is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2005. She works from 7am to 6pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Layal

texts.en: Layal is a 21 year old woman. She has 1 child. She works and lives in Aley. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy new merchandise and jewelry to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise and jewelry

loans.name: Riham

texts.en: Riham is a 20 year old woman who lives in Aley selling clothes. This is the second time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 35 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are 20, 17 and 15 years old. Rose is a clothes seller. She started her business in 2003. She works from 6am to 7pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand a bricklaying business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand a tie-dye business

loans.name: Ivon Alicia

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago Ivon began her stationery store with a small display case and a few items for sale. She started the business out of economic need when her three children starting growing up and expenses were increasing, and her husband´s teacher´s salary was not enough. Currently two of her children are in primary school and the oldest is in university. They help her in the business when they are on break from school. Little by little her business has grown and now she not only sells stationery supplies but also some gift items.

She now needs a loan for US $950, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy supplies for the upcoming Children´s Day and Mother´s Day holidays. She is confident that with your contribution her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ivon tiene una papelería que inicio hace 15 años con una pequeña vitrina y unos cuantos artículos para venta. Ella emprendió el negocio dada la necesidad económica por la que estaban pasando cuando sus tres hijos empezaron a crecer y entonces los gastos se incrementaron y el sueldo como profesor de su marido no les alcanzaba, actualmente dos de sus hijos cursan la primaria y la mayor esta en la universidad. Ellos la ayudan a atender el negocio cuando están de vacaciones en la escuela. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio ya que ahora no solo vende artículos de papelería sino también algunos artículos para regalo.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para las próximas fechas del día del niño y día de las Madres. Ella confía que con tu contribución lograra progresar en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase inventory.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
Juan Luis has a general store which he started up because the income he could earn as a laborer was too little. So 12 years ago he decided to start a business in order to have extra income. He is the father of 3 sons ages 17, 14 and 4, and as they grow up his expenses also increase, and he wants to give them a more comfortable and better life.

He is now asking for a loan of US $400, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and some items which his customers have been requesting and which he wants to offer, such as gifts and stationery. With your help Juan Luis will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Luis tiene una tienda de abarrotes la cual inició por que es poco el ingreso que tiene como trabajador en un taller entonces hace 12 años decidió emprender un negocio para otro ingreso. El es padre de 3 hijos de 17, 14 y 4 años y conforme van creciendo se van incrementando los gastos y el deseaba darles mas comodidad y una mejor vida.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y algunos artículos que sus clientes le están solicitando y que el quiere ofrecerles como regalos y papelería. Con tu apoyo Juan Luis saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Siwema's Azimio Kichemchem Group

texts.en:
Siwema, age 26, is married with 4 children (ages 19, 9, 6, and 2). She has a charcoal business and also sells sarongs from door-to-door. She started this work 3 years ago and sells charcoal and sarongs from 7am to noon daily. In a month, she makes a profit of about $70.

In the past, Siwema has taken 3 loans to increase the stock for her business. She now hopes for a new loan to buy more charcoal and sarongs to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in brick production, charcoal, cement, and general items sales.

In the picture, Siwema is standing first on the left.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and sarongs to sell door-to-door

loans.name: Thelma Esther

texts.es:
Thelma R. is married and has three married sons. Currently she has changed her residence to be closer to her grandchildren, whom she takes care of several hours a day because her daughter in law works.

She started her business, a store selling tamales, to help her husband with the educational expenses of their sons since her husband works as a laborer in some ranches and makes a minimal wage. Due to her dedication her sales have been going well. She had to change the location of her business and she is establishing herself at the new address.

She is currently requesting a loan of USD $575, which she will repay in six months, for the purchase of raw materials. With your contribution, Thelma will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Thelma R. es casada y tiene tres hijos que están casados. Actualmente se cambio de domicilio para estar cerca de la casa de sus nietos, porque los esta cuidando algunas horas del día, en las que su nuera trabaja. Inició su negocio, un expendio de tamales para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de educación de sus hijos ya que su esposo trabaja como jornalero en algunos ranchos y percibe el sueldo mínimo. Debido a su dedicación le ha ido muy bien con la venta de estos. Tuvo que cambiar el negocio de lugar, y se esta posicionando nuevamente en el nuevo domicilio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para compra de materia prima. Con tu contribución Thelma seguirá prosperando.

loans.use: Purchase or raw materials

loans.name: Wisdom 2015-1 Group

texts.en: Roda K. is the leader of her group of five.  Roda sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Roda is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a  driver.  She has 7 children ranging from age 18 to 40.  Each week, Roda makes approximately 20 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the help of her loan, she hopes to be able to grow her business. Roda is joined in her small group by Madellina K., Rejina N., Anna F., and Victoria Eliyas.  Madellina K. and Rejina N. sell breads.  Anna F. brews alcohol and Victoria Eliyas is sells beer. All of these ladies will use their loans to build their businesses.

loans.use: To expands businesses

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda Jiménez is married and has three kids, two of them are married. One of them works at a bank and the other one is a housewife. Her younger one is single, has a job but still lives at home.

She began her beauty salon business where she offers services as: hairstyling, perms, haircuts and more. She did this in order to help her husband with everyday home and children expenses. She wanted to offer her family a better quality of life.

She is actually requesting a loan of $350 which she will pay in 4 months. She will use this money to buy some materials that she still needs in order to offer some specific services. With your help Hilda will be able to move on.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda Jiménez es casada y tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores y están casadas, una de ellas trabaja en un banco y la otra se dedica al hogar, el menor es soltero y trabaja aun vive en casa. Ella decidió iniciar su negocio, un salón de belleza donde ofrece diversos servicios como peinados, permanentes, cortes de cabello y mas, lo hizo para apoyar a su marido con los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos, ya que querían ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Actualmente solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar algunos materiales que le hacen falta para realizar diversos servicios. Con tu ayuda Hilda saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of working materials

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús A. does janitorial work and doesn't make much money. He barely earns enough to pay for basic living needs. For this reason he undertook another business venture in order to have money for any unforeseen necessary expenditures in the future. About three years ago, using money he had saved and a loan from a friend, he began to sell linens to work friends and family from a catalog. This business has been going well for him, as he treats his customers well and has low prices.

Jesús A. is asking for a loan of $300 to remodel the room where he displays his products. He will repay the loan in 3 months.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Jesús A. se desempeña como operador de limpieza, su salario es bajo, y apenas le alcanza para sus gastos más necesarios, por lo cual le surgió la inquietud de emprender alguna actividad para tener dinero extra para imprevistos. Hace aproximadamente 3 años, con algo de dinero que tenia ahorrado y con un pequeño préstamo de un familiar, empezó con la venta de blancos por catalogo a sus compañeros de trabajo y familiares. le ha ido muy bien con esta actividad ya que da un buen trato a sus clientes y buenos precios.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para remodelar el cuarto donde tiene la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To remodel the home store

loans.name: Flor De Liz 1 Group

texts.es:
Norma Esperanza B. V. belongs to the Flor de Liz 1 solidarity group. She is 36 years old and has three children. Two years ago she started a business selling clothing from her home. The goods most in demand are women´s and children´s clothing. With her loan she will invest in buying more merchandise, for which she will travel to the city of Tuxtla Gutierrez, located two hours from her town. Part of her earnings will go toward helping out with household expenses.

The other members of the group are Minerva Neri, who sells jewelry and Gloria, who embroiders blouses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

NORMA ESPERANZA B. V. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO FLOR DE LIZ 1. ELLA TIENE 36 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS. DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS INICIO EL NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE ROPA EN SU CASA, LA MERCANCIA MAS COTIZADA ES DE MUJERES Y NIÑOS. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAS MERCANCIA YA QUE VIAJA A LA CIUDAD DE TUXTLA GUTIERREZ UBICADO A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. PARTE DE SUS GANACIAS ES PARA APOYAR CON LOS GASTOS DE SU HOGAR. LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO DOÑA MINERVA NERI (VENTA DE ALHAJAS) Y DOÑA GLORIA (ARTESANA, BORDA BLUSAS).

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Afi Martine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Afi Martine S. was born on March 29, 1973 in Lomé. She is married and is the mother of four children. She sells fruit juice, ice water, and smoothies made from milk, sorghum and ice cubes. She has been in this business since 1997 in the district of Agoè in the north of Lomé. At present, she has found a niche in the Société Togolaise de Plaques. This sales point is well suited to her business and ensures her a goodly number of sales every day. Her first loan in the amount of US$ 375, which she reimbursed promptly, allowed her to acquire a freezer.

In view of the size of her customer base, she would like to have a second freezer in order to produce a sufficient quantity of ice; she also wants to buy a bag of sorghum. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 625.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Afi Martine est née le 29 mars 1973 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de jus de fruits, d’eau glacée et de bouillie préparée à base de lait, sorgho et de glaçon. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1997 dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Présentement elle a trouvé un emplacement au sein de la Société Togolaise de Plaques. Cet endroit approprié à son activité lui permet de réaliser un chiffre d’affaires journalier important. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 150.000 FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé lui a permis d’acquérir un congélateur.

Compte tenu de l’importance de sa clientèle, elle désire acquérir un second congélateur pour produire en quantité suffisante le glaçon et acheter un sac de sorgho. Elle sollicite alors un crédit de 250.000 FCFA.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congélateur

loans.name: Flor De Liz 2 Group

texts.es:
María Aide is 37 years old and has three children. She sells glassware and toys. She started the business 3 years ago because her town was very small and did not have any stores where they sold childrens´s toy, dishes or glassware. She buys her goods in San Cristobal de las Casas or Tuxtla Gutierrez, both places located two hours from her town. She belongs to the Flor de Liz 2 solidarity group along with Rosalinda, who sells clothing and Aida Delia, who sells fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA AIDE TIENE 37 AÑOS, TRES HIJOS Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE CRISTALERIA Y JUGUETES. ESTE NEGOCIO LO INICIO HACE TRES AÑOS A RAIZ DE QUE SU LOCALIDAD ES MUY PEQUEÑA Y NO HAY TIENDAS EN DONDE VENDAN DISTINTOS JUGUETES PARA LOS NIÑOS, PLATOS Y VASOS DE CRISTAL. SU MERCANCIA LO COMPRA EN SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS O TUXTLA GUTIERREZ AMBAS UBICADAS A DOS HORAS DE SU LOCALIDAD. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO FLOR DE LIZ 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA ROSALINDA (VENTA DE ROPA) Y DOÑA AIDA DELIA (VENTA DE TELAS)

loans.use: Purchase toys and glassware.

loans.name: Flor De Liz 3 Group

texts.es:
The support group named Flor de Liz is made up of three women: Teresa de Jesus M. (grocery business), Josefa Mariela (grocery business), and Mrs. Teresa de Jesus Mendes D.. Mrs. D. is 57 years old and has 10 children. She began a bread business two years ago in her home. She offers delicious, warm breads to the general public every day of the week. These women are hard working and wish overcome adversity in order to offer their families a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

EL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO FLOR DE LIZ 3 ESTA FORMADO POR TERESA DE JESUS M. (TIENDA DE ABARROTES), JOSEFA MARIELA (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y DOÑA TERESA DE JESUS MENDES D. 1° TIENE 57 AÑOS Y TUVO DIEZ HIJOS. INICO EL NEGOCIO DE PANADERIA DESDE HACE DOS AÑOS EN SU CASA, OFRECE AL PUBLICO EN GENERAL PANES DELICIOSOS Y CALIENTITOS TODOS LOS DIAS. ELLAS SON MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS Y TRABAJADORAS QUE QUIEREN SOBRESALIR PARA OFRECER A SU FAMILIA UNA MEJOR CALIDAD VIDA.

loans.use: To purchase flour and eggs to make bread

loans.name: Abidé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abidé H. was born on June 13, 1978 in Kadja, in the prefecture of Kozah. She is married. She owns a bar called SOURCE d’EAU in Agoè where she has been selling soft drinks since 2004. She has an open, airy place where customers can make themselves comfortable.

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 975 which will allow her to make repairs on her two freezers and purchase 55 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame H. Abidé est née le 13 juin 1978 à Kadja dans la préfecture de la Kozah. Elle est mariée. Elle est propriétaire du bar « SOURCE d’EAU » à Agoè où elle vend les boissons gazeuses depuis 2004. Elle dispose d’un espace aéré qui permet aux consommateurs de se mettre à l’aise.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’une valeur de 400.000 FCFA lui permettra de réparer deux congélateurs dont elle dispose et d’acheter 55 casiers de bières.

loans.use:
Repairing two freezers and purchasing 55 cases of beer

Réparation de 2 congélateurs et achat de 55 casiers de bières

loans.name: Biakamangue

texts.fr:
Mrs. Biakamangue K., 33, is married and the mother of three children. In 1999 she opened up a little store she calls ETS DIEU N’OUBLIE PERSONNE where she sells everyday necessities in the neighborhood of Agoè. Her first loan in the amount of US$ 1100 allowed her to purchase the goods she retails in sufficient quantity to avoid going back and forth a lot to the Central Market in Lomé. She was also able to avoid buying on credit which used to cut into her profit.

Since her turnover has now increased and in view of the needs of her clientele, she would like to request another loan of US$ 1100 to purchase 10 sacks of rice, 10 tins of vegetable oil, and seven sacks of sugar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 33 ans, Madame K. Biakamangue est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. En 1999 elle a crée une boutique « ETS DIEU N’OUBLIE PERSONNE » de vente des produits de première nécessité dans le quartier d’Agoè. Son premier crédit d’un montant de 450.000FCFA lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour éviter de faire d’incessants allers-retours vers le Grand Marché de Lomé et de se soustraire du crédit fournisseur qui ne lui permet pas de gagner suffisamment.

Suite à l’accroissement de la vente et aux besoins de la clientèle, elle désire reconduire son crédit pour un montant de 450.000 FCA pour acheter dix (10) sacs de riz, dix (10) bidons d’huile végétale et sept (7) sacs de sucre.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 bags of rice and 10 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de riz et de 10 bidons d'huile végétale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Maria F. began selling groceries three years ago when her husband was let go from his job. At that time they both decided to invest all they had in this business so that they could satisfy their basic needs and afford everyday expenditures. Today their business generates a lot of income and they have been able to move forward with expenditures and assume responsibility for their situation.

Martha is asking for a $475 loan so that she can enlarge and remodel her store. She will repay the loan in 6 months. With your help her goal will be reached.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Martha F. se Inicio en la venta de Abarrotes hace tres años, debido a que su esposo fue liquidado de su empleo, al verse ambos con la responsabilidad de los gastos económicos y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, decidieron invertir lo de la liquidación en el negocio, que hasta hoy en día les ha dejado buenos ingresos y han podido salir adelante con todos los gastos y responsabilidades.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito por US $475 a 6 meses, para ampliar y bordear el local. Con tu contribución esto podrá hacerse realidad.

loans.use: Remodel the store

loans.name: Simoambar 1 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is a craftswoman who makes bracelets, necklaces and earrings using amber. Her community, Simojovel, is characterized by extracting amber from its mines. Most community members work with this material and base their economy on it. With the loan, she intends to buy more amber in order to shape different accessories for men, women and children. She is separated from her husband and needs to invest in the business, in order to obtain profits to support her four children. Gloria is 31 years old and a member of the solidary group called Simoambar 1, along with her partners, devoted to the same activity, Cristina A. Hernández y Berthi Sánchez Hernández.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es artesana y hace pulseras, collares y aretes con material de ámbar. Su comunidad, Simojovel, se caracteriza por extraer de sus minas el ámbar. La mayor parte de su comunidad trabaja este material y su economía lo obtiene de este mismo. Con su préstamo pretende comprar más ambar para darle forma en distintos accesorios para hombres, mujeres y niños. Ya que es separada de su esposo, necesita invertir en el negocio para obtener ganancias y asi sostener a sus cuatro hijos. Gloria tiene 31 años y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Simoambar 1, junto con sus compañeras, que desempeñan la misma actividad, Cristina A. Hernández y Berthi Sánchez Hernández.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of amber.

loans.name: Simoambar 2 Group

texts.es:
Celia is 29 years old and has four children. She belongs to the SIMOAMBAR2 solidarity group. She pursues handicraft activities. She buys amber and later works it into bracelets, earrings and necklaces. She also decorates articles such as handbags and other handmade goods. These products are sold to persons who resells them both in and outside of the state of Chiapas. The other members of the group - Martha R. Nuñez and Juan Nuñez G. - also work with amber.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

CELIA TIENE 29 AÑOS, CUATRO HIJOS, PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO SIMOAMBAR 2. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD ARTESANAL. COMPRA AMBAR Y POSTERIORMENTE LO TRABAJA DANDOLE FORMA DE PULCERAS, ARETES, COLLARES. TAMBIEN PUEDE DECORAR OTROS ARTICULOS COMO BOLSAS Y RECUERDOS ARTESANALES. ESTOS PRODUCTOS SON VENDIDOS A PERSONAS QUE LO COMERCIALIZAN DENTRO Y FUERA DEL ESTADO DE CHIAPAS. SUS DEMAS COMPAÑERAS TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN AL TRABAJO DEL AMBAR: MARTHA R. N. Y JUANA N. G..

loans.use: Purchase amber.

loans.name: Simoambar 3 Group

texts.es:
Every morning Paulina Hernández T. sells butchered and cleaned chickens from home. She has been doing this for the past 2 years, and in the afternoons sells shoes by catalog, offering her goods to family members, friends and neighbors. With a loan, she will invest in both businesses so she can have an income to help her husband with family expenses. She belongs to the SIMOAMBAR 3 solidarity group along with Leticia Adriana, who sells perfume and cosmetics, Herlinda Sánchez M., who sell chickens, and Milagros de Jesus E., who works with amber.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

PAULINA H. T. SE DEDICA POR LAS MAÑANAS A LA VENTA DE POLLO DESTAZADO EN SU CASA, LLEVA DOS AÑOS CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD, POR LAS TARDES VENDE CALZADO POR CATALOGO OFRECIENDO A FAMILIARES, AMIGOS, VECINOS. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN AMBOS NEGOCIOS YA QUE OBTIENE INGRESOS PARA OPOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO SIMOAMBAR 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA LETICIA ADRIANA (VENTA DE PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS), HERLINDA S. M. (VENTA DE POLLO) Y DOÑA MILAGROS DE JESUS E. (ARTESANA DEL AMBAR).

loans.use: Invest in businesses.

loans.name: Margarita's Group

texts.es:
Isabel and Margarita belong to the Santo Domingo de Acocro Communal Bank, from the Acocro district, located two hours away from the city of Ayacucho.

Isabel is 27 years old, married and mother of three children. Along with her husband, she manufactures typical breads and sells them at the Acocro main plaza on weekdays and at her district fair on Saturdays. She bakes her breads in a rented oven. She also raises small animals and sells them at the fairs.

Margarita, on the other hand, is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She is a peddler at Acocro’s main plaza, who sells fruit, chicken and fish. She also buys cereals and potatoes at her district to them sell them at Ayacucho’s markets. Isabel and Margarita need loans of 600 and 1500 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying wheath, sugar, rice, produce, meat and hens.

Isabel and Margarita’s dreams are to have a cart to transport their products, educate their children, increase their businesses capital and own an oven.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Isabel y Margarita pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo de Acocro, las socias son del Distrito de Acocro, ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel es casada, tiene 27 años y 3 hijos. Junto a su esposo, elabora panes típicos de la zona y realiza sus ventas en la plaza principal de Acocro de lunes a viernes, y los días sábados vende en la feria de su distrito. Isabel hornea los panes en un horno alquilado. Además Isabel se dedica a la crianza de animales menores que posteriormente vende en las ferias.

Por otro lado Margarita es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos. Vende frutas, pollo y pescado en la plaza principal de Acocro de manera ambulatoria. Además Margarita compra cereales y papa en su distrito y lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel y Margarita necesitan préstamos de 600 y 1500 soles respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, gallina, azúcar, arroz, verduras, frutas y carnes.

Los sueños de Isabel y Margarita son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, educar a sus hijos, incrementar el capital de su negocio y tener un horno propio.

loans.use: Isabel and Margarita need loans of 600 and 1500 soles respectively, which they will invest in buying wheath, sugar, rice, produce, meat and hens.

loans.name: Amelia Leonidas

texts.es:
Amelia is a member of the community bank Santo Domingo de Acocro. Amelia lives in the district of Acocro which is located about 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Through her community bank she has learned to be disciplined, responsible, orderly and clean. Amelia is married and is 32 years old. Amelia has a coffee shop in the school of the district where she sells fruit, candy and food. Additionally, together with her husband they have a locksmith shop.

Amelia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, candy and condiments.

Her savings will be used in the construction of her house where she will locate her business. Amelia dreams of traveling to different places and having a good time with her husband, having a beautiful house and being with her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Amelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo de Acocro, Amelia es natural del Distrito de Acocro que esta ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser disciplinada, responsable, ordenada y limpia. Amelia es casada y tiene 32 años, Amelia tiene un cafetín en el colegio del distrito donde vende frutas, golosinas y comida. Además junto a su esposo tienen una cerrajería.

Amelia necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, golosinas y condimentos.

Sus ahorros serán utilizados en la construcción de su casa y para implementar su negocio en su casa. Los sueños de Amelia son viajar a distintos lugares y divertirse junto a su esposo, tener una casa bonita y estar junto a su mama.

loans.use: Amelia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, cooking oil, noodles, candy and condiments.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44710

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia is a member of the community bank Santo Domingo D. Acocro, lives in the district of Acocro which is 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Apolonia is married, is 55 years old and has 2 children. Apolonia has a grocery store in her home located in the main plaza of the district of Acocro. Also, she works in the growing of cereals which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Apolonia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, ham and candy.

Apolonia dreams of having a large shop in the city of Ayacucho and living in Ayacucho with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Apolonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo D. Acocro, Apolonia es natural del Distrito D. Acocro que esta ubicado a 2 horas D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Apolonia es casada, tiene 55 años y 2 hijos, Apolonia tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa ubicado en la plaza principal del Distrito D. Acocro. Además Apolonia se dedica a la agricultura D. cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Apolonia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas, cerveza, arroz, azúcar, jabón y golosinas.

Apolonia sueña con tener una botica granD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y vivir en Ayacucho junto a sus hijos.

loans.use: Apolonia needs a loan of 1500 soles (USD $575), money which will be invested in the purchase of soft drinks, beer, rice, sugar, ham and candy for her store.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44711

loans.name: Tereza's Group

texts.es:
Magna, Maritza and Tereza belong to the Santo Domingo de Acocro community bank. They are from the district of Acocro, located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Magna lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. Magna has a general store in her home. Additionally, Magna plants grains, which she sells to intermediaries.

Maritza, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has 1 son. Maritza has a small store where she sells groceries and sweets, her store is located close to the district school. In addition, Maritza sells food.

Tereza lives with her partner, is 43 years old and has 5 children. Tereza has a store where she sells groceries and vegetables. In addition, Tereza sells food to workers at different institutions in the district.

Magna, Maritza and Tereza need loans to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, pastas, cookies, candy, chicken, vegetables, meat and spices.

Among the dreams which Magna, Maritza and Tereza have are to have a cart to transporting their merchandise, that their children become professionals, to have a restaurant and that their businesses improve.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Magna, Maritza y Tereza pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo de Acocro, las socias son del Distrito de Acocro que esta ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Magna es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Magna tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, Además Magna siembra cereales que vende a intermediarios.

Por otro lado Maritza es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Maritza tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende abarrotes y golosinas, su tienda esta ubicada cerca del centro educativo del Distrito. Además Maritza vende comida.

Mientras que Tereza es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Tereza tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras. Además Tereza vende comida a los trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones del Distrito.

Magna, Maritza y Tereza necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo, galletas, caramelos, pollo, verduras, carne y condimentos.

Los sueños de Magna, Maritza y Tereza son tener un carro para transportar su mercadería, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un restaurante y que sus negocios sean mejores.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses; buy rice, sugar, milk, pastas, cookies, candy, chicken, vegetables, meat and spices.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
This lady is very hard working and a warrior. She has three older children, they all help her with home expenses. Maria cleans houses as a living. She has been doing this since she was 21 years old and has been working very hard for many years. With her hard work she has been building her home bit by bit and hopes to make some improvements in the near future. Currently, she hopes to change the ceiling of her house and this way guarantee a dry winter free of leaky roofs.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, todos la apoyan con los gastos de la casa. Doña María tiene como oficio servir en casas. Ella desde hace 21 años es doméstica y le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para mantener a sus hijos y sacarlos adelante, Con su trabajo poco a poco ha ido construyendo su casa y espera en un futuro hacerle mejoras para tener una casa más digna. Actualmente espera poder cambiar el techo de su casa y de esa manera garantizar que en el próximo invierno su hogar no se vaya a inundar debido a las goteras.

loans.use: Purchase of materials in order to fix her roof

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gladis Ivania

texts.es:
Ms. Gladis has a degree in Biology, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood and is single. Due to the economic conditions in our country, she makes a living selling chicken and fried food, cool drinks and hamburgers in the evening.

Gladis is an enterprising woman with a lot of enthusiasm towards her work. She plans to grow her business in the future and be prosperous. This is the reason for her request for financing, to be able to invest it in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gladis es licenciada en Biología, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es soltera; pero, debido a la situación económica de nuestro país se dedica a la venta de pollo, a la vez por la noche vende fritanga, fresco y hamburguesas.

Gladis es una mujer emprendedora y de mucho entusiasmo para el trabajo. En un futuro espera poder crecer y lograr que su negocio sea próspero. Es por esta razón que esta pidiendo este financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio.

loans.use: Invest the money in her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mayra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Mayra is 33 years old, married, and has two young children. She is a woman that has always worked to help her husband with household expenditures and independently finance herself at the same time. Her husband is a taxi driver and contributes to the economic management of their home.

Mrs. Mayra sells fish and also runs a car wash. She is the head of both businesses. She is requesting a loan so that she can build a wall on the east side of her house, thus providing her family with more security.

Translated by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Doña Mayra es una mujer de 33 años, casada, tiene dos hijos adolescentes. Es una mujer que siempre se ha dedicado a los negocios a fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y a la vez para ser una mujer independiente en sus finanzas. Su esposo es taxista y con su trabajo contribuye de sobremanera con la economía de la casa. La Sra. Mayra se dedica a la venta de pescado y al mismo tiempo tiene un auto lavado ambos negocios los administra ella. El préstamo lo esta solicitando para construir un muro al este de su casa, con este muro espera darle mayor seguridad a su hogar.

loans.use: To build a wall to protect her home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida is 46 years old and lives in the village of Memorial Sandino in the capital. She works as a very responsible person in a pharmacy. She helps needy children as young as 5 years old.

She has 4 young boys who help her with daily home expenses. One of her biggest dreams is to have a better home, one that will offer the basic needs that all human beings need in order to have a healthy and nice life.

The loan Zoraida requests is to invest in the purchase of building materials which will be used to remodel a bedroom and living room in the house.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zoraida tiene 46 años de edad habita en el Bo. Memorial Sandino de nuestra capital, trabaja como responsable de farmacia en un Centro de apoyo a niños de escasos recursos desde hace cinco años. Tiene 4 hijos varones de los cuales dos trabajan y ayudan en gran medida a su mamá en los gastos de la casa. Uno de los grandes anhelos de la Sra. es tener una vivienda más digna, que cuente con las comodidades básicas que todo ser humano necesita para vivir en un ambiente sano y agradable. El préstamo doña Zoraida lo esta solicitando para invertir el dinero en compra de materiales de construcción que utilizará para la remodelación de un cuarto y de la sala de su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials to build a room for their home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es:
Juana is 40 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte, her and her husband maintain their own home. However, in order to help her husband with expenses has taken a job as a cook.

From her salary she hopes to pay back the loan requested to put up a wall in her home. Their 17 and 20 year old kids help them around the house. She wishes for them to live in a safer home. She hopes the wall is just the beginning for more small projects to come. She hopes to make this a reality through the loans she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana de 40 años de edad, habita en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casada y su esposo mantiene la casa de su trabajo, sin embargo ella para apoyar la carga de su marido en los tiempos difíciles trabaja como cocinera. De su salario pretende pagar un crédito que solicita para hacer una pared en su casa, sus hijos de 17 y 20 años de edad, le apoyan en las quehaceres del hogar, y quiere que ellos habitan en una casa mas segura por lo que poco a poco empezando con esta pared quiere ir avanzando en mejorar su casa con sus créditos.

loans.use: Put up a wall in her bedroom

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Mrs. Mariluz V. is 45 years old, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, she is single, and has three adult sons.

Her source of work is a grocery store which she started 8 years ago and which has grown quite a bit. She will soon be able to turn it into a general store because she has prospered in her community due to her warm personality and hard work.

In spite of being a woman and alone, she has moved her sons ahead through her hard work. She is requesting a loan for working capital. She wants to supply her grocery store to attract more new customers and retain the exiting ones.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mariluz V. tiene 45 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores de edad.

Su fuente de trabajo es una Pulpería que con gran esfuerzo hace 8 años inició y ha crecido bastante, pronto podrá ser una Miscelánea ya que ha tenido prosperidad en su comunidad como resultado de su calidez humana y esfuerzo de trabajo duro.

Como mujer sola sacó adelante a sus hijos fruto de su duro trabajo. Solicita un crédito para capital de trabajo, quiere abastecer más su pulpería para atraer más clientela y retener a la que ya tiene

loans.use: Supply inventory for her store

loans.name: Leann

texts.en: Mrs. Leann S., 30, is a farmer who lives in Koh Kok Village, Kampong Cham Province. S. earns about $3.66 per day. Her husband, Mr. Um Narith, is a 35-year-old farmer who also makes about  $3.66 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young. With growing family expenses, they need to increase their income. They request a loan of $1,100 to purchase small pigs to raise and ducklings to lay eggs. By using this loan they will get more income and be able to support their family effectively.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs and ducklings

loans.name: Harun

texts.id:
Harun was making a living by selling fish, but now he changed to selling fried soybeans. He changed his profession because the income from selling fish were decreasing and too many competitors at that time so that Harun couldn't continue selling fish. Now Harun is running a business in selling fried soybeans. Although all of his children already got married, Harun still continues the business. Harun works together with his wife who helps him frying the soybeans. Harun delivers the fried soybeans to the kiosks of his customers. With the initial capital of Rp. 1,000,000, Harun could buy 200 kg of soybeans and he could finish selling them in a week. With limited capital, of course, he only earned limited profit which was only enough for his daily expenses. As now living expenses are increasing and the price of frying oil and fried beans is also increasing, his initial capital is no longer enough to buy the required materials. Fortunately, Dinari Foundation gave a loan to Harun so that he still can continue the business. Although the business is a little bit slump, he still can finish selling 200 kg of soybeans every week. He is sure he can still continue running the business as he expands his sales to Singaraja area. He is also sure he can get more profit so he can save some money to support his & his wife's life when they become elderly.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Harun yang dulunya seorang pedagang ikan beralih profesi menjadi pedagang Kacang Kedelai goreng. Ini dilakukan karena penghasilan ikan dilaut berkurang dan banyaknya pesaing dalam berjualan ikan sehingga Harun tidak mampu lagi untuk meneruskan usaha berjualan ikan. Kini Harun menekuni usaha Kedelai Goreng. Walaupun semua anaknya sudah pada menikah namun Harun tetap giat dalam menjalankan usaha ini. Bekerjasama dengan istrinya yang bertugas menggoreng Kedelai,sedangkan Harun bertugas untuk menyetor ke warung-warung langganannya. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.000.000,Harun dapat membeli 2 kwintal kacang kedelai dan ini akan habis dijual dalam satu minggu. Dengan modal yang sedikit tentu saja keuntungan yang diperoleh juga sedikit, dan itu hanya cukup untuk keperluan dapur saja.Apalagi sekarang biaya hidup semakin meningkat. Harga minyak goreng dan juga kedelai semakin tinggi sehingga modal awal yang di miliki oleh Harun tidak lagi mencukupi untuk pembelian barang dagangnnya. Untungnya Yayasan Dinari memberikan pinjaman modal kepada Harun,sehingga ia tetap bisa menjalankan usaha ini. Walaupun keadaan agak sepi namun ia tetap mampu menjual 2 kwintal itu dalam setiap minggu semua ini dipengaruhi oleh meningkatnya harga kedelai dan juga minyak goreng ,namun Harun tetap yakin usahanya akan berjalan terus,terbukti kini penjualan sudah dilakukan sampai kewilayah Singaraja. Dan ia yakin hasil yang didapat juga akan meningkat,sehingga Harun dapat menabung untuk kehidupan hari tuanya bersama istri.

loans.use: To add more capital for buying soybeans

loans.name: Johari

texts.id:
Johari is a responsible father to his family. Even in the tough economic situation, Johari can survive it because he has skill in building raft so he is now making use of this skill. Furthermore, currently quite many people need rafts so his business can go well. Johari started the business with the initial capital of Rp. 500,000, however, since the business has become bigger, it is not enough for buying the raw materials (bamboo). Moreover, the price of bamboo is increasing because of its high demand. When he can't buy bamboo, he orders raft from Jawa, then he modifies the size as requested by his customers in Bali. Fortunately, Dinari foundation is willing to give him a loan so that Johari can continue the business. This business is his only source of income, while his wife is a full-time housewife who doesn't earn money at all. A raft made of bamboo skin can be sold for Rp. 450,000, and a raft made of bamboo can be sold for Rp. 300,000. With the loan from Dinari, Johan hopes that his business can grow and he can earn more profit so that he can afford his children's education fee and his family's life expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Johari seorang bapak yang sangat bertanggung jawab terhadap kehidupan keluarganya. Dalam menghadapi situasi ekonomi seperti ini Johari tetap bisa bertahan karena ia memiliki ketrampilan dibidang menganyam bedeg,sehingga ketrampilan itu sekarang dikembangkan. Apalagi sekarang ini yang memerlukan bedek lumayan banyak sehingga usaha ini bisa dikembangkan terus. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.500.000 Johari menekuni usaha ini, namun sejalan dengan berkembangnya usaha ini dan banyak yang mulai mengenal hasil anyaman Johari maka modal awal tidak lagi mencukupi untuk membeli bahan baku yaitu bambu. Apalagi sekarang harga bambu mulai meningkat ,karena banyaknya yang mencari,sehingga kesempatan bagi pemilik bambu untuk bisa menaikan harga . Dan kalau tidak dapat membeli bambu maka Johari akan mendatangkan bedek yang sudah jadi dari Jawa,kemudian sampai di Bali bedeg tersebut disambung sesuai dengan ukuran yang diminta oleh si pemesan.Untungnya ada Yayasan Dinari yang memberikan pinjaman modal ,sehingga Johari bisa tetap meneruskan usaha ini. Karena usaha inilah satu-satunya matapencaharian bagi Johari dan keluarga,sedangkan istrinya tidak mempunyai pekerjaan yang bisa menunjang keuangan keluarga. Satu lembar bedeg yang terbuat dari kulit bambu bisa dijual seharga Rp.450.000, sedangkan kalau bedeg yang terbuat dari bambu bagian dalam hanya bisa terjual seharga Rp.300.000.
