Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Johari berharap usahanya dapat terus berjalan dan berkembang dan keuntungan yang diperoleh pun bisa meningkat sehingga anak-anaknya dapat bersekolah dan kehidupan keluarga dapat terjamin.

loans.use: To buy raw material (bamboo)

loans.name: Chhneang

texts.en: Mrs. Chhneang K. earns about $4 per day selling vegetables and raising pigs. Her husband, Mr. Khoeun Ran, 29, is a farmer who makes about $3 per day. They live with their three children in Kork Mon Village, Siem Reap Province. Their children are young and still in school. K. requests a loan of $1,100 to purchase tools for wine making and to buy a trailer. By using this loan K. can improve their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase tools for wine making and to buy a trailer

loans.name: Put

texts.en: Mrs. Put S. lives in Trapeang Prey Village, Siem Reap province. S. makes about $3.29 per day from duck and pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Heng Chong, is a 37-year-old building constructor and earns about $2.33 per day. They live with their three children, all of whom are in school. To pay for their children’s studies and support their family, they have to increase their income. They request a loan of $600 to purchase more ducks and small pigs to breed. This loan can increase their income and also support their children’s studies. (Photo is S.'s husband)

loans.use: To purchase more ducks and small pigs to breed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok S. is a 38-year-old farmer who lives in Tuol Chambork Village, Kampong Cham Province. She makes about $1.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Thal, is a 39-year-old who makes about $2 per day. They have been farming for twenty-eight years. S. and Thal have three children, all of whom are young. S. requests a loan of $100 to purchase used goods to resell. This loan will help to add capital for their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase used goods to resell

loans.name: Hib

texts.en: Mrs. Hib L. makes about $4.50 per day selling clothes at the market. L. has been selling for eleven years. Her husband, Mr. Tan Than, is a 55-year-old who makes $3.30 per day sewing clothes. L. and Than live with one child in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province. L. and Than are requesting a loan of $ 1,100 to purchase more clothes to sell. By using this loan L. can improve her business and increase her famiL.’s income.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Mrs. Tep S. sells groceries, earning about $3 per day. Her husband, Mr. Keo Mana, is a 26-year-old motorcycle taxi driver who earns $2 per day. They live with their one child in Chy Kreng District, Siem Reap Province. S. requests a loan of $200 to purchase grocery stock. This loan will help to expand their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stock

loans.name: Buri

texts.ru:
Buri T. lives in the Shahrinav region. He is 54 years old, married and has five children. He is in the animal husbandry business and has a small cow house where he breeds several calves. He needs a loan to buy more calves of a better pedigree. It's necessary in order to get a pedigree offspring. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошев Бури проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 54 года. Женат , имеет 5 детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Где разводится несколько бычков. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить бычка хорошей породы. Это необходимо для получения породистого потомства. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Masturahon

texts.ru:
Masturahon A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education and is in the animal husbandry business. She breeds calves for resale. She buys young calves, feeds them and then resells at a more profitable price. She has been in this business for four years. Masturahon wants to buy two more calves and for this she needs $450US. She needs a loan which she will pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Атабаева Мастурахон проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 32 года,замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых телят , откармливает и продает на базаре по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 4 года. Хочет купить еще двух теля . на покупку которых необходимо 450 долларов США . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит , а погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Muborak J. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 45 years old, married with no children. She buys and sells cattle. She buys calves in the town of Sahrituze and resells at her local market. She has been in this business for ten years. Her husband is also helping her. Muborak wants to increase her commodity circulation by receiving a loan. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джалилова Муборак проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 45 лет, замужем , детей не имеет.Занимается купле продажей крупно- рогатого скота .Покупает бычков в горде Шахритузе и перепродает у себя на базаре. Занимаентся этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Но занимается этим не одна , ей помогает муж. Сейчас хочет увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Mohsharif

texts.ru:
Mohsharif B. lives in the town of Vahdat. Shs is 56 years old, married and has five children. She is in the business of making milk products such as cottage cheese, sour cream and heavy cream. She has been in this business for the past ten years. The business has let her make good income and also supply the residents with organic products. Because the equipment is old and wears out quickly, Mohsharif needs to buy one new and one extra separator. She needs to get a loan and will pay it off within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Буриева Мохшариф проживает в городе Вахдат.Замужем , имеет 5 детей. Ей 56 лет .Занимается производством кисло-молочных продуктов.Таких как творог , сметана и сливки.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. Ее деятельность помогает ей получать неплохой доход , а так же обеспечить население ее района экологически чистыми продуктами.Но техника быстро изнашивается и поэтому ей необходимо обновить сепаратор и купить запасной. Для этого она планирует получить кредит. Который сможет погасить в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a separator

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mr. Phal P. is a 49-year-old fisherman who makes about $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Phin Thon, is a vegetable seller who makes about $3 per day. They live with their three children in Chykreng District, Siem Reap Province. One of their children is married, one is a construction worker, and another sells groceries. They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy more grocery stock and purchase a motorcycle to transport vegetables to sell at the market. This loan will help to expand their business and increase family income. (Photo is P.'s wife)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and buy more grocery stock

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru:
Nozigul S. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old, married and has seven children. When she had finished school she started her own business. She sells children's clothing and has been in this business for the past 16 years. At this time, this business is the only source of income for the family. Nozigul plans to increase her commodity circulation by getting a loan. It will help her purchase additional inventory. She plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шерова Нозигуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Ей 46 лет, она замужем и имеет 7 детей. Закончила школу после чего началоа свой бизнес. Торгует детской одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже около 16 лет. Сейчас этот бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Планирует увеличить товарооборот, путем получения кредита. Это поможет ей закупить новый ассортимент товара, что увеличит товарооборот. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течегнии 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat R. lives in the town of Vahdat. She is 46 years old. Her husband has passed away and she is left with five children. She is a housewife and also sells milk. She has a milking cow which brings about 10 liters of milk. She also buys milk from the neighbors at a lower price and then takes to Dushanbe where she resells it wholesale. Mamkalat wants to buy another milk cow which will bring another 10 liters. It will help increase her income which the family needs so much. For this she needs a loan and with pay it off within 12 months. In spite of the harsh conditions, she is very happy and does not lose hope.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Мамлакат жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 46 лет . Муж умер и у нее осталось 5 детей. Домохозяйка, занимается продажей молока. Имеет корову, которая дает около 10 литров молока, а так же скупает у соседей по более низкой цене и вывозит молоко в город Душанбе. Продаетоптом и возвращается домой. Сейчас хочет купить еще одну корову . которая даст возможность получать дополнительные 10 литров. Это поможет ей увеличить доход, который необходим для семьи. Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит, а погасить его она сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Не смотря на тяжелые условия , она очень жизнерадостна и никогда не унывает.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mayram

texts.ru:
Mayram M. lives in Vahdat. She is 47 years old. Mayram is married with 4 children. She has a community college degree, she is a qualified child care worker. However, she does not work in this area as its pays very little. Her own children are still young, they are in middle school. So for the last 12 years Mayram has been selling groceries. She has a stall at the local Vahdat market. Locals know that she always has fresh items. She would like to expand her inventory by adding new items. This is why she needs the loan. By expanding her business Mayram will improve the quality of life of her family. She plans to repay the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Мадрахимова Майрам Урунбаевна жительница города Вахдат . Ей 47 лет. Майрам замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-техническое,по специальности воспитательница . Но по специальности Майрам не работает, так как заработная плата очень маленькая . Прожить на такие деньги очень трудно.Дети Майрам маленькие,они посещают среднюю школу. Поэтому более 12 лет клиентка занимается куплей продажей продуктов питания. Майрам имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Вахдат. Местные жители знают,что у нее всегда можно приобрести только свежую продукцию .Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки , для чего ей и нужны деньги. Майрам решила взять кредит. Тем самым расширить свой бизнес , улучшить качество жизни своей семьи .Планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Add new items to the inventory

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang K. is a 46-year-old farmer who makes about $2 per day. Her husband makes about $1 per day making palm sugar. They live in Boeung Ghort village, Siem Reap province, and have six children, two of whom are married and three of whom are young. K. requests a loan of $250 to purchase rice stock to resell. This loan will help improve their business and increase family income.

loans.use: To purchase rice stock to resell

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan H. is 32 years old and runs two business with her husband. Their goal is to raise their family's standard of living. She is farmer, and earns less than $1 a day growing a variety of vegetables on a small plot of land. Her husband, Teth Sophea, 36, is a security guard in the Tom Bea district of Kampong Cham province and earns about $2.50 a day. They have two children, both of whom are students.

This couple wants to better support their family by starting another business which would buy yams in bulk and resell them at a local market. By doing this, they believe they can increase their family's income and be able to continue sending their children to school in the future. (Teth Sophea is pictured here because Mrs. Kan H. was not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S. is 49 years old and has lived in Kampong Cham province for her entire life. She and her husband have three children and work very hard to support their family. She owns a plot of land on which she has grown vegetables for the last ten years. She earns about $5 a day. Her husband, Sreng Nghel, is 58 years old and makes about $2 a day as a security guard.

All of their children work in garment factories, where they each earn $50 a month. Recently, one of her sons left his job to begin training to become a mechanic. Mrs. Bou S. is requesting a loan to pay for this son's training, as well as to buy the seeds and fertilizer she needs to grow more crops. By doing this, she will generate more income for her entire family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds, and pay a training fee for her son.

loans.name: Princh

texts.en:
Princh S. is 27 years old, has two children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes about $1 a day growing and selling vegetables in a busy local market. Her husband, Mr. Hout Yoeun, is a 27-year-old construction worker who makes about $4 a day.

This couple has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a cow that will have offspring which they can raise and sell. They will use the remainder of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers, which they will use to grow more crops.

loans.use: To buy a cow, fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run R. earns about $7.33 per day purchasing rice to resell. R. is a 40-year-old widow and lives with her two childR. in Run Choeung village, Siem Reap province. She requests a loan of $1,200 to purchase rice to resell. The remainder of the loan will be used to purchase small pigs. This investment will increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Khuth

texts.en:
Khuth S. is 43 years old and has lived in Kampong Cham province with her two children for many years. She earns about $5 a day running a vegetable store in a busy market in her town. Her husband, Chom Sarong, is 39 years old and makes a living growing lotus rhizome, which is used in Cambodia both as a food and a medicine. He makes about $7 a day selling this crop to people who come to his house to buy it.

Khuth S. has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy wood to repair her leaking house. Her goal is to have a stable home which is dry during the long rainy season. (Her husband is pictured because she was not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair her leaking house.

loans.name: Tchotcho Anastasie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Tchotcho Anastasie A. was born on March 13, 1969 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Parfait Paraiso who is a bicycle mechanic. She sells cooked food and locally produced clothing in the Agoè neighborhood. In the mornings, she sells cooked rice and in the afternoons she displays tailor-made clothing.

Having increased her working capital thanks to her first loan of US$ 500, which she reimbursed in a timely manner, she was able to improve her profits while satisfying the needs of her clientele, mainly made up of tailors.

She expects this loan in the amount of US$ 725 to allow her to better serve her clients by purchasing 15 bolts of poplin and acquiring a machine for overcasting seams with a view to improving her sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Tchotcho Anastasie est née le 13 mars 1969 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur PARAISO Parfait qui est un mécanicien à deux roues. Elle est restauratrice et revendeuse d’articles de couture dans le quartier d’Agoè. Dans la matinée, elle fait la restauration de riz et expose les articles de couture dans l’après midi.

Ayant augmenté son fonds de roulement à travers son premier crédit de 200.000FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé, elle a amélioré son bénéfice en satisfaisant les besoins de sa clientèle constituée majoritairement des tailleurs.

Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA devait lui permettre de mieux servir ses clients à travers l’achat quinze (15) rouleaux de popeline et l’acquisition d’une machine à surfilage en vue d’améliorer ses ventes.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 bolts of poplin and a machine for overcasting seams

Achat de 15 rouleaux de popeline et acquisition d'une machine à surfilage

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 37 year old man. He works and lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. He suffers from a physical disability. Ali records music and songs. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy material to sustain and develop his business. The increased income generated from the credit will be used to help him continue to build his house.

loans.use: to buy material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Abra Enyonam

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1957 in Agomé Tomégbé in the prefecture of Kloto, Mrs. Abra Enyonam M. is married and the mother of three children. She retails vegetables and charcoal in the Agbalépédo neighborhood in Lomé. She buys her vegetables from market gardeners and sells them to restaurants and neighborhood households.

This first loan of US$ 500 will permit her to purchase 15 bags of charcoal. With the income from her business, she helps out with her family's expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 31 décembre 1957 à Agomé Tomégbé dans la préfecture de Kloto, madame M. Abra Enyonam est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes et de charbon dans le quartier Agbalépédo à Lomé. Elle achète ses légumes auprès des jardiniers et les revend aux restaurants et aux ménages du quartier.

Le premier crédit d’un montant de 200.000 FCFA lui permettra de faire le stock par l’achat de quinze (15) sacs de charbon de bois. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle participe aussi aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 15 sacs de charbon

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay S. is 39 years old and the mother of six children,. She and her husband have lived in Kampong Cham province for many years. She is an entrepreneur who supports her family by running two businesses with her husband. Everyday she goes from door to door in her village, earning about $3 a day selling rice. Her husband raises chickens and sells them at the local market, making about $4 a day. Two of their children are married and live away from home. One has a small business selling sugar cane juice in front of their house. On average, this child makes less than $1 per day. The rest of the children are students.

Lay S. has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy more rice to sell, and will use the balance of the funds to buy chickens and ducks to breed. By doing this, she believes that she can earn much more money and provide her children with an education. (Husband is pictured here because his wife is not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell, and chickens and ducks to breed.

loans.name: Atef

texts.en: Atef is a 60 year old man with 2 children. He lives in southern Lebanon, in Tyre, selling clothing. This is the second time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to buy merchandise and do maintenance work on his business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, and do maintenance work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hachem

texts.en: Hachem is 21 years old. He works and lvies in Southern Lebanon, located in Tyre. Hachem owns a small computer and internet service shop. This is his first loan, and he would like to use the money to purchase and support his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Fotima K. lives in Vahdat. She is 36 years old, married with 1 child. She has a community college degree. She does not have job but sells perfume and other small household goods. She has a small shop at the market in Vahdat. The business makes some profit but it is not sufficient to cover the family needs. Fotima has thus decided to add new products to her inventory, which will help increase sales and profits. She really needs the loan to succeed. She plans to repay it in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Кайнарова Фотима проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 36 лет, замужем и имеет 1ребенка. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает. Но занимается торговлей парфюмерией и другими промышленными товарами. Имеет небольшой магазин на рынке города Вахдат.Получает неплохой доход ,но все равно ей не хватает на жизнь. Поэтому она решила увеличить ассртимент товара, что поможет ей увеличить объем продаж и увеличить доход.Ей необходимо получить кредит , который поможет ей добится успеха. А погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To add new products to inventory

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 36 years old. He has 4 children. He works and lives with his family in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud is in the construction business. He wants to buy materiA. to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Oussama

texts.en: Oussama is 31 years old. He has 2 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Oussama owns a falafel restaurant. This is the first time he has applied for a loan through kiva. He wants to buy cooking equipment for his business.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Shahlo H. lives in Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She has a community college degree. She does not have a job. She helps her husband provide for the family by selling milk. Shahlo has steady clients from whom she buys milk at low prices and then travels out of the area to re-sell it. This is a profitable business. Shahlo has her own cow, but the cow does not give any milk. If she had a milk cow, her profits would nearly double and she would also be able to lower her prices. This would make the milk she sells more affordable for the local people. This is why she is seeking a loan of $1025 to buy a good dairy cow. She plans to repay her loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Хабибуллоева шахло проживает в городе Вахдат . Замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Нигде не работает. Но не смотря на это помогает мужу обеспечивать семью. Занимается торговлей молока. Имеет клиентов у которых скупает молоко по низким ценам и вывозит за приделы района. Продает оптом , а затем возвращается домой. Этот бизнес приносит доход.У нее есть корова , но она не дает молока. Но если бы у нее была корова, которая давала бы молоко, то ее доход увеличился бы почти в два раза, и кроме того цены на продаваемое ею молока были бы ниже. Это позволило бы населению покупать молоко по более низким и доступным ценам. Поэтому Шахло решила обратится к нам за кредитом . Ей нужна сумма в размере 1025 долларов США, на которые она сможет купить хорошую дойную корову. А погасить кредит планируетв течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 46 years old. He has 4 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Hussein is in the agriculture business. This is the first time he has applie for a loan at Al Majmoua. He wants to prepare his land and buy fertilizers for his business.

loans.use: to prepare a land and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is 38 years old woman who works and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, where she owns a bakery. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She wants to do some maintenance work on her buiding:  to fix the roof and develop her business.

loans.use: to fix the roof

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en: Adnan is 26 years old.  He has 1 child.  He works and lives with his family in Tyre, Southern Lebanon.  Adnan is a mechanic. This is the first time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua.  He plans to use the loan to buy materials for his business.  He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to buy material

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Simwana's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Simwana is 33 years old and is married with two children, ages 18 and 14. She and her husband also take care of two other children, who are 14 and 18 years old as well. Simwana is a fish seller. She started her business in 2003. She works from 5am to 10pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Queenrose and Asia, who have businesses dealing in clothes (khanga) and bites sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long N., age 34, is married and has four children. She stays at home during the day, looking after her children and cooking food for the entire family. After the housework is done, she earns about $1 a day raising pigs. Her husband works in construction, earning about $3 a day building houses. Two of their children are students, and two others are too young to attend the school.

To make more money to support her family, she has applied for a loan to buy piglets, which she will breed and sell when they are grown up.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Mariam's Tuamke Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 31 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are ages 14, 12 and 9. Mariam owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Samila, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 27 years old and lives in Southern Lebanon, located in Tyre. Fatima owns a small market, where she sells a variety of goods. Fatima would like to apply for a loan to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 31 years old. She has 3 children. She works selling livestock and lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon.  She wants to buy a cow to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nuru's Heri Group

texts.en:
Nuru is is 28 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 9. Nuru sells food items in the market. She started her business in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales and market sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (potatoes, rice, tomatoes) for her business.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Mr. F. is 53 years old. He has 5 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Youssef sells livestock. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through kiva. He wants to buy a cow to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is 31 years old.  He has 2 children.  He works and lives with his family in Tyre, Southern Lebanon.  Rabih is a blacksmith. This is the first time he has applied for a loan through Al Majmoua. He plans to use this loan to buy equipment to keep his business going.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Yul

texts.en:
Yul L., age 48, is a widow who lives with her children in Kampong Cham province, where she was born. She earns about $1 a day growing rice on a plot of land she owns. She has three children, one of whom is married and lives away from home. Her second child is a blacksmith who earns about $3 a day, and the youngest is a garment factory worker who makes $2 a day.

Because the blacksmith business is growing fast, Mrs. Yul Lay has applied for a loan to buy more tools. This will allow her child to make more money and provide additional support to the family.

loans.use: To buy more tools.

loans.name: Sada's Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Sada is 32 years old and is married with 3 children. Her children are 13, 9 and 7 years old. Sada is a charcoal seller. She started her business in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwanahawa, who has a business dealing in market sales

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. Her children are 25, 23, 18 and 16 years old. Fatuma owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2004. Everyday, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items (chairs, tables, milk, sugar) for her restaurant

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng Y., age 54, has eight children and lives in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband make a living as farmers, and each earns about $1 a day . Four of their children are married and live away from home, while two are factory workers who earn about $2.50 each per day. The remaining two stay at home and help their parents farm.

Heng Y. has applied for a loan from Kiva to dig a pond in which she will raise fish. She will use the balance of the loan to buy wood to build a stable house for her children. (picture: wife and husband)

loans.use: To dig a pond to raise fish and build a house for her children.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 44 years old and is a single woman. Mwajuma owns a small beauty salon and she is a clothes seller as well. She started her businesses in 2001. Everyday, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mwajuma has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her salon and more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more items such as weaves and hair treatments for her salon and to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Nyota Ndogo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 30 years old and is a single woman. Mwanaidi is a timber seller. She started her business in 2000. She works from 6am to 6pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Mwanaidi has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more timber for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Enesia, who also has a business dealing in timber sales.

loans.use: To buy more timber for her business.

loans.name: Freedom 2030-2 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace Ewdard. She is currently in the business of selling to the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Grace is 42 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 8 children ranging from age 18 to 30 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately 500 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Grace is joined in her small group by Elias U., Awadia S., Ajelina K., and Ludia S.. Elias U. has a business in selling breads and wants to expand the business. Awadia S. is currently operating a business in selling breads and wants a loan for building . Ajelina K. operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Ludia S. is currently in the business of selling beer and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Meth K. is a 60-year-old widow with five children who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and makes about $1 a day. One of her children is married and lives away from home, two have opened a small shop Phnom Penh city where they earn about $5 a day selling food, and two others are farmers.

The business in Phnom Penh city is doing very well, which is why Meth K. has applied to Kiva for a loan to buy more chairs, tables and other supplies. This will allow the family to expand the business and earn more income.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more chairs, tables and other supplies.

loans.name: Doto

texts.en:
Doto is 37 years old and is married with 2 children. Her children are 20 and 16 years old. Doto is a clothes (batik) seller. She started her business in 2002. She works from 6am to 9pm at her business each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (batik) for her business

loans.name: Veronica's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Veronica is 37 years old and is married with two children. Her children are 15 and 10 years old. Veronica sells food in her local market. She started her business in 2002. She works from 6am to 7pm each day. She can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Veronica has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Jamila, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, flour, maize, beans, peas) for her business

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 42 years old and is married with one child (who is 24 years old). Khadija is a fish whosaler. She started her business in 1998. She works from 6am to 6pm at her business every day. She earns a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Khadija has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Zainabu's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 41 years old and is married with two children, ages 21 and 17. Zainabu owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2000. She works there from 6am to 7pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $225.

In the past, Zainabu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items such as wigs, weaving and hair treatment for her salon. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, Fatuma and Rehema, who have restaurant and bar businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items such as wigs, weaving and hair treatment for her salon.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is 46 years old and is a single woman with two children, ages 16 and 13. She also takes care of one other person, aged 75.

Debora owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items such as weaving and hair treatment for her salon.

loans.use: To buy more items for her salon.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 32 years old and is married with two children, ages 8 and 5. Violet is a clothes and soft drinks seller, a business she started in 2005. She works from 8am to 8pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been a charcoal seller since 2007. She works from 9.30am to 7.30pm at her business each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Siri

texts.en:
Siri is single woman who owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm in the salon and she can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items such as hair conditioner and weaving for her salon.

loans.name: Siri

texts.en:
Siri is a single woman who owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm in her salon and she can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy items such as hair conditioner and weavings for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her salon.

loans.name: Massah

texts.fr:
Madame Massah E. is 41 years old, married and the mother of 5. In Ewe, the name Massah means she is the third girl of the family (if she had been the third son, she would be named Mensah). She and her large family live in the town of Adéta, located about 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To be able to feed, clothe and pay for school expenses of her children, Massah sells food along the road going to Adéta. She specializes in Akpan, a traditional and refreshing food made from cornmeal that one must wet and mix with ice and sugar. This is Massah's first loan and she awaits the opportunity to purchase more corn and sugar to continue to make iced Akpan. She would also like to purchase flour and bread with this loan so as to diversify her production and to attract more customers. This will allow her to respond to the needs of her family and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Madame Massah E. est agée de 41 ans, mariée de 5 enfants. En Ewe, le nom Massah indique qu’elle est la troisième fille de sa famille (si elle était le troisième fils, il s’appelerait Mensah) Elle et sa grande famille habitent dans la ville d’Adéta, une ville situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomè, la capitale du Togo. Pour provisionner la nourriture, les vêtements et les frais scolaires pour tous ses enfants, Massah prépare et vend la nourriture au bord d’une route occupé d’Adéta. Elle est spécialisée en Akpan Glacé, un repas traditionnel et rafraîchissant (voir la photo) de la farine du maïs qui devient molle et mélangée avec de la glace et du sucre. Ce crédit est la première pour Massah et elle attend l’opportunité d’acheter plus du maïs et du sucre pour la préparation d’Akpan Glacé. Aussi, elle désire avec ce crédit d’acheter du blé et du pain pour diversifier son produit et d’attirer plus de clients. Ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de sa famille et d’augmenter la qualité de leur vie.

loans.use: To purchase more corn and sugar to make iced Akpan.

loans.name: Groupement Noviwowo

texts.fr:
The group Noviwowo is an enterprise made up of four gentlemen in the town of Adéta, Togo, a town located about 150 kilometeres from the capital. The head of the group is Mr. Atsou A., who is 20 years old, single and who sits in the second position from the left in the photo. The other members are Mr. Ayao A., who is 26 years old and single, Mr. Koffi O. who is 30 years old and single and Mr. Innocent K. who is 28 years old and married. These diligent men make furniture, chairs and beds from woods such as teak and sell them in town. A job in the wood and furniture industry is a good one to have in Togo and the group Noviwowo has been a part of this artisan community for 3 years. They are entrepreneurs, responsible and conscientious of their customer's needs. They have already benefited from two previous loans and which they have paid back on a regular basis. They are asking for a third loan to purchase more planks, rafters, saws and hammers so that they can continue with their work. With these purchases, they will be able to produce more furniture of high quality for their community and they will use the profits to meet the needs of their respective families.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Groupement Noviwowo est une entreprise des menuisiers créée par 4 hommes d’Adéta, Togo, une ville situé à environ 150 kilomètres de la capitale. Le chef du groupe est Monsieur Atsou A., âgé de 20 ans, célibataire et qui est situé en deuxième position à partir de la gauche de l’image. Les autres membres sont: Monsieur Ayao A., agé de 26 ans et célibataire, Monsieur Koffi O., âgé de 30 ans et célibataire, et Monsieur Innocent K., âgé de 28 ans et marié. Ces hommes diligents fabriquent des meubles, chaises et lits par exemples, à partir des bois locaux comme le tek, et les revendent en ville. L’exploitation du bois et la fabrication des meubles en bois est un vrai métier ici au Togo, et le Groupement Noviwowo était parti de la communauté artisane pour plus de 3 ans. Ils sont les entrepreneurs responsables et consciencieux clients, puisqu’ils ont déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Ils demandent ce troisième crédit pour acheter les planches, chevrons, pointes, scie et marteaux pour continuer leur travail. Avec ces achats, ils peuvent produire les meubles en bois de haute qualité pour leur communauté et ils peuvent utiliser les profits pour répondre aux besoins de leur famille respective.

loans.use: To purchase planks, rafter, saws, and hammers.

loans.name: Odil

texts.ru:
Odil H. lives in Yavan. He is married with five children and has a happy family. He is 45 years old. He has no higher education. Odil earns his money by buying and re-selling calves. He buys young calves, feeds them to fatten them up and then sells them. The profits from this business are not bad and they help provide for his family. Right now Odil is looking to expand the business and to buy more calves to make a larger profit. The loan would help him expand and thus also help his large family. He plans to repay his loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Халимов Одил житель города Яван. Женат и имеет пятерых детей. Ему 45 лет. Образования не имеет , но зарабатывает купле-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Привозит молодых бычков , откармливает и перепродает. Этот бизнес дает неплохой доход , который позволяет кормить семью.Сейчас он хочет увеличить товарооборот , который даст возможность заработать больше. Кредит сможет помочь ему и его большой и дружной семье. Погасить кредит одил сможет в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy  more calves

loans.name: Honimoy

texts.ru:
Honimoy B. lives in Yavan. She is 48 years old, married with six children and is a housewife. She also keeps and raises a few calves for sale. In addition to the calves Honimoy would like to buy a dairy cow to provide fresh milk for her family and to sell whatever is extra. This would help her earn some money. She is hoping to borrow $1025 to buy a cow and she plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Бадалова Хонимой Проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 48 лет. Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка. Имеет небольшое хозяйство, где разводит бычков. Но Хонимой хочет купить дойную корову для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью свежим молоком , а если будет лишнее сможет продавать его и зарабатывать этим деньги.Но для этого ей необходимо получить кредит в размере 1025 долларов США. Погасить кредит клиентка сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Hidaya's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Hidaya is 32 years old and is married with two children, ages 12 and 6. Hidaya owns a small stationary business, which she opened in 2000. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more stationary items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Mariam, who is a painter.

loans.use: To buy more stationary items such as books, ruler, paper and cards for her business.

loans.name: Gulboy

texts.ru:
Gulboy K. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 61 years old, is married and has 4 children. He has use of land on which he raises cattle. He purchases young calves, sheep and goats, raises them and resells them on the market. His business helps the general development of cattle raising in the region and supplies local markets with fresh meat. Gulboy is currently planing to increase turnover and wishes to obtain a loan for this purpose. He plans to repay the loan within a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Карахочаев Гулбой проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 61 год , женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Покупает бычков, овец и коз, откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Его бизнес помогает развитию животноводческого сектора и обеспечивает рынки мясом. На данный момент Гулбой планирует увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Это поможет получать больший доход. Который необходим его семье.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 28 years old and is married with one child, age 10. Asha has been selling bed sheets since 2004. She works from 7am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets for her business.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 38 years old and is a married woman with three children, ages 12, 8 and 4. She and her husband also take care of two other people, ages 50 and 62 years old.

Zaituni sells clothes and carpets, a business she started in 2001. She works from 7am to 10pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Zaituni has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and carpets to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and carpets for her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 41 years old and has four children, ages 20, 18, 17 and 9. She and her husband also take care of three other people, ages 50, 7 and 5 years old.

Hamida is a brickmaker and seller, she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her brickmaking and can earn a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

In the past, Hamida has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more cement, sand and other equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cement, sand and other equipment for her brickmaking business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and is a single woman. Mary is a fish seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 5am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

Mary now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 37 years old. She is married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. She and her husband also take care of another child, age five.

Mariam is a charcoal and food seller, a business she started in 2000. She works from 6am to 9pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $47 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is 26 years old and is single woman with one child, age three. Zaituni is a tailor and she also sells decorative items. She started her business in 2004. She works from 6am to 8pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Zaituni has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items, including needles, cloth, lotion, rings, cream and necklaces for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring and decorative items for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old and is a single woman. Mariam is a clothes seller, a business she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 7pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

Mariam has taken out a previous successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Šemsa

texts.en: Šemsa is 54 years old and lives in Begov Han, a small community near the town Žepče. She is married and her husband has a full-time job in which he earns about $600 a month. Šemsa helps support her family by farming, and has applied for a loan to buy seeds to plant. The crop she plans to produce will ensure that her family has healthy vegetables to eat.

loans.use: To buy seed for her farm.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 18 years old and is a single woman. Mariam started selling clothes in 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Behka

texts.en: Behka was born in 1972 and lives with her husband in Lukavica, a small village near the town of Živinice. Her husband is a self-employed mechanic who paints cars for a living. They earn a little more than $1,000 a month. Behka contributes to the family's income by raising and selling poultry. This is her first loan from MCO WWI, and she plans to use it to buy a cow and feed for it to eat.  She plans to raise her family's income by selling the cow's milk.

loans.use: To buy a cow and feed for it to eat.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 30 years old and is married woman with two children, ages 10 and 6. Rehema owns a small telephone shop, which she started in 2006. She works from 7am to 10pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Rehema has taken out a previous successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more telephone parts.

loans.use: To buy more telephone parts for her phone shop.

loans.name: Džemila

texts.en: Džemila lives in Lukavica, a small village near the town Živinice. She is married and her husband has a full-time job as a driver for a local company. His salary is about $300 a month. They earn another $300 a month by selling milk to a local dairy. Dzemila has applied for her second loan from MCO WWI, and plans to use this loan to buy another cow for her farm and thereby increase her family's monthly income.

loans.use: To increase her family's income by buying another cow.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Zene za Zene, a partner of Women for Women International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 38 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 16,12 and 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, 3 months. Ester is clothes (khanga) seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloths (khanga) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) for her business.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 36 years old and is a widow woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. Arafa owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items such as hair treatment, hair conditioner and other equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 27 years old and is a single woman. Salome started selling clothes in 2006. She works from 9am to 10pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

In the past, Salome has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 40 years old and is married with five children, ages 7 to 20. Rehema is a clothes and cosmetics seller. She began this business in 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

In the past, Rehema has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is thirty-two years old and a mother of three children. She is a member of Eagle Women Group (a system through which a group of women co-guarantee to obtain a loan). Through the loan, she started a grocery store six months ago where she sells products like oats and other cereals, hair food, liquid soaps, margarine, toiletries, etc. 
Ama is very happy now because she has a livelihood. She will use her next loan to buy more items wholesale to avoid price hikes and to increase the number of customers she can satisfy.

loans.use: To buy  of cereals, toiletries, cartons of liquid soap, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Sawula

texts.en:
Sawula S. is forty-eight years old and a married woman with four children. All of her children are currently in school. She prepares and sells rice with stew for a large number of customers. She also buys and sells dry maize in bulk to canteen operators. Through the loan, Sawula has been able to finance her first two children to high school. She wants to use the new loan to buy more bags of rice and maize wholesale, which will help her avoid constant price increases which reduces her profit.
Sawula is a member of the group called Eagle. Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and maize

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44802

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice N. is forty years old and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school. She prepares pastries which she sells to school children.  Through this business, she has been able to send two out of the four children to school. She wants to use the new loan to buy more flour and oil to expand her operation so she can sell to more school children. She is a member of the group called Eagle. Eagle members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of pastry flour and gallons of vegetable oil

loans.name: Olipa

texts.en: Olipa B. M. is a mother of five. She lives in the Mburahati area of Dar Es Salaam. She runs a charcoal store in the area, a business she has been doing for the past six years. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her store and increase business.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business

loans.name: Jafari

texts.en: Jafari S. is thirty-five years old, a father of two, and a resident of Mbagala. He has been in business for the past six years. Jafari owns a welding and fabrication workshop. He welds door and window frames and other special items. He also runs a grocery store. He is in need of a loan to help expand him both his businesses.

loans.use: To expand his welding shop and grocery store

loans.name: Ayeshetu

texts.en:
Ayeshetu A. is thirty-seven years old and a single parent of three children. She works very hard to provide for her children's needs. Through the loan, Ayeshetu was able to open small clothing and earring shop. She buys her products from Togo. She wants to buy more variety of cloths and earrings with the new loan so her stock will attract more customers. Her income will help educate her children.
Ayeshetu is a member of the group called Eagle. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes and earrings in larger, wholesale amounts

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 44806

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce operates a clothing and cosmetics shop in Kariakoo, Dar Es Salaam’s busiest trading area. She specializes in clothing for ladies and kids. She will use her loan to grow her business by investing in more inventory with a greater variety of items.

loans.use: To purchase more stock and grow her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es:
Mr. Nicasio G. Amaro lives in a rented home in San Juan Cotahuma on the western side of La Paz with his wife and three children. Nacasio is employed by a laundry business in this city and his wife is a cook selling meals in a food stand. With previous loans Nicasio built a home on land he owns. The current loan will be used to finish the construction so his family will be able to move in to their new home. This is the third loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably to access this line of credit. Nicasio has been a client of Impro since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Nicasio G. Amaro vive en alquiler en la zona de San Juan Cotahuma ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y tres hijos. El señor Nicasio es empleado en una empresa de lavandería de esta ciudad y su esposa es cocinera vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto de comida. Con anteriores créditos el señor Nicasio construyó una vivienda en el terreno de su propiedad. El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado de la construcción, para que así su familia se traslade a su vivienda propia. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Nicasio es cliente nuestro desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Finish building a home in order to be able to live in it.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Mr. Julián M. M. lives in his own home in the Fabril area of El Alto city with his wife, Mrs. Pabla Surco, and their daughter. Julián works as a public transportation driver and his wife is employed as a domestic employee in the city of La Paz. The loan he seeks will be used to demolish an old home made of adobe which because of its age is in danger of collapsing, and then construct a new home of brick in the same location. This is the sixth loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably to access this line of credit. Julián has been a client of Impro since 2000.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Julián M. M. vive en casa propia, en la zona Fabril de la Ciudad de El Alto, con su esposa, la señora Pabla Surco y su hija. El señor Julián trabaja como chofer de transporte publico y su esposa es empleada en un domicilio particular de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de una habitación de adobe que por su antigüedad corre el riesgo de caer, para luego construir en el mismo lugar una habitación de ladrillo. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Julián es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.

loans.use: Demolish an old home made of adobe and construct a new home of brick.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa Fernández Paco and her two children rent a home from her brother-in-law in the Fabril area of El Alto city. Teresa has a neighborhood store in this residence also. The loan will be used to construct walls around a recently purchased piece of land. This is the third time that she is seeking a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably for this line of credit. The previous loans were channeled through Kiva and have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Teresa Fernández Paco vive en casa en alquiler, de propiedad del esposo de su hermana, en la zona Fabril de la Ciudad de El Alto, con sus dos hijos. La señora Teresa tiene una tienda de barrio en su mismo domicilio. El crédito solicitado será destinado al amurallado de un terreno que adquirió recientemente. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. El crédito anterior fue canalizado a través de Kiva y ha sido pagado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construct walls around recently purchased land.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Mr. Roberto Q. Huchani lives in his own home in the area of Pasankeri on the west side of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Matilda Huchani, and their six children. Roberto is a policeman and his wife is a housewife. The loan will be used to build a retaining wall in order to level his property to the level of the street for access. This is the first time that Roberto has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably to access this line of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Roberto Q. Huchani vive en casa propia, en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz. con su esposa la señora Matilda Huchani y sus seis hijo. El señor Roberto es policía y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un muro de contención ya que debe nivelar su propiedad a la vía de acceso. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a retaining wall to level his property to the street level for access.

loans.name: Carola

texts.es:
Carola S. Cori lives as a caretaker of a home in the San Pedro area of La Paz, with her two year old daughter. Carola is employed as a flower shop delivery person in La Paz. The loan she seeks will be used to pay the security deposit for a home in the same area of the city, as the house which she is taking care of is going to be demolished. This is the first time she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies her favorably to access this line of credit. In addition she needs this assistance in order to be able to live in a safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carola S. Cori vive como cuidadora de una vivienda en la zona de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz, con su hija de dos años. La señora Carola es empleada mensajera en una florería de esta ciudad. El crédito solicitado será destinado al pago de un anticretico (una Habitación) en la misma zona, ya que la casa que cuida actualmente será demolida. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito, además de que ella necesita esta ayuda para poder vivir en un lugar seguro. .

loans.use: Pay the security deposit in order to rent a home

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma sells perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry in offices, markets, and stores. She leaves her merchandise on credit and collects daily, weekly, biweekly and monthly in some cases. Her home is located in the Alto San Pedro area in the western part of La Paz. This is the second time that she seeks a loan from Impro, her history qualifies her as an “1 Client”, meaning she has repaid her previous loan in good standing. The loan will be used to buy perfume, cosmetics, and jewelry and will be able to stock up on merchandise for Mother’s Day as that holiday is approaching (it is May 27 here in Bolivia). Her work and experience permits her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Norma vende perfumes, cosméticos y joyas en las oficinas, mercados y tiendas. Les deja a crédito y cobra cada día, a la semana, quincenal y mensualmente en algunos casos. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Alto San Pedro zona peri urbana Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito. El crédito será destinado para la compra de perfumes, cosméticos y joyas y poder estocarse de mercadería para el día de la madre que ya se aproxima (es el 27 de Mayo aquí en Bolivia). Su trabajo y la experiencia que tiene como promotora le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy perfume, jewelry, and cosmetics in order to have more merchandise ready for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
K. Mary is a fishmonger. She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She buys fresh fish from  fishermen processes and then sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $425 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44814

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
A. Mary is a fishmonger. She is a single parent and has 5 dependents. She buys fresh fish from fishermen, processes and then sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Shiek Ibrahim

texts.en: Mr. K. is 50 years old and married, with 10 children, 8 of whom are still in school. He owns a small grocery stall in the Makup Bana village of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With some business skills and the previous loans from SMT, Mr. K. was able to diversify his business. Now he would like to expand further and secure appropriate shelter for the business. A loan of approximately $700 US will help him meet this goal.

loans.use: To rent an appropriate location for a grocery store

loans.name: Amidu

texts.en: Amidu is 54 years old and married, with 19 children. He is an accomplished and experienced tailor, but he lacks the capital to purchase enough supplies to allow him to meet customer demand. He learned tailoring 10 years ago and has been sewing clothes ever since, especially for women in Makup Bana village. His service is very vital and saves women from travelling long distances to Makeni town to seek sewing services. Amidu would like to expand his business and is requesting a loan of approximately $700 US to purchase more cotton material, buttons, and other supplies for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase sewing and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is a dealer in plastics. She is married and has 4 children. Business is very good. She wants to increase her income to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital to buy more plastics for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more plastics for sale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is 35 years old and married, with 3 children. She sells locally produced food such as cassava, sweet potatoes and vegetables in the open market to retailers from Makeni town. She purchases the commodities from farmers in small quantities, and because transportation to collect the produce is very expensive, Kadiatu makes very little profit. She would like to expand the business by purchasing her commodities in bulk to save on transportation time and expenses.   She is requesting a loan of approximately $700 US for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy commodities in bulk

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
C. Hannah sells clothing. She is married and has no children. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the needs of the family. Hannah is working very hard to help support the family’s finances. At the moment she wants to increase her sales to meet increasing demand of her goods but she lacks adequate capital.

She is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul K. is 39 years old and married, with 4 children. He sells cassava, sweet potatoes and vegetables such as eggplant to wholesalers from Freetown, who then resell the produce. Because he does not sell directly to the customers, Abdul earns very little profit. He would like to expand his business by purchasing and selling the foods directly to Freetown. He needs additional capital so that he can bypass the middleman and go directly to the market in Freetown himself. He is requesting a loan of approximately $350 US for this purpose.

loans.use: Food sales

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna D. buys food items like maize and groundnut in large quantities and sells them to her customers in smaller quantities they can afford. She is married and has 2 children. Business is very good but she spends most of her income on transportation.

She is asking $825 as additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her capital.

loans.use: As additional capital to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her capital.

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 44822

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
A. Veronica prepares food for sale. She is a single parent of 4 dependents. Business is good and her customer base is increasing.  She wants to increase production to meet the increasing demand.

She is asking for $525 as  additional capital to buy more food items for food production and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more food items for food production and sale.

loans.name: Aba Kate

texts.en:
A. Aba Kate travels to a distant town to buy food supplies in bulk. She is married and has 3 children. Business is very good but the cost of transportation is her major problem.

She is asking for $725 as additional capital for transportation costs.

loans.use: As additional capital for transportation costs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet D. is a 38-year old manufacturer who bakes bread. She is a wife and mother of six children. She bakes and supplies her bread to retail shops and canteen operators. Lots of customers enjoy her bread because of its good quality and taste. Her family is happy because the loan have improved their lives. She will use her next loan to buy more bags of flour and sugar to increase her production and serve additional clients for increased income. Janet belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust group.

loans.use: To buy more flour and sugar to expand production

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
G. Papa sells shoes and clothing. He is married and has 3 children. Business is very good and he wants to increase sales to meet the demand for his goods. He is lacking capital.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods for sale.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
E. Kate sells clothing materials. She is a single parent of 2 children. Demand for the goods has increased and she wants to increase sales but she lacks enough capital.

She is asking $525 as additional capital to buy more inventory.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia lives on Circunvalación Avenue in the Pampahasi area of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works as a taxi driver and owns his own car, and their 17 year old son. She has a stand on one of the commercial streets in the city where she sells flowers. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for her stand, as flowers are a product that is always in demand and her customer base has grown. This is the fourth loan with Impro, and the evaluation qualifies her for this loan. Claudia has been a client of Impro since 2005.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Claudia vive en la Avenida Circunvalación de la zona Pampahasi ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer en su automóvil propio, actualmente vive con su hijo menor de 17 años. Tiene un puesto de venta callejero en una de las avenidas comerciales de la ciudad donde vende flores.. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería para su puesto de venta, pues las flores es un producto que siempre está en demanda y ahora su clientela ha aumentado. Es el cuarto crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Claudia es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005.

loans.use: Buy flowers for her flower stand.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime lives on Killman Street in the Obispo Indaburo neighborhood of La Paz. He lives with his wife, who sells candy at the entrance of a school in their neighborhood, and they have three children. He works repairing and painting cars in his shop which is located beside his home. The loan will be used to buy materials at wholesale prices (paint, parts, etc.) and thereby reduce his expenses. This is his first loan with Impro, and the evaluation of his business qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Jaime vive en la calle Killman de la zona Obispo Indaburo ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa, quien vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio de la zona, tienen tres hijos. Trabaja en el arreglo y pintado de vehículos en su taller que se encuentra en la parte lateral de la casa donde vive. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de trabajo al por mayor (pinturas, repuestos, etc) y así reducir sus gastos. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy paint and parts for his car paint and repair shop

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 50 years old and married, with 5 children. She sells beans, rice and palm oil in Makup Bana village. With her previous loans from SMT, she diversified the business, but Isatu wants to be able to consistently provide the food items her customers demand. She needs additional capital to purchase extra food stock so that she can keep her customers coming back!  She is requesting a loan of $350 US  for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase food items to meet customer demand

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa F. is a sixty-year old mother of two children who are currently in school. Her husband has gone on pension, so Adwoa is the bread winner of her family. She sells kebab (local food prepared with soya beans, meat and oil). She is very grateful for the financial assistance and will use her loan to buy more stock of soya beans and oil so she can produce larger quantities and increase her income. Adwoa belongs to the community group called Eagle Trust Group. Group members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials (soya beans, oil, meat) to increase production.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu sells plastic sandals and African printed cotton material  in the village of Makup Bana, a business she has been operating for more than 10 years.  Her business supplements the family's farming income, playing a vital role in meeting family expenses. Fatu would like to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $350 US.

loans.use: Expand her shoe and cloth business

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is 50 years old and married, with 8 children. She started her business with small loan of $40 from SMT. Trading her cosmetics in the village, Isatu generated income to meet her family expenses and invested some profit in the family farm. She would like to expand the cosmetics business so that in the future she can rent a market stall. She is requesting a loan of $350 US.

loans.use: Expand cosmetics business

texts.en: Isatu started her business with small loan of $40 from SMT.  Trading her cosmetics within the village, Isatu generated income to meet her family expenses and invested some profit in the farm.  With previous loans her stock increased.  She would like to expand the business so that in the future she can rent a market stall.  She is requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000. Isatu is 50 years old and married with 8 children.

loans.use: Isatu needs a loan to help her move towards her goal of renting a market stall for her cosmetics business.  She wants to incease the profits from her business to do so.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa B. is sixty-years old and a she has been a traditional for fifteen years. She is a mother of two children and she manufactures local soap, pomade and powder which provide cures for many skin diseases. Her products have been very helpful to a lot of people with skin problems, but due to financial issues, she has not been able to expand her production. With high demands, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials (perfume, Vaseline, oil etc.) to expand her production and increase her income. Adwoa belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust Group. Members  agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like perfume, Vaseline, oil etc to expand her production of specialty pomades and powders

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris D. is thirty-eight years old  and a mother of twins and 2 other children. She operates a second-hand clothing store where she sells both adult and children clothes, bed spreads, curtains, type-dyes. She will use her new loan to buy more bales of clothes with more variety, which will appeal to more customers. Through the loan program,  Doris now has a store of her own. It is her heart's desire that her business progresses well so she can send her twin daughters to high school this year. She belongs to a community group called Eagle Trust Group.
