Group members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 42 years old and married, with 10 children. He has a small farm where his family grows food mainly for their own consumption. He also has a business buying and selling local produce. John is requesting a loan of approximately $1050 US to increase the amount of local produce he can buy and sell. With the increased profits from produce sales, he will be able to invest more in the family farm. He would like to train his children to do agribusiness.

loans.use: Purchase produce to sell, then invest profits in the family farm.

loans.name: Watan Yelie Group

texts.en: Ibrahim J. is 36 years and married, with 4 children. He is the leader of the group. Ibrahim started buying and selling cows when he was young but could not purchase more than one cow at a time due to lack of capital. With his previous loan he was able to buy two cows at a time, and he would like to expand his business even further to generate more income. The other group members operate different types of businesses. Saidu has a small local restaurant, Mohamed B. buys and sells cows, and Hassanatu B. and Alphajor B. own small grocery stalls in the market. All would like to expand their businesses. They are requesting loans of approximately $275 US per member. Group members guarantee each other in case of failure to repay the loan by any member, and the group already has some savings and are saving additional money weekly.

loans.use: Capital for expanding several businesses:  livestock, restaurant, and grocery stalls

loans.name: Potal Group

texts.en: Alhaji Baba J. is 26 years old and the group leader. The group started some years ago as a rotating savings and credit association (ROSCAs) and became stronger when they joined the SMT program. With their previous loans, they expanded their businesses and would like to continue doing so. Bailor J. sells fuel and engine oil, Seray B. raises goats and has a small stall of grocery items for sale, and Alhaji Baba J. has a grocery shop in the village. They are requesting a loan of approximately $625 US, or about $208 US for each member.

loans.use: Capital to expand their enterprises: a grocery shop, fuel oil sales, and goat raising

loans.name: Adelayda

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Mrs. Adelaida R. owns her own convenience store in the home where she lives, taking care of her faithful customers every day by offering her variety of products.

It is important to note that this woman has the responsibility of supporting her young school-aged son so she seeks ways to provide for his needs so that in the not so distant future he can become a great professional. As with all businesses she needs investment, specifically capital to purchase merchandise, and for that reason she is seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan and in this manner supply what she needs in order to succeed in her business and support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Adelaida R. posee su propia pulpería en su casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela todos los días ofreciendo su variedad de productos.

Es de importancia destacar que esta dama tiene la obligación de mantener a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar por lo que busca la manera de cómo suplir sus necesidades para que en un futuro no muy lejano llegue a ser un gran profesional. Como todo negocio necesita de inversión, el negocio de pulpería de la señora Adelaida necesita la compra de la mercadería, es por tal razón que ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera suplir tal necesidad para continuara adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Mrs. Ana Rios has been selling flowers for two years, and has her own business selling flowers from her home.

It is necessary to note that she is a widow who upon losing her husband began selling these products to support her household. Today thanks to the support that she has received from Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her economic condition and has acquired great quantities of flowers to sell.

Today she approached Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable her to acquire flowers from growers to sell them and thereby continue her business in her home with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana Rios se dedica desde hace doce años al negocio de venta de flores teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación donde las comercializa.

Es necesario destacar que ella es una dama viuda que al haber perdido a su esposo inició con la labor de la venta de estos productos para el sostén de su hogar. Hoy en día gracias al apoyo que le ha proporcionado Ceprodel, ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y ha adquirido mayores cantidades de flores para la venta.

Hoy en día una vez más acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir las flores de los proveedores para comercializarlas y así continuar con su sustento en su localidad de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase flowers

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the Somotiillo area of Chinandega city, Aracelly G. has had a convenience store for eight years, supporting her two children who today are students in their small community. It is necessary to note that Aracelly is both mother and father as she is a single mother and the convenience store is her only business that provides income.

In order to improve her economic situation she has struggled to supply her business and little by little she has stocked her store. Today she seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan which will permit her to get ahead in selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace ocho años en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Aracelly G. se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería con el que sustenta a sus dos hijos que hoy en día se encuentran estudiando en su pequeña comunidad. Es necesario recalcar que la señora Aracelly hace el papel de padre y madre por ser madre soltera y siendo la pulpería su único negocio con el que percibe ingresos.

Para mejorar su situación económica ha luchado para suplir el negocio poco a poco y para cubrir la necesidad del abastecimiento de la mercadería, hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita salir adelante en la venta de sus productos.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
Blanca Adriana H. is originally from the Somotillo area of Chinandega an dshe sells second hand shoes and clothing. She sells in the nearby markets of this community. For approximately 11 years she has worked to improve her quality of life and she has dreams of selling greater quantities of clothing and shoes to her faithful customers.

Ceprodel has been a pillar of support for her business as it has provided the loans used to buy merchandise from her suppliers. Today once again she has approached our institution to obtain a loan and thereby continue growing her business and meeting the needs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Blanca Adriana H. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega y se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos ambos de segunda mano. Ella vende en las cercanías al mercado de esta comunidad. Desde hace doce años aproximadamente ha venido esforzándose para mejorar su nivel de vida y es por esto que sus sueños son ampliar su negocio vendiendo mayores cantidades de ropa y zapatos a sus fieles clientes.

Ceprodel ha sido un pilar en su negocio por el hecho de que le ha proporcionado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de su mercadería a los proveedores. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a la institución para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar con la manutención de su negocio y además con las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and clothing

loans.name: Brenda Esperanza

texts.es:
Since 3 years, the Senora Brenda M. sells clothes in small quantities in the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega.

She sells the clothes in her house where she shows them either on a rope or wire. This way, they can be seen by people passing by.

As she cannot earn enough money only selling at home, she sells the clothes in the streets of Somotillo as well. She goes from house to house exhausting herself and exposing herself to fatigue due to the sun.

It is important to emphasize that she had to overcome difficult economic circumstances in this business and that she now needs to buy more clothes. She seeks the support of CEPRODEL in order to obtain the credit that will allow her to buy more clothes and in that way to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Brenda M. se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de la venta de ropa en pocas cantidades las cuales las vende en su casa al mostrarlas en una cuerda o alambre tendidas a vista de las personas.

Además, al no tener buenos resultados en la venta en su casa, por lo general ella vende la ropa ambulantemente por las calles de Somotillo ofreciéndola de casa en casa exponiéndose al desgaste físico y fatiga provocada por el sol.

Es necesario destacar que ella ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas en el negocio y hoy en día la necesidad es la adquisición de la ropa. Es por dicha razón que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que la permita adquirir la ropa y de esta manera salir adelante mejorando su condición económica.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Carla  Vanesa

texts.es:
The business that Carla B. is involved with is the sale of natural soft drinks and sodas from her own store in the Somotillo neighborhood in the city of Chinandega. She is well-known in the area for making delicious soft drinks, which has brought her new customers who want to try them.

Currently she wants to diversify her beverages and offer greater quantities of soft drinks. In order to do this, she primarily needs to buy fruit to make the soft drinks. For this reason, she has asked Ceprodel to help her with a loan that would permit her to buy the raw materials to make and sell the beverages. Little by little, she will be able to diversity her soft drink business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica la señora Carla B. es a la venta de refrescos naturales y gaseosas en su propio establecimiento en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es muy reconocida en su sector por el hecho de que elaborar deliciosos refrescos el cual han atraído a nuevos clientes para consumirlos.

Actualmente, el anhelo de ella es diversificar sus bebidas ofreciendo mejores cantidades de refrescos. Para esto necesita primeramente adquirir las frutas para elaborar los refrescos. Por dicha situación es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para recibir el oportuno crédito que le permita la compra de la materia prima para luego comercializar las bebidas y así poco a poco ir diversificándose en su negocio de refresquería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Donald Agustín

texts.es:
For the past 8 years, Mr. Donald B. has owned a business renting out a mill in a bedroom in his house in the Somotillo neighborhood of the city of Chinandega. He has many customers who demand his mill service, which can process corn, cacao, and other products.

This business is the only source of income for Mr. B., and for this reason he is looking for a way to expand the business by buying a new motorized mill with greater capacities to serve more customers. Without doubt, he has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan in order to buy a mill with the goal of getting ahead of his economic situation and improving his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Donald B. desde hace mas de ocho años se dedica al negocio del alquiler de molino en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega en el municipio de Somotillo. Es muy visitado por clientes que demandan el servicio de molino ya sea en el procesamiento del maíz, cacao y otros productos.

Este negocio es el único sustento para el señor B. y por tal razón es que busca como ampliar el negocio por medio de la compra de un nuevo molino de motor con mejores capacidades para brindar el servicio. Sin dudarlo, ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el debido préstamo para la compra del molino con el fin de salir adelante en su situación económica y mejora de su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase a mill

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Mrs Edelmira runs her grocery store since 12 years. She sold only a few products in the beginning but diversified her offer since. She decided to invest in a few products and to start her business because of her difficult financial situation and the fact that her husband’s salary could not cover all the household expenses.

Thanks to her strength and the support CEPRODEL provided her through their credits, she has been able to improve her economic situation. She has diversified the products she offers, like personal products for the house and food.

Today she urgently needs to buy more products and thus requests a loan, as she has already done before, in order to obtain the necessary capital to keep her business running.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Edelmira desde hace 12 largos años se ha dedicado al negocio de pulpería iniciando con la venta de pocos productos que a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido, ha venido diversificándose. El negocio lo inicia por la difícil situación que atravesaba y al no cubrir las necesidades del hogar solamente el salario de su esposo decidió invertir en la compra de estos pocos productos para iniciar el negocio.

Hoy en día, gracias a sus esfuerzos y al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel por medio de los créditos, ha logrado mejorar su condición económica diversificando sus productos y ofreciendo tanto productos personales como productos de casa y comestibles. La necesidad atravesada por ella hoy en día es la urgencia de la compra de estos productos, por tal razón ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel con el fin de obtener el capital económico para la adquisición y venta de estos productos.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Emilia Domitila

texts.es:
Ms. Emilia Gonzáles is worthy of of being emulated, as she spends her days elaborating meals for sale at her home. She lives in the Somotillo community and has characterized herself for being an excellent cook, who makes her own dishes, consumed by her costumers with great delight.

It is important to point out that the responsibility of securing the wellbeing of her household lies on her. For that reason she has sought Ceprodel’s support, in the form of loans which have allowed her to purchase the ingredients needed to prepare her meals and improve her business. She presently counts a total of two credits with Ceprodel, standing out as a loyal customer of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Emilia Gonzáles es una persona digna de imitar, ya que todos los días y a todo momento se dedica a la elaboración de alimentos para venderlos en su casa de habitación. Ella es habitante de la comunidad de Somotillo y se ha caracterizado por ser excelente cocinera, elaborando sus propios platillos que con mucho gusto sus clientes consumen.

Es necesario destacar que ella es una dama con la obligación de velar por el bienestar de su núcleo familiar. Para ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan adquirir la materia prima para preparar los alimentos y así salir adelante en su negocio. Hoy en día ella tiene un total de dos créditos en Ceprodel destacándose como fiel cliente de la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.

loans.name: Felix Maritza

texts.es:
Felix Maritza has worked with the Fundación Leon 2000 institution since 2003. Her credits have been largely devoted to working capital. She has a business in the city center, for which reason she has a large influx of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Esta cliente trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año dos mil tres sus creditos han estado enfocados a el capital de trabajo, ella tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad por lo que tiene mucha afluensia de clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of items to prepare food for sale to the public

loans.name: Francisco Martín

texts.es:
The gentleman Francisco R., from the Somotillose neighborhood, has a jewelry business with his own shop in a bedroom in his house. He is visited by clients who request services such as jewelry repair, polishing, and assembly.

Francisco is a married man with the responsibility to care for his two school-aged children. He will always be found working in his shop, and for this reason he has succeeded in improving, thanks to his hard work. We also must not forget the support that Ceprodel has given him, which has helped him buy his work materials. Today he once again is requesting a loan in order to buy these work materials, trusting that this will be awarded without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Francisco Rios originario del municipio de Somotillose dedica al negocio de joyería teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habtacion donde es visitado por sus clientes para obtener los servicios de reparacion, pulido y armado de las joyas.

Francisco es un caballero casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar. Siempre se encuentra trabajando en su negocio y es por esto que lo ha logrado mejorar gracias a su esfuerzo y sin olvidar a los apoyos que Ceprodel le ah brindado el cual le han servido para la compra de sus enseres de trabajo. Hoy en dia una vez mas solicita el crédito para la compra de estos enseres confiando en que le será otorgado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase work materials

loans.name: Juana Aracelly

texts.es:
Food sales is a very popular business in the Somotillo neighborhood due to the fact that there are a lot of food vendors where the customers can choose according to their taste. For Mrs. Juana A., this is not a problem because she is known as an excellent cook who prepares foods for all preferences, for her customers’ maximum enjoyment.

Despite this situation, Juanita runs into the problem of insufficient funds to purchase the raw materials to make her dishes. For this reason she is requesting Ceprodel’s help to take out a loan which would give her the opportunity to purchase food. In this way, she can continue to sell her dishes, as she is always looking for a way to keep her loyal neighborhood customers satisfied.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy popular en el municipio de Somotillo por el hecho de que existen muchas ventas de alimentos en la que el cliente puede escoger según sea su gusto. Para la señora Juana A. este no es una problemática debido a que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una excelente cocinera que prepara los alimentos con todo el gusto para que sus clientes los disfruten al máximo.

A pesar de esta situación, Juanita atraviesa la problemática de la insuficiencia económica para adquirir su materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Es por este motivo que ella busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir los alimentos y de esta manera continuar con la comercialización de ellos buscando la manera de mantener siempre satisfecha a su fiel clientela en su municipio.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
When she began her business, Melania Patricia had on old pedal sewing machine. With time and due to demand, she purchased a modern machine. She works with families and especially with her husband, who sells her products in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando inicio el negocio tenia una maquina de pedal viejita con el tiempo debido a la demanda compro una maquina moderna, trabaja con sus familias y en especial su esposo que es quien comercializa en otras ciudades.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as fabric, thread, lacework and other supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia R., native to Chinandega, Nicaragua, lives in the town of Somotillo, where she runs her own business selling clothes in small quantities. This is her only source of income and is able to support her two sons who attend school.

Like all Nicaraguan women, Mrs. Lucia is a hard-working person, and despite some hardships is always looking for work in order to sustain her home and family. Ceprodel has greatly supported her business through the disbursement of some previous loans, which have enabled her to acquire merchandise which she was able to sell to various customers.

Once again, she is confident that this new loan will be granted, and is therefore confidentally awaiting its disbursement.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Lucia R. es originaria del departamento de Chinandega en Nicaragua y vive en el municipio de Somotillo en el cual tiene su propio negocio de pulpería y venta de ropa en menores cantidades siendo este su único ingreso con el que sustenta a sus dos hijos escolares.

Como toda mujer nicaragüense, la señora Lucía es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de las adversidades siempre está en pie buscando el trabajo para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Ceprodel ha apoyado grandemente su negocio por medio de la entrega de créditos que le han permitido adquirir su mercadería para ofertarla a los diferentes clientes. Una vez más confía en que su crédito será otorgado y por esta razón es que espera confiadamente en la institución.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise  (Compra de mercadería)

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
For Mr. Luis G., his general store business should be improved because every day new competitors emerge that obligate him to make changes in his business in order to keep offering his products. He is originally from the Somotillo neighborhood in Chinandega, where he works to support his wife and son, for whom he is responsibile.

Nowadays his business needs an immediate investment in merchandise like food and personal products. For this reason Ceprodel has helped him obtain a loan that gives him the opportunity to purchase these products to sell at his store. Through this loan, Mr. G. will be able to purchase the products that he needs to diversify his inventory and attract more customers to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Para el señor Luis G., su negocio de pulpería debe ser mejorado por el hecho de que cada día surgen nuevos competidores que obligan a efectuar cambios en los negocios para continuar ofertando sus productos. El es originario del municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega donde se esfuerza para mantener a su esposa e hijo que están bajo su responsabilidad

Hoy en día su negocio está necesitando la inversión inmediata de la mercadería como comestibles y productos personales. Por esto es que de manera personal ha asistido a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le den la oportunidad de adquirir estos productos para comercializarlos en su negocio. Por medio de este préstamo se dará lugar a que al adquirir los productos el señor G. diversifique su inventario atrayendo mas clientes para su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio R., native of the municipality of Somotillo, has been working in a horseshoe workshop for several years since this is his only sustenance for maintaining his family which consists of his spouse and three children.

This gentleman, cognizant of the necessity to invest in his home, has initiated construction in it due to the fact that it has been thoroughly beaten by the natural phenomena that have struck over many years. After starting the reconstruction of his home, he has been forced to delay the process due to a lack of economic resources. He has only managed to erect one wall, and he still needs to replace the roof with a new one. For that reason, he is looking to receive financial aid from Ceprodel, from which he will obtain the necessary economic assistance to continue the reconstruction of his home with the goal of offering better living conditions and security to his wife and children.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco Antonio R. originario del municipio de Somotillo desde hace varios años ha laborado en un taller de herradura siendo este su único sustento con el que mantiene su familia que consta de su cónyuge y tres hijos.

Este caballero, consciente de la necesidad de invertir en su casa de habitación ha iniciado una reconstrucción de su casa por el hecho de que ha estado muy maltratada debido a los fenómenos naturales que por mucho tiempo la han azotado. Al haber iniciado la reconstrucción de su casa ha tenido que verse en la obligación de detener el proceso por falta de recursos económicos. Solamente ha logrado levantar una pared pero aun le hace falta cambiar el techo por uno nuevo. Por ello busca el financiamiento en Ceprodel con el que logrará obtener el capital económico para continuar con la reconstrucción de su hogar con el fin de brindarle mejore condiciones de vida y seguridad a su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: Purchase materials to reconstruct his home.

loans.name: María  Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora B., native of the Somotillo municipality, is married with two school-aged children. As a responsible mother, she makes every effort along with her husband to accomplish her dreams of having a decent roof over their heads where their children can grow and develop in their studies.

Over the course of time, there have been infrastructure problems in the home where they have lived, which has prompted them to invest in the reconstruction of this property. After starting the reconstruction, they have had to delay the process due to lack of financial resources. In order for them to continue with the project, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel with the goal of acquiring construction materials to proceed with the reconstruction and thus, offer her children all the possibilities to develop in their studies. Currently, the progress has been the erection and painting of plycem walls, but the roof and floors still need an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Auxiliadora B. originaria del municipio de Somotillo es casada y con dos hijos en edad escolar, como madre responsable se esfuerza junto con su esposo para lograr ver cumplido sus sueños de tener un techo digno donde sus hijos logren crecer y desarrollarse en sus estudios.

A través de los años la casa de habitación donde han vivido ha presentado problemas de infraestructura por lo que los ha inquietado a invertir en la reconstrucción de esta propiedad. Al haber iniciado la reconstrucción de la casa han detenido la labor por falta de recursos económicos. Es por este motivo que para continuar con la labor, ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de adquirir los materiales de construcción para continuar con esta obra y por medio de ella proporcionarle a sus hijos todas las posibilidades para desarrollarse en sus estudios. Actualmente el avance se ha llevado en el levantamiento y pintado de paredes de plycem pero aun hace falta invertir en el techo y piso.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Eliceo

texts.es:
Mr. C. lives in his own home with his wife on Pisiga Street in the Alto Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. His wife works selling clothing to help with the household expenses. Eliceo uses his vehicle as a taxi. The loan that he is requesting will be used to repair the motor, purchase tires, and repair regular wear and tear. This is crucial as the vehichle is his only source of income (his wife earns very little). He has a good prior history and qualifies to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor vive en casa propia con su esposa en la calle Pisiga de la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, la esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa para ayudar en la casa con los gastos. Eliceo usa su vehículo como taxi, el crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor, comprar llantas y reparar daños que tenga la movilidad, la cuál es su única fuente de ingreso (su esposa gana muy poco). Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Señora María A. is from the municipality of Somotillo, which is where she works very hard at her business of raising and selling pigs. She has a small corral at her home where she raises and feeds them so they develop in good conditions.

It's necessary to point out that because she is a hard-working mother, she receives the support of her two children in this business. They help her care for and feed the pigs to guarantee their efficient development. In spite of this, the underlying need for her is the urgency of purchasing pigs to raise and sell them in the place where she lives. This is why she is searching for support in Ceprodel to obtain the necessary credit that will give her the economic resources for said purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora María A. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo que es donde se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos en su casa de habitación teniendo un pequeño corral donde los cuida y alimenta para que se logren desarrollar en buenas condiciones.

Es necesario destacar que al ser una madre esforzada recibe el apoyo de sus dos hijos en el negocio los cuales le ayudan a cuidar y alimentar a los cerdos para garantizar su eficiente desarrollo. A pesar de esto, la necesidad atravesada por ella es la urgencia de la compra de los cerdos para su respectiva crianza y comercialización en su localidad donde habita. Por eso busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le de lugar a la adquisición del recurso económico para dicha compra.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy had her first son at 25-years old. Two year later, she had her second. She always wanted to have a business, and this is why she never gave up the idea of being able to study something and starting a business. Two years ago, when her sons were a little older, she made the decision to study cosmetology at a beauty school. After some months, she fixed up a space in her home and opened a salon with the little money she had then. Throughout two years, she worked hard to be able to finish constructing a location to move to. Now she works in a bigger location that she has gradually implemented over the years and where, for six years, she has dedicated a space to her bookstore. She invests what she receives from these two businesses into the higher education of her sons. Luckily, her husband, who works in a mechanic shop, supports her in everything. Today, Lucy's objective is to continue growing her salon and to sell cosmetic products wholesale in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

A los veinticinco años Lucy tuvo a su primer hijo, dos años después tuvo al segundo. Ella siempre quiso tener un negocio, es por ello que nunca renuncio ala idea de poder estudiar algo y empezar un negocio. Hace doce años, cuando sus hijos estuvieron un poco más crecidos, tomo la decisión de estudiar cosmetología en un instituto de belleza. Luego de unos meses ambientó un espacio de su casa y abrió su peluquería con lo poco que tenia en ese entonces. Durante dos años estuvo trabajando duro para poder terminar de construir un local y mudarse. Ahora trabaja en un amplio local que con los años ha ido implementándolo de a pocos y en donde, además, desde hace seis años, dedica un espacio para su librería. Lo que recibe de sus dos negocios los invierte en la educación superior de sus dos hijos, Felizmente su esposo, quien trabaja en un taller de mecánica, la apoya en todo. Hoy en día, el objetivo de Lucy es continuar creciendo en su peluquería y más adelante vender productos cosméticos al por mayor.

loans.use: To invest in a cosmetics store

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba has her own home and lives with her husband on Titicaca Street in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. The couple has children, all of whom are married. Elba set up a grocery store in her home, which provides income for daily expenses. She also cooks and has regular customers who pay each month for lunch service. She's asking for a loan to have additional capital to be able to supply her store with the basics (products of basic necessity), which have greatly increased in price lately.

She has a good prior history and qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora tiene domicilio propio, vive en la calle Titicaca de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, la pareja tiene hijos y todos están casados. Elba instaló en su vivienda una tienda de abarrotes, la cual le genera ingresos de subsistencia, también cocina y tiene pensionados (clientes que pagan cada mes por un servicio de almuerzo). Solicita crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo y adquirir productos de primera necesidad, los cuales están subiendo mucho de valor últimamente. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Additional capital for products to supply her business

loans.name: Maria De La Concepci

texts.es:
In the town of Somotillo, in the city of Chinandega, Mrs Maria T., who is the mother of two girls, teaches in a small elementary school.

Convinced of the need to repair her home because it was in such poor condition, she began rebuilding the house, but had to stop due to lack of financial resources, and thought that she'd continue when her finances were better.

Today she is determined to continue with reconstruction, and has requested a loan from Ceprodel, for the sole purpose of completing the work she had started. This construction work will directly benefit her two children since they are young.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Maria T. madre de dos niñas se dedica a la docencia en un pequeño colegio de la comunidad donde imparte clase a los niños de primaria.

Convencida de la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda por estar en deficiente estado, inició su reconstrucción de la casa pero por la falta del recurso económico detuvo la construcción para lograr continuar en otro momento cuando su situación lo permita. Hoy en dia decidida a continuar con la reconstrucción de su vivienda, ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales de construcción con el único fin de terminar la obra que inició. Por medio de esta reconstrucción beneficia directamente a sus dos hijos que tanto necesitan de ella por ser menores de edad.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (Compra de materiales para la construccion)

loans.name: Martha Isolina

texts.es:
With much effort, in the municipality of Somotillo, Martha S. sells clothing with the sole purpose of accomplishing her dream of having a decent home where she can live with her family.

Over the course of the years, she and her husband have been making a strong effort to accomplish this goal. For this reason, after seeing the condition of the infrastructure of their home, they decided to invest in the purchase of construction materials to initiate the repairs to their home. After they did this, there was a time in which they had to stop the reconstruction due to lack of financial resources. Today, to continue with this project, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan that will enable the purchase of construction materials to continue the pursuit of their dream of having a home that offers ideal living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Con mucho esfuerzo en el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Martha S. se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa con el único propósito de lograr ver realizado su sueño de tener un techo digno donde habitar junto con su familia.

Su esposo y ella a través de los años se han venido esforzando fuertemente para lograr el sueño de tener una casa digna donde habitar, por este motivo es que al ver las condiciones de su infraestructura decidieron invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para iniciar con la reparación de su casa. Al haberla iniciado llego un momento en el cual tuvieron que detener la reconstrucción por el recurso económico pero hoy en día para continuar con esta labor ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con su sueño de tener un hogar que preste todas las condiciones para vivir.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a widow who lives in her own home with her children on Tupac Katari Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. In the mornings, she works selling clothes which provides her with a very small amount of money. Her other source of income comes from the rental of a taxi. The loan that she is requesting will be used to repair her taxi so that she can continue generating enough income. This is especially important since she is alone and the only one supporting her children.

She has a good prior history and qualifies to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora vive en la C. Tupac Katari de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, es viuda y por las mañanas trabaja vendiendo ropa donde percibe un salario muy pequeño, su otra fuente de ingresos es la renta de un taxi, el crédito que solicita es para reparar su movilidad y poder seguir generando ingresos ya que es ella sola la que mantiene a sus hijos Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
In the beginning, Mariela had a very small scale business compared to today. Her stall was in a state of disrepair, covered with plastic and wood. Improvements have now been made to the stall and to her business. Mariela has six credits with the Fundación Leon 2000 institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Al inicio tenia el negocio en una escala muy baja comparado con la actualidad era un negocio pequeñito y el tramo en mal estado cerrado con plastico y madera, actualmente a realizado mejoras al tramo y a su negocio tiene seis creditos con nuestra institución.

loans.use: Purchase of products for daily use in the household

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha M.’ business is run from her home, being that it is a cabinetmaking workshop situated in its ample yard where she is visited by the sector’s clients. She is a married woman with four children to maintain.

The necessity that Mrs. M. is facing today is the urgency to purchase wooden boards so that she may carry out the cabinet orders for her business. To obtain these boards, she has turned to Ceprodel hoping to receive a loan that will allow her to finish her work. With the financial assistance given to this lady, her four small children will also benefit since they depend on her and her work.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de la dama Martha M. se lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación siendo un taller de ebanistería que se ubica en su amplio patio de la casa donde es visitada por los clientes del sector. Ella es una dama casada y con cuatro hijos que mantener.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora M. es la urgencia de la compra de la madera en tablas el cual le permite realizar sus trabajos de ebanistería en su negocio. Para lograr adquirir esta madera, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel esperando que le sea otorgado el crédito que le permita adquirir la madera para la elaboración de su trabajo. Con la ayuda brindada a esta dama también se benefician sus cuatro pequeños hijos ya que dependen de ella.

loans.use: Purchase wooden boards for her cabinetmaking business.

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
Christian lives in his grandparent's house at 6 August Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. He's studying computer science. In the house where he lives, he set up a business of online gaming and in the back room, he put in a billards room. With these activitites he is able to generate enough income to cover the cost of food for the household and for his studies. Christian is requesting a loan to buy the latest model computer so that he can also set up an internet cafe. He has a good prior history and he qualifies to obtain a new loan. In addition, he has received a loan through Kiva before.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

El señor vive en casa de sus abuelos en la calle 6 de agosto de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta estudiando informática y en la casa donde vive instalo un negocio de juegos en red y en la trastienda instalo un salón de billar. Con dichas actividades genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y estudio. Christian solicita crédito para comprar un equipo de computación de último modelo para la instalación de Internet en su negocio. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito, además que ya fue un cliente beneficiado por Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Mayra De La Cruz

texts.es:
Señora Mayra M. makes a living by selling various products. She has her own mini-market where she sells all types of products like personal items and food. Her biggest dream in her career is to succeed in improving her business by way of expanding her land to improve the conditions of her store. This is why she strives greatly to carry out this goal and in this way to offer a better life to her children.

As is well known, every remodeling or expansion of a business needs a large investment, which is why she has very confidently turned to Ceprodel to benefit from the credits that they could offer her to expand her business with the aim of offering better conditions to her clients and at the same time offering better comforts to her children, who she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mayra M. se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería en la que vende todo tipo de productos tales como personales y comestibles. Su mayor sueño comerciante es lograr mejorar su negocio por medio de la ampliación de su terreno para mejorar las condiciones de la pulpería, es por eso que se esfuerza grandemente para llevar a cabo esta meta y de esta forma proporcionarle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.

Como bien es sabido, toda reconstrucción o ampliación de un negocio necesita una alta inversión por lo que ella muy confiadamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan ampliar su negocio con el fin de prestar mejores condiciones a sus clientes y a la vez proporcionarles mejores comodidades a sus hijos que los ama mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
The transportation business requires much investment being that the cost of fuel increases each time and the cost of spare parts has elevated to great magnitudes. In the city of Somotillo, Miguel Angel R. has been in the transportation industry with his own taxicab, which he works daily in an effort to bring home the daily bread to be ingested by his wife and three children.

The problem Mr. R. is facing is that he needs to buy spare parts for his vehicle because it is in bad condition and needs to be taken to the shop for repairs. For this, he has turned to Ceprodel for support with the goal of obtaining a loan to purchase the parts and continue with his transportation business in the municipality of Somotillo, from which he is a native.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de transporte es una labor que requiere de mucho inversión por la razón de que hoy en día el costo del combustible se eleva cada vez más y además los repuestos de los vehículos se elevan a grandes magnitudes. En la ciudad de Somotillo el caballero Miguel Angel R. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de transporte teniendo su propio taxi el cual lo trabaja todos los días procurando llevar el pan a la mesa para que lo puedan ingerir sus tres hijos y esposa.

La problemática atravesada por el señor R. es la necesidad de la compra de repuestos para el vehiculo debido a que está en malas condiciones y necesita adquirir estos repuestos para llevar el auto al taller y que sea reparado. Para esto ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de que le proporcionen créditos para adquirir estos repuestos y así continuar con su labor de transporte en el municipio de Somotillo de donde es originario.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair his taxicab.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Ms. P. has handled five credits with which she has improved her business and has since grown her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora P. ha manejado cinco creditos en los cuales ha mejorado su negocio ya que a crecido su inventario.

loans.use: Purchase of General Merchandise

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Señora Modesta Pastrana is from the municipality of Somotillo and makes a living by selling cheese out of her home. It's very important to point out that she has been very well-known in her community for being a very hard-working woman who strives every day to offer her family a better quality of life.

To continue will her cheese-making business, señora Pastrana has the obligation to invest in the purchase of raw materials. This is why she has sought the support of CEPRODEL, looking for a way to obtain credits that allow her to earn a living for the benefit of herself and her family. Currently she is a loyal client of CEPRODEL and has a credit record of two credits with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Modesta Pastrana es originaria del municipio de Somotillo y se dedica a la venta de queso en su casa de habitación. Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella ha sido muy conocida en su comunidad por ser una mujer muy trabajadora que día a día se esfuerza para brindar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

Para continuar con el negocio de la elaboración de queso, la señora Pastrana tiene la obligación de invertir en la compra de la materia prima. Es por ello que ha buscado apoyo en CEPRODEL buscando la manera de conseguir créditos que le permitan llevar el sustento a su mesa para beneficio de ella y su familia. Actualmente es una fiel cliente de Ceprodel teniendo un record crediticio de dos créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Norlan

texts.es:
Señor Norlan H. is from the municipality of Somotillo. He works very hard to better the living conditions of his family who needs his support so much right now because of scarce economic resources. After noticing the need to invest in the reconstruction of his home, he started by raising a wall to provide better security since the infrastructure had presented a lot of shortcomings. After starting the reconstruction, he decided to stop the process due to a lack of economic resources but is now looking to continue it again. He is looking to Ceprodel for timely support to benefit from the credit that will let him acquire construction materials to continue his work.

Through the support offered by Ceprodel, he and his family that he loves so much will benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Norlan H. originario del municipio de Somotillo trabaja arduamente para lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo por ser de escasos recursos económicos. Al darse cuenta la necesidad de invertir en la reconstrucción de su casa, inició con el levantamiento de un muro para dar mayor seguridad ya que su infraestructura ha presentado grandes deficiencias. Al haber iniciado con la reconstrucción, decidió detener el proceso por falta del recurso económico pero una vez más para continuar busca el apoyo oportuno en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita adquirir sus materiales de construcción para continuar con la obra

Por medio de este apoyo proporcionado por Ceprodel se beneficia él y su familia a la que tanto ama según comenta.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es:
Rosa Alpina’s business is the sale of prepared meals (fritanga) from her home in the municipality of Somotillo in Chinandega. She puts great effort into her business and is open in the evenings, when she sells her delicious dishes to the general public who visits her.

Rosa is a married mother and has the advantage of having her daughters support her in the business. However, the necessity she is facing is the urgency to purchase prime materials for the creation of her meals. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will enable the purchase of the necessary ingredients to make her dishes. Curently, she is a loyal customer of Ceprodel and for that reason, she is confident that she will receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica la señora Rosa Alpina es a la elaboración y venta de comida (fritanga) en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de Chinandega. Se dedica a este negocio con mucho esfuerzo teniendo su horario de atención por las noches donde vende sus deliciosos platillos al público en general que le visita.

Rosa es una madre casada y posee la ventaja de que sus hijas le apoyan en el negocio, sin embargo la necesidad atravesada por ella es la urgencia de la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos. Por ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los ingredientes para elaborar los platillos. Actualmente es fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por ello es que confía que su crédito sea otorgado.

loans.use: Purchase the necessary ingredients to make her dishes.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Maria Yolanda began her business selling from a mobile cart in the streets. With time she has managed to acquire a stall in the bus terminal where she now offers her products. She is a woman of very limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

cuando inicio el negocio vendia en las calles en un carreton de manera ambulante con el tiempo a logrado adquirir un tramo en el mercado de la terminal de buses donde oferta sus productos es una señora de muy escasos recursos

loans.use: Fruit Sales

loans.name: Ruth Amalia

texts.es:
Ruth Amalia is a young mother from Somotillo. She makes a living by selling clothing with the unique purpose of finishing reconstruction on her house, which was damaged a long time ago by natural phenomenons. For her, her priority is her young daughter, and that is why she is looking for the way to offer her better living conditions so she can have a decent roof over her head where she can develop and at the same time improve the conditions for her clothing business.

It's necessary to point out that upon starting her reconstruction, she didn't manage to finish because of economic reasons. Nevertheless, she is now willing to continue until she finishes, and this is her main motive for turning to Ceprodel: to obtain credits that will allow her to acquire the construction materials for her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Ruth Amalia es una joven madre originaria del municipio de Somotillo el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa con el único propósito de terminar de reconstruir su casa de habitación que ha sido lastimada desde hace mucho tiempo por los fenómenos naturales. Para ella su prioridad es su pequeña hija y es por esto que busca la manera de proporcionarle mejores condiciones de vida para que su pequeña posea un techo digno donde desarrollarse y a la vez para mejorar las condiciones del negocio de la venta de ropa.

Es necesario destacar que al haber iniciado su reconstrucción no logró terminar por el factor económico, sin embargo hoy en día está dispuesta a continuar hasta terminar la obra siendo este el motivo principal por el cual acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir los materiales de construcción para su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials for her home

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Isabel B. lives in the town of Somotillo. She runs a clothes business with a lot of dedication. She would like to realize her dream to continue the reconstruction of her house. As her home is in a deteriorated state, her two children could risk getting hurt if the construction collapses.

It is for her children that Mrs Isabel has started to rebuild her house again and that she has reached out to CEPRODEL. She would like this institution to help her in obtaining a loan to buy the needed construction materials.

She is very happy today because she is certain that she will obtain the loan and that it will improve the life of her family and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos Isabel B. es una dama del municipio de Somotillo el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa en el cual se esfuerza para llevar a cabo su sueño de continuar con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ya que al tener su infraestructura en mal estado expone a sus dos pequeñas criaturas a un problema provocado por un derrumbe u otra situación. Por ello es que la señora Isabel ha decidido iniciar nuevamente con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación y para ello ha buscado el apoyo monetario en Ceprodel el cual ha asistido a esta institución para ser beneficiada con el recurso económico que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción. Hoy en día ella se siente muy contenta porque está segura que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará la condición de vida de su familia y permitirá el mejoramiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Gilda Maritza

texts.es:
Ms. C. sells general merchandise, including clothing, footwear, cosmetics and other items.  She has been working with the Fundación Leon 2000 institution for eight years.


Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora C. se deica a la venta de mercaderia en general vende ropa, calzado, cosmeticos y otros ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace ocho años.

loans.use: Clothing and Cosmetic Sales

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega, Virginia V. runs a transportation business with her own tricycle carts, which she sometimes drives herself but mostly they are driven by some young people from her community, to whom she pays for their work. Ever since she started this business, she has searched for a way to invest more in it to offer better service to her passengers that use her services daily. For this, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel being that currently the tricycle is in bad shape and must be repaired, and she must purchase the parts to guarantee its function. Through the support offered by Ceprodel, she will be able to continue her unique business with which she maintains her household.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Virginia V. se dedica al negocio de transporte teniendo sus propio triciclos el cual lo conduce en ocasiones ella y en la mayoría de los casos un jóvenes de su comunidad al que paga por conducir.

Desde que inició con su negocio de triciclo ha buscado la manera de invertir mas en este para brindar un mejor servicio a los pasajeros que diariamente hacen uso de este servicio. Para esto ha solicitado crédito en Ceprodel debido a que actualmente el triciclo está en mal estado y por ello debe de ser reparado y se deben de comprar las piezas para garantizar su funcionamiento. Por medio del apoyo brindado por Ceprodel se permitirá que ella logre continuar con su negocio único con el que mantiene su hogar.

loans.use: Make repairs to her tricycle cart.

loans.name: Yadira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs Yadira S. runs a tortilla business in the district of Somotillo in the city of Chandega. Her goal is to begin the reconstruction of her house that is in a deteriorated state. Indeed, as winter approaches, she has to invest in the repair of the house in order to avoid that her children get a cold or other illnesses.

Mrs Yadira and her husband put all their strengths together in order for this dream to come true. As her earnings are too low, she searches a way to obtain the loan that will allow her to purchase the construction materials. She turned to CEPRODEL in order to receive the necessary loan to buy zinc, brick and other materials.

It is necessary to emphasize that the loan will foremost help her little children that need their mother so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Yadira S. se dedica la negocio de la venta de tortillas con el único objetivo de iniciar con la reconstrucción de su vivienda por estar en mal estado y además al darse cuenta que el invierno se acerca debe de invertir en la mejora de la vivienda para evitar que sus pequeños se enfermen por resfríos u otras enfermedades. La señora Yadira junto con su cónyuge han unido sus esfuerzos para lograr llevar a cabo este sueño y debido a que sus ingresos económicos son bastante escasos, ella busca la manera de cómo conseguir el crédito que le permita la compra de los materiales de construcción. Para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario para la compra del zinc, ladrillo y bloque. Es necesario destacar que con el apoyo que se le brinde a esta esforzada dama también se está beneficiando a sus pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de su madre.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mercedes Mafalda

texts.es:
Señora Mercedes sells general merchandise out of her home and out in the streets. She has been with our bank institution for the past 4 years.

La señora se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general negocio que lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante trabaja con nuestra institucion desde hace cuatro años.

loans.use: To invest it in new inventory

loans.name: Yanneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs Yanneth del Socorro E. runs a beverage store with a lot of dedication. Her store is located in the discrict of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She does this job since six years in order to support her household and to provide food to her two small children who depend on her.

As she cares a lot for her children and in order to improve her business, she has requested the support from CEPRODEL. She requests a loan that will allow her to purchase fruits to prepare drinks and to buy canned juices and sodas.

She would like to emphasize that the loan will help her as well as her business and her small children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yanneth del Socorro E. se dedica al negocio de la venta de refrescos en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Se dedica a esta labor muy esforzadamente desde hace seis años con el fin de brindarle el mantenimiento a su hogar de habitación y llevar el alimento a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto necesitan de su apoyo. Para ello se esfuerza grandemente y para mejorar la condición de su negocio ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan adquirir las frutas para elaborar sus refrescos y además para la compra de los jugos enlatados y gaseosas.

Por medio del crédito es necesario destacar que se beneficia tanto ella, su negocio y sus pequeños hijos.

loans.use: To purchase fruits to prepare drinks and to buy canned juices and sodas

loans.name: Yasmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega's "municipio" of Somotillo, Yasmina has a school supply shop that, with a lot of work over the years, she's managed to stock with various items. She's the mother of two children and is responsible for providing them with the education that they deserve.

Thanks to help from Ceprodel, she's succeeded in improving her business. Now she needs to buy products such as as notebooks, pencils, binders, etc. It's for this reason that she has applied again to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to stock what she needs and improve the conditions of her humble business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Yasmina Torres se dedica al negocio de librería el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado suplir con diferentes artículos a medida que han venido transcurriendo los años. Es madre de dos hijos y con la responsabilidad de brindarle los estudios que ellos se merecen.

Gracias al apoyo otorgado por Ceprodel ha logrado mejorar la condición de su negocio dándole lugar a la compra de sus vitrinas y sus productos en general. Hoy en dia su necesidad es la adquisición de los productos de librería como cuadernos, lapiceros, afiches, etc. Es por este motivo que ella acude una vez mas a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita suplir su necesidad y de esta manera mejorar la condición de su humilde negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Enercida

texts.en:
Enercida is a humble but hard-working and active entrepreneur who strives to support her three children.  Enercida lives in the Casabe community of Santo Domingo where she sells shoes and underwear.  The entrepreneur explains that she doesn’t have the capacity to buy or rent a local stall, but she’ll keep working hard in order to achieve that goal, and in the meanwhile strengthen her business.
Enercida is requesting a loan (the second one she’ll take from FSMA) to buy more shoes and underwear and add new styles in order to attract new people to her business.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra sells women’s clothing in her hometown, the Casabe community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur is twenty-seven years old and the mother of four daughters ranging from six to twelve years old, all of whom attend school.
Alejandra has been selling her goods for three years. Recently, she took from FSMA a loan which she invested in the purchase of a collection of fashionable clothing.  She managed to repay successfully the loan, and this could increase significantly her income. Now, the entrepreneur is requesting a second loan to buy more goods since her products are in high demand at the moment.  Alejandra wants to have money enough to keep supporting her daughters’ educations.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda, a native of the "municipio" of Condega, is married and has two children, one of whom is school-aged. For ten years, she has made a living making and selling tortillas, having her own shop in her house in Condega. Despite her house being in bad shape, she has decided to invest in rebuilding it and also in remodeling the shop where she makes tortillas. It's for this reason that she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to buy construction materials for starting work on the project.

It's important to stress that Ceprodel loans have benefited this lady and that she and her dear children who, more than ever, need their mother's support, will continue benefiting from them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Brenda G. originaria del municipio de Condega es casada, con dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos se encuentra en la edad escolar. Desde hace diez años se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega. A pesar de que su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado con mala infraestructura, ella ha decidido invertir para la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación y además le es de mucha necesidad remodelar el local donde elabora las tortillas. Es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de los materiales de construcción para iniciar con esta labor.

Es necesario recalcar que por medio de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel ha esta dama serán beneficiados tanto su negocio, ella y sus queridos hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su mamá.

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ruth Dilenia

texts.en: Ruth Dilenia is the proud mother of three children (two daughters and one son), two of whom attend school. Ruth Dilenia owns and operates a poultry shop, which she starts about five years ago with her husband’s help. She also operates a "pica pollo", a restaurant where people can buy deep-fried chicken with fried bananas or potatoes. She operates the "pica pollo" in the night. The entrepreneur explains that the local stall where she runs the business is not hers but a rented one. She plans to buy it in a few years. In the meantime, she says she’ll dedicate all her efforts to improve the quality of the services she’s offering to her clientele.  Ruth Dilenia wants a loan to purchase more chicken in order to increase her sales volume and her income.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase live chickens for a "pica pollo" and a poultry shop.

loans.name: Marianeri

texts.en:
Marianeri, mother of one son, is a young and budding entrepreneur who strives to improve her family’s living conditions. 
To make a living, she sells iron and other metals in the low-income Casabe community of Santo Domingo. Shortly after her child’s birth, Marianeri had to stop her studies in order to fend for her child. The entrepreneur explains that she’d like to continue her studies, and she says if her income increases in the next month, she’ll pay someone to look after her son in the afternoon so that she can go back to school.  With her loan, Marianeri will buy more metals in order to increase her sales volume, and thus her revenue.

loans.use: To buy metals to resell in her community.

loans.name: Bianey

texts.en:
Bianey is the owner and operator of a small restaurant in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo.  Each day, thousands of people visit her business to enjoy the tasty Dominican plates she prepares with care. Bianey explains that people love to eat in her restaurant because she always does her best to offer a top quality service and a clean space.
The excellent chef explains that her business helps her support her two sons (six and two years old). With her loan, she’ll buy new goods in order to diversify the menu she offers to her clientele. Bianey hopes that her investment will continue her business growth and that, eventually, perhaps she can even buy some nicer furniture for her home.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other goods for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Andrea Francisca

texts.es:
Andrea, who belongs to the lending group, Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial de Huaraz ("Working Women of the Huarez Fair Grounds"), makes a living selling alfalfa and regional foods from the coast in the Goyita market in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.500 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy alfalfa, rice, cooking oil and pasta.

Andrea, 36, is partnered with 4 children. Her partner is a construction worker who works far away. Both work to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Andrea, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y alimentos al costado del mercado Comercial Goyita, en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará alfalfa, y 1 saco de arroz, 18 litros de aceite, 10 kg. de fideos.

Ella tienen 36 años de edad , es conviviente tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es albañil trabaja lejos, ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Hermelinda Elvira

texts.es:
Hermelinda, who belongs to the lending group, Mujeres Trabajadoras de Huaraz ("Working Women of Huaraz"), makes a living selling groceries and colas. Her business is located in her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.300 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy rice, cooking oil and pasta for her shop.

Hermelinda, 27, has 2 children. Her husband is a teacher and both work to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Hermelinda, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Trabajadoras de Huaraz, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y gaseosas, su negocio esta en su domicilio ubicado en Billón Bajo Pasaje 25 en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará: un saco de arroz, un balde de aceite y bolsa de fideos para su bodega.

Ella tienen 27 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, su esposos es profesor ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos .

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio, who belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") lending group, sells groceries and fresh vegetables. Her shop is located in the central market of her town in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.300 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and pasta for her shop.

Rocio, 26, is separated from her husband. She has a 5-year old daughter. With her business and her parent's help, she is making a better life for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rocio, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Emprendedoras, se a la venta de abarrotes y verduras ,su esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará: un saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 18 litros de aceite 10 filos de fideos balde de aceite y bolsa de fideos para su bodega.

Ella tienen 26 años de edad, es separada de su esposo tiene una hija de 5 años con su negocio y la ayuda de sus padres esta sacando adelante a su hija.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Luzmila

texts.es:
Vilma, who belongs to the Mujeres Emprendedoras ("Enterprising Women") lending group, makes a living selling cattle parts (the heart, tongue, and other cheaper cuts). Her stall is located in the central market of her town in Peru's "departamento" of Ancash. With the S/.300 loan, to be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy cattle parts in the town of Camal to sell them at retail.

Vilma, 31, is married and has 2 children. Her husband is an electrician and both work to educate their children and support the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Vilma, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres Emprendedoras, se dedica a la venta de menudencias de ganado vacuno ( corazón, lengua, bofes, patas), su puesto esta ubicado en el mercado central del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas , comprará corazón, bofe, patas lenguas del camal para venderlos al por menor.

Ella tienen 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposos es electricista ambos trabajan para educar a sus hijos y mantener su hogar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.en: Alba Marina defines herself as “an experienced woman” in spite of the fact that she just is eighteen years old.  Actually, two years ago, her parents allowed her get married, but shortly afterward she had to come back to her parents’ home as she broke up with her husband. Now, Alba runs a small cafeteria that she just started last month. She sells sandwiches, hamburgers, spaghetti, natural juices and the like. Alba explains that after making the first investment, she doesn’t have enough capital to keep running her café suitably. So, she’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials and other goods for her cafeteria. Alba hopes that her business can generate sufficient money so that she can put aside some money for her upcoming university studies.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of goods for her small cafeteria.

loans.name: Eduardina

texts.en: Eduardina is forty-two years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of them boys and all of whom go to school. For eleven years, Eduardina has been selling fresh meat in her lovely Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. Her husband helps her operating the business, and now she has a well-established clientele. This activity is the main source of income of the family, so Eduardina is nervous about the challenge of producing sufficient money to face all the family’s issues. With her loan, she will purchase a large quantity of meat so that she can increase considerably the sales volume and her revenue. The entrepreneur explains that supporting her children’s education is her most important goal for the future.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh meat to resell in her community.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a young mother of two children and a budding entrepreneur.  She’s recently started a small grocery store, which will help her keep supporting her family.  As her business is in her initial phase, it’s not generating the amount of income the entrepreneur needs to boost it and face all her financial issues. Therefore, Martina is requesting a loan to keep investing in the purchase of different goods to supply her store. The businesswoman hopes that her grocery store can grow insomuch as she’ll get a well established clientele and before long improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of many goods to restock a grocery store.

loans.name: Maura's Group

texts.en:
Maura is the coordinator of a group of five women, all of whom are entrepreneurs which operate their own businesses in the Los R. community of San Cristobal. Maura is fifty-eight years old and a proud mother of seven grownup sons, each one living with his respective family. Maura explains that her husband passed away eight years ago and she was left alone to face all the responsibilities. She spent almost all her savings to start a small cafeteria. She explains that in the beginning, it was really difficult to run the cafeteria. She remembers that she had to face an arduous competition, and the access to capital was complicated.

Now, Maura’s cafeteria is relatively stable and she has a lot of customers that visit her everyday to enjoy her appetizing plates. Maura would like to leave the local stall (made of wood) within which she’s operating her cafeteria and build a concrete one in a few years. With her loan, Maura will buy raw materials and other goods to prepare her food and keep satisfying her clients.

The members of Maura’s group are: Santa Patricia S. C., a grocery store’s owner; Yenny Gabriela R. A., to invest in her store; Anicia S. C. will buy more goods for her clothing store; Fiordaliza S. G., to purchase women’s clothing to resell in her community.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and many other goods for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Mrs. Seam M. is a widow with six children, three sons and three daughters. Two of her children are married and live on their own. One of her daughters works in a garment factory, one is in school, one of her sons helps her run the farm and the youngest child stays at home. Her husband died in 2006. The family lives about 15 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Seam has been a farmer for over 30 years and grows many kinds of crops, depending on the season. Currently, she is growing tomatoes and bananas.

She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a water pump and build a rest room.

loans.use: To buy a pumping machine and build a rest room.

loans.name: Mony

texts.en:
Mrs. Mony S. and her husband were married in 1995 and have two daughters. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mony started weaving silk earlier this year. It’s skill she learned from her neighbor. Before starting this business, she sold vegetables at a market in Phnom Penh. For the past eight years, her husband has made a living as a mason.

She has applied for a loan of $100 to buy silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Kimsoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimsoeun S. and her husband were married in 2000 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Kimsoeun has been a silk weaver for eight years. It’s skill she learned from her husband. She sells her finished products to a middleman in her village, who sells them in Phnom Penh. For the past four years, her husband has made a living raising pigs.

Mrs. Kimsoeun is requesting a loan $1,000 to buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving and to repair her house.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai M. and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Mak, were married in 1991 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mai has been in the business of selling fish for four years and also works as a mason. His wife has sold fish for 17 years. She buys them wholesale, and resells them at nearby Ta Khmao market. Together, they earn between 30,000- 40,000 riel per day.

Mr. Mai has applied for a loan of $500 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Hol

texts.en:
Mr. Hol H. and his wife were married in 1984 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Their oldest son is a fisherman and the other four children are in school. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
