Mr. Hol has worked as a mason in his village and a nearby province for 12 years. For the last year, his wife has earned an income raising fish.

Mr. Hol is requesting a loan of $1,000 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Mrs. Rina Y. and her husband were married last year and just had their first child. They live with her mother and two brothers, who work full-time in Phnom Penh, on an island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from the city.

For the last 10 years, Mrs. Rina has made a living weaving silk, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her products to a middleman in her village, who sells them in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Rina is requesting a loan of $300 to buy a motorbike for her brother use to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for brother use at work.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 32 years old and is married woman. Rehema is a fruits and vegetables seller, a business she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 6am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $95 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and is single woman with one child, age two. Asha is a vegetable and fruits seller. Every day, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Tunu's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Tunu is 34 years old and is a divorced woman with four children, ages 17, 15, 13 and 6. Tunu sells GLND vitamins and supplements. She started in 2006 and every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more GLND drug products for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members Habiba and Grace, who have food vending businesses.

loans.use: To buy more GLND drug products for her business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married woman with one child, age two. Bahati is a bed sheet and clothes seller. She started the business in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more bed sheets and other clothes for her business.

loans.use: To  buy more items for her clothes business.

loans.name: Janeth's Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Janeth is 27 years old and is married woman with one child, aged three. Janeth is a soft drinks seller, a business she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 8am to 3pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $200 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more drinks (soda, juice and water) for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group member Samiu, who has a food vending business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her business.

loans.name: Lina's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Lina is 26 years old and is a single woman. Lina owns a small food store and she also sells clothes. She works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $220 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase her stock of food and clothes to sell. She will share this loan with Tausi, who has a business as a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy more food and clothing inventory.

loans.name: Salha's Furaha Group

texts.en:
Salha is 21 years old and married with one 10-month-old child. Salha sells shoes, a business she started in 2007. She works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to increase her stock of shoes for her business. She will share this loan with Veronica, who has a business making batik.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of shoes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 28 years old and single, with one 4-year-old child. Halima owns a small food store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $170.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items, such as rice, beans and flour.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Amina's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Amina is 39 years old and a widow with three children, ages 19, 15 and 13. Amina owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm at her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her shop. She will share this loan with her group members Amina, Fatma and Munira, who have businesses dealing in food vending and fish selling.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her food market.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 36 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 16,14 and 5 years old. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children. Mariam owns a small cafe, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items( chairs, tables and microwave) for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy more items(chairs, tables and microwave) for her cafe

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 36 years old and married. She has three children, ages 5, 14 and 16; she and her husband also take care of four other children.

Mariam owns a small cafe, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 7am to 9pm at her cafe and earns a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chairs, tables and a microwave for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy more items for her cafe.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She and her husband also take care of three other children. Elizabeth sells charcoal, a job she started in 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal inventory for her business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 40 years old and married, with three children. She and her husband also take care of four other children.

Salma owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food inventory, such as bananas, rice and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a single woman. Mwanaidi owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. She works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $310 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory, such as blue band, juice, rice and flour.

loans.use: To increase the inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Stamil

texts.en:
Stamil is 34 years old and married, with three children. She and her husband also care for three other children.

Stamil owns a small food crops store, which she started in 2003. Every day she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $225 from her sales.

She is applying for a loan to buy more food crops, such as rice, bean, peas and maize.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni is a single woman with three children, ages 17, 20 and 23. She also cares for three other children. Semeni sells clothes, a business she started in 2000. Every day she works from 7am to 3pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes inventory for business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 29 years old and is a single woman with two children, ages 11 and 6. She also cares for three other children.

Sophia owns a small food market, which she started in 2007. Every day she works from 7am to 7pm at her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her market.

loans.name: Lawama

texts.en:
Lawama is 32 years old and married with three children, ages 13, 9 and 2. Lawama owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food inventory for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a single woman with two children, ages 12 and 18. Zuhura started tailoring in 2000. Every day she works from 10am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $500 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring supplies for her business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing supplies.

loans.name: Beas's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Beas is 33 years old and married; she has two children, ages 16 and 20. Beas owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her group members Rosy and Tatu, who have businesses in vegetable sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Sweetbetha's Dhamana Group

texts.en:
Sweetbetha is 35 years old and married, with two children, ages 20 and 7. Sweetbetha owns a small food vending store and grocery, which she started in 2008. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $95 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food and grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with Grace, who also has a grocery business.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her food shop.

loans.name: Maliserina's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Maliserina is 40 years old and married; she has two children, ages 12 and 22. Maliserina owns a small food store, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with Linda, who also has a business in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food stock for her business.

loans.name: Pendo's Matumaini Group

texts.en:
Pendo is a single woman with one 8-month-old child. Pendo sells soup and clothing; she started in 2007. Every day she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes -- khanga -- for her business. She will share this loan with Mwajuma, who has a business selling fish.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Ashura's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Ashura is 35-years-old and is married, with 2 children, ages 12 and 17. She and her husband also take care of three other people, ages 60, 25 and 17.

Ashura owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2005. Everyday she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery supplies, such as beer and soda, for her business.

Ashura will share this loan with her group members Tunu, Elizabeth, Rehema and Frida, who have businesses dealing in groceries, food vending and salons.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a married woman with two children, ages 2 and 15. Yusta owns a small restaurant, which she started in 2007. Everyday she works from 8am to 5pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy supplies for her restaurant, such as a chair, table and thermos.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Hadija's Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 38 years old and married, with two children, ages 11 and 13. Hadija sells soft drinks, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 7:30am to 2pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her group members Ester, Salma, Sofia and Raufu, who have businesses dealing in food vending, charcoal sales and soft drink sales.

loans.use: To buy more soft drink items for her business.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is a married woman with four children, ages 28, 23,19 and 16 years old. She and her husband also take care of another 4-year-old child.

Felista sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. Everyday she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima B. is from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is married.  Her husband runs a small restaurant where he bakes and sells wheat chapattis. She stays at home and make ice cream sticks. She lives in a family house with her in-laws. Her loan group consists of: Nasreen B. (who will invest in her family’s fruits business), Zubaida B. (who is borrowing for her sugar cane business) and Asiah B. (who sells ready made garments). 
These women have been together for a long time and practice values such as punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to expand her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Asiah's Group

texts.en: My name is Asiah L.. I was married eleven years ago and have four kids: three boys and one girl. All of my kids attend school except my daughter who is not yet of school-going age. I have enrolled my kids in school so that they do not have to do menial jobs like my husband and I and can earn a decent living for themselves. My husband sells milk while I make zippers. We need a loan to expand our milk business by buying a dairy cow. My loan group includes: Kishwer B.( her husband drives a horse cart), Kubra B. (who embroiders clothes) and Parween A. (who runs a tea stall).

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana K. is the group leader. She is married and a mother of seven: three boys and four girls. Her family resides in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore. Her husband makes a living driving a horse cart.  He also knows how to tailor clothing. He transports wood based on orders in his cart.  He needs a loan to buy an additional cart for the business to increase his income. The other women in the group are: Zubaida B. (who wants to buy a horse), Balqees B. (who will buy a horse cart) and Kalsoom B. (who needs this loan for her husband who is a turner).

loans.use: to buy an additional cartt

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en: Farzana M. is from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. She was born in the small city of Sheikhupura but moved to Lahore after she got married. She have five kids: two girls and three boys. Her husband drives a horse cart and she makes electric switches for order from a nearby factory. Her husband needs to purchase a horse and thus requires a loan. Her fellow group members are: Reshman B. (who manufactures snacks), Firdos B. and Shahnaz B. (who both embroider clothes).

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: Nasreen A. is widow with five kids: four boys and one girl. Her sons are the breadwinners of the family. One of her sons manufactures traditional blankets known as razai. He has a small factory where he manufactures these blankets with the help of a few other workers. Her son now requires a loan to expand his business so that he can manufacture blankets in a large quantity and thus double his profits.  Her loan group members are: Arshad B. (who sells animal fodder), Samina B. (who sells milk), Walayat B. (who wants to purchase a horse cart) and Naseem B. (who will invest in her family’s tea stall).

loans.use: to expand a blanket manufacturing business

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
I was married 16 years ago and have three kids: one girl and two boys. My eldest daughter is in grade eleven whereas the boys are in grades eight and five respectively.  I reside with my family in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. My husband works at a local factory while I sell cloth. I travel to the city of Faisalabad to buy cloth to sell.  I am requesting a loan to buy summer suiting for my business.  My loan group members are: Shugufta B. (who runs a laundry) and Suriya L. (whose husband is a turner).
This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed amongst the members. The members will either invest in their own businesses or those of their family members.

loans.use: to expand her cloth business

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en: I am Mariam I. from Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two sons, both of whom attend a local school. My husband has run a canteen in one of the local schools for the last eight years. I help him to prepare snacks for his canteen.  My loan group consists of: Rubina B. (who sews clothes to order), Anwer J. (her husband is a turner) as well as Shamshad A. and Nazia B. (both are borrowing for their families’ construction business).

loans.use: to expand the cafeteria situated in a local school

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: I am Rehana Z.. I have been married for 12 years and have two kids: one boy and one girl. My son attends a local school whereas my daughter is too young to attend a school. My husband and I stitch bags.  We have employed a few workers to help us. I have been joined in my loan group by: Nighat B. (who sews clothes), Parween R. (who will buy construction supplies), Nusrat S. (who is borrowing for her turning business). This group of women have spent many years together and during this period have learned to be punctual, responsible and cooperative.

loans.use: to expand bag-making business

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en: My name is Jameela A.. I am married and a mother of eight: four boys and four girls. I reside with my family in Lahore, Pakistan. My husband is a daily wage laborer and I sew bags. I have been sewing bags for the last 25 years. I would like to acquire a loan from Kiva to further expand my business. My loan group members are: Fatima Asghar (who is borrowing for her butcher shop), Yasmeen (who also sews bags) and Safia B. (who trades used items).

loans.use: to expand my bag stitching business

loans.name: Sarfraz's Group

texts.en: Sarfraz has been married for the last twenty years and has six children: two boys and four girls.  She lives in the big city of Lahore in Pakistan. None of her kids could attend school because of poor financial conditions. Her and her husband make wood and beaded curtains. These are very beautiful curtains that are used as decorative items in homes.  They need a loan to buy wood and beads in bulk.  Her group also includes the following women: Riffat B. (who wants to buy tires for her vehicle), Nabeela B. (who embellishes clothes with sequins and gems), Mubeena B. (who will buy a rickshaw) and Nargis B. (who wants to expand her family’s used items business).

loans.use: to expand a manufacturing business

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en: Sobia A. is the group leader of a small group of five women. She married a couple of years ago and has one daughter who is one and a half years old. Sobia’s husband works at a local factory and earns a meager income. He feels the need to start his own business and therefore needs a loan. He will use the loan to start an auto spare parts shop. He is very hopeful and wants to increase his income to give a better future to his daughter. Sobia’s group members are: Venice B. (who wants to buy iron for her business), Azra B. (who will buy a dairy cow for her milk business), Sughran B. (who wants to buy spare parts) and Rubina S. (who will buy construction supplies).

loans.use: to start an auto spare parts business

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween S. and I reside in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I have been living here for the last 35 years. I am a widow with two kids: one girl and one boy. My daughter is in 5th grade in a local school whereas my son trades used silver and copper items. He is the only breadwinner in the family and we need to expand his business. With the loan. he will buy used items in larger quantities thereby increasing our profits. My loan group also includes: Tahira B. (who will invest in her family’s auto spare parts business), Nargis B. (who will bolster her used iron items sales), Akberi B. (whose family manufactures shoes), and Ashi J. (who wants to buy iron objects).

loans.use: Enlarge used items business

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en: Irshad R. is married and a mother of five.  She has two daughters and three sons. She moved to Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan, seven years ago from a small city named Muridkay.  Both of her daughters are married and live away from home.  Her sons all trade fruits between cities. Irshad’s husband remains sick and does not work anymore. Summer has just started and mangoes will be high in demand. Her sons plan to buy a truck of mangoes and sell it to increase their income. The other group members in her loan group are: Razia B. (a widow whose sons manufacture school bags), Asma H. (her husband is an electrician and will buy a drill machine and a grinder), Nasira T. (her husband runs a restaurant and needs to buy new crockery).  Lastly, Asiah S. wants to improve her general store.

loans.use: to buy a truck of mangoes

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: My name is Nasreen K.. I am married and mother of five: four boys and one girl. Three of my sons are currently working while one boy and one girl attend school. I sell clothing to people in my neighborhood. I buy from the clothing from a market in Faisalabad, a mid size city in Pakistan. My loan will allow me to buy summer suiting in bulk. I have been joined in my loan group by Shahnaz B. (who wants to buy tires for her tire store), Saima S. (who will buy auto spare parts), Talat Y. (who wants to expand her telephone and mobile calling card business), and Nasreen K. (who will buy crockery for her husband's business).

loans.use: to expand clothing sales

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia Z. is a group leader of a few other women who reside in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. She is married and has three kids: two boys and one girl. Her eldest son and daughter are enrolled in a local school whereas the youngest boy is too small to attend school. Razia’s husband trades used spare parts in the city’s biggest auto spare parts market named “Bilalgung.” With this loan they plan to expand their business of selling spare parts. Razia has been joined in her loan group by five other women who include: Sidra M. (her husband trades used iron objects), Kubra A. (whose family trades silver and copper objects), Azra S. (her husband trades silver items), Sabha A. (her husband manufactures shoes) and Azra B..

loans.use: to expand a spare parts business

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: Arshad B. is the wife of Jalal Din and resides with her family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. Her other family members are two daughters and two boys. Both of her boys could not attend school due to various financial problems but she has now managed to send her daughters to school. Her husband works at a convenience store and both her boys supplies construction supplies. Sabra J. wants to buy CDs for their video centre; Shabana I. will also invest in her business; Azra M. needs to buy a new horse for their horse cart and Sadia B.’s husband deals in spare parts.

loans.use: expand construction supplies business

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: Arshad B. is the wife of Jalal Din and resides with her family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. Her other family members are two daughters and two boys. Both of her boys could not attend school due to various financial problems but she has now managed to send her daughters to school. Her husband works at a convenience store and both her boys supplies construction supplies. Sabra J. wants to buy CDs for their video centre; Shabana I. will also invest in her business; Azra M. needs to buy a new horse for their horse cart and Sadia B.’s husband deals in spare parts.

loans.use: expand construction supplies business

loans.name: Arshad's Group

texts.en: Arshad B. is the wife of Jalal Din.  She resides with her family in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan.  She has two daughters and two sons. Both of her sons could not attend school due to various financial problems.  However,  she has now managed to send her daughters to school. Her husband works at a convenience store and both her sons work at a business that sells construction supplies. Arshad is joined in her group by Sabra J. (who wants to buy CDs for her video centre), Shabana I. (who will invest in her business), Azra M. (who needs to buy a new horse for her horse cart) and Sadia B. (whose husband deals in spare parts).

loans.use: to expand a construction supplies business

loans.name: Rukkiah's Group

texts.en: I am a widow who has nine children: five boys and four girls. Five of my kids are married. Four of them live elsewhere while the others live with me. I am borrowing for third time from Asasah, a microfinance institution, for my son’s embroidery business. He has hired a few workers for the business. Wedding season has just begun and my son has started getting orders for embroidered clothes.  Therefore, he needs a loan to buy cloth, beads and thread in bulk. I would like to borrow in a group.  The other women include: Shahnaz B. (who will invest her share of the loan in her son’s motorbike spare parts business), Basheeran B. (who will buy a sewing machine and dress making material with the loan), and Riffat R. (who is borrowing  for her husband’s electronics store).

loans.use: to buy material to make embroidered dresses

loans.name: Walayat's Group

texts.en: I am Walayat M. from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and have six kids: four boys and two girls. I could not educate any of my kids due to very poor economic conditions a few years ago. My husband is a retired officer and one of my sons manufactures shoes. This is the busy season and therefore my son wants to manufacture shoes in a larger quantity.  However, he lacks the required finances. As a group of women, we are requesting a loan.  The group includes: Suriya R. (who needs the loan to buy a bull cart), Farzana Z. (her husband manufactures shoe buckles), Shahnaz A. (who will use the loan to fix her family’s rickshaw) and Suriya B. (who wants to buy a lathe (a machine used to turn objects)).  All of us are in need of this loan and your help can bring prominent change in our lives.

loans.use: to manufacture shoes in bulk

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Rukhsana B. and I am a group leader from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. I am married and have four kids, three of whom attend a local school. I am very hopeful for my childrens’ future and pray to God to give them all of the luxuries in life that my husband and I could not provide them. My husband manufactures a special type of bolt that is used in various vehicles. By expanding our business, we hope that our income will increase.  Therefore, I would like to borrow in a group, with a few other women, who include: Rani N. (whose son has a video games centre); Rafia B. (who manufactures thread), Zubaida B. and Yasmeen B. (who both manufacture electric plugs).
The responsibility to repay the loan rests on all of the group members.  As their group leader, I assure you of timely repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to expand her manufacturing business

loans.name: Zareena's Group

texts.en: Zareena B., the group leader, resides in Lahore, a big city in Pakistan. She is married and has three kids, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. She is a health worker and her husband make thread reels. He has been making these reels for more than 15 years. Now, they wish to expand their business though a loan.  Zareena B.’s sub group members are: Sumaira B. (who has a family business of manufacturing shoe buckles), Uzma S. (who has an electric store), Rafia B. (who buys and sells vests), and Parween B. (who wants to buy her son a rickshaw.)

loans.use: to expand her thread reels business

loans.name: Burna's Group

texts.en:
I am Burna G., the group leader. I am married and a mother of two, both of my children attend a neighboring school. We live in Pakistan’s second largest city Lahore. To earn a living my husband manufactures shoe buckles. He has 16 years of experience manufacturing these buckles. His income is just enough to cover the major household expenses. By acquiring a loan, we plan to improve and expand our business further.

I would like to borrow in a group of several other women who are also in need of loans. Rafia M. and Seema B. also want to invest in their shoe buckle businesses; Nasreen B.’s son also manufactures shoe buckles and Rehana K. embroiders clothes with threads and sequins.

loans.use: to mass manufacture shoe buckles

loans.name: Seema's Group

texts.en:
Seema S. is a group leader. She is married and has six kids, all of whom attend a local school. Seema’s husband manufactures thread reels. He has invested a several loans in his business previously, which allowed him to continue sending his kids to school. Now, they require a loan to expand their business further.

The women in the group all reside in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Seema’s subgroup members are: Yasmeen (who has a grocery store), Asma S. (her husband is a welder) and Rehana B. (who has a thread manufacturing business). Lastly, Safia B. is a widow who has a printing press.

loans.use: to expand the manufacture of thread reels

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro Pablo P. is a native of the municipality of Cinco Pinos in the city of Chinandega, and has a business selling clothing, pillows and some small appliances, which he offers to clients from his home . He is a hard-working gentleman who has managed to provide his family (wife and two children) with what is needed to survive.

Today, Mr. P. urgently needs to acquire financing to buy merchandise. For this reason he is looking for help from Ceprodel to receive a loan which will allow him to buy clothing, pillows and some small appliances to sell and in this way, to continue to support his household.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro Pablo P. es un caballero originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega el cual se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa, almohadas y algunos electrodomésticos vendiéndolos en su casa de habitación donde los oferta a sus clientes. Es un caballero muy esforzado que ha logrado proporcionar a su familia (cónyuge y dos hijos) las condiciones necesarias para subsistir.

Hoy en día, la necesidad que el caballero P. atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de su mercadería, por ello es que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para recibir el crédito que le permita realizar la compra de la ropa, almohadas y algunos electrodomésticos para luego comercializarlos y así continuar con el sostenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela T. is a native of the municipality of Condega and works selling cosmetics and shoes. She has her own store and over the past months, has been buying goods and investing in the business.

Now she urgently needs to buy products to sell, and for this reason she has approached Ceprodel for a loan which will enable her to buy cosmetics and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Angela T. es una dama originaria del municipio de Condega el cual se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y calzados atendiendo en su establecimiento que a través de los meses ha venido surtiendo e invirtiendo en su negocio. Es necesario destacar que esta dama es soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su pequeño hijo. Por esta razón es que ella hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez para con su infante.

Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la urgente compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización, es por este motivo que ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan obtener el recurso económico para la compra de los cosméticos y los zapatos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa Amelia P. R. is single and lives in Condega. She has been in business for the past 25 years and is a hairdresser. All her life she has worked in this area and has her own beauty salon in town. She takes care of expenses for her son´s education with the income from her business.

She has requested loans from Ceprodel to purchase products for her salon, and this has also allowed her to improve her customer service. Today once again she has approached Ceprodel for a loan which will enable her to buy products such as talcum powder, dyes, creams, etc. She confidently awaits approval of her loan, knowing that this will help her to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Rosa Amelia P. R. es soltera y del domicilio de Condega, es comerciante desde hace 25 años y se dedica al estilismo. Toda la vida se ha dedicado al trabajo de la belleza teniendo su propio salón de belleza en esta localidad. Cabe señalara que ella costea los gastos de estudio de su hijo a través de los ingresos de su negocio.

Ella ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para la compra de productos para el salón, estos le sirven también para mejorar la atención a su clientela. Hoy en día una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la adquisición de los productos tales como talco, tintes, cremas, etc. Es por eso que muy confiadamente espera la aprobación del crédito sabiendo que le será para beneficio y desarrollo de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is seventy years old and has been selling shoes, blouses and shirts for more than twenty years in the Itabo community of San Cristobal. Each day, Victoria sets out all her goods on her display table, and her customers as well as passers-by visit her to buy her goods.  The entrepreneur wants to add a wider variety of goods to her stock. 
Victoria also explains that her husband is getting old and can work no more.  So, she has to support her family on her own.  Victoria hopes that her business growth will help her and her husband enjoy a better future.

loans.use: To restock a small business of selling clothing.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol, hard-working and multifaceted entrepreneur and mother of three school-going children, owns a small lottery bank and sells shoes, tennis shoes and other goods to the women of her community.  She has been selling these goods for more than ten years. Marisol explains that it’s a very hard task to keep up three children and have to pay the rental of the house.  Nonetheless, she says she’ll keep doing her best to provide good education to them. With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy more goods to continue satisfying her clientele’s need and increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy shoes and tennis shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
"On weekends, I sell second-hand goods in different neighborhoods. I sell clothing, shoes and some small appliances. My request is to be able to supply my business and in that way, have more sales. I would like to buy seasonal clothing since the hot weather season is almost here. The amount I am requesting is US$ 700."

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Los fines de semana tengo una venta de segunda en diferentes colonias, vendo ropa, calzado y algunos aparatos eléctricos, mi solicitud es para poder surtir mi negocio y así tener más ventas, me gustaría comprar ropa de temporada ya que se acerca el tiempo de calor; la cantidad que solicito es de $750.00 dll

loans.use: Buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Ms. Estela M. has been devoted to her grocery store business, located at her home, for the past five years, in the Cinco Pinos area of the Chinandega region. It is necessary to point out that this young woman is mother of three children and, along with her husband, makes a great effort in order to provide them with the living conditions they deserve.

The need Estela is presently facing is the immediate acquisition of food and personal use products for her business. For this reason she has sought Ceprodel’s support who, for the past three years, has provided her with the opportunity to improve her business, by granting loans for purchase of merchandise. With this support she has managed to stock up her store and improve the financial conditions of her household.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Estela M. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería, el cual tiene desde hace cinco años en su casa de habitación. Es necesario destacar que esta joven dama es madre de tres hijos y, junto con su esposo, se esfuerza para brindarle las condiciones de vida que ellos se merecen.

La necesidad atravesada actualmente por Estela es la adquisición inmediata de los productos comestibles y personales para el negocio. Es por ello que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel, quien desde hace tres años le ha brindado la oportunidad de desarrollarse por medio de la entrega de créditos para la adquisición de sus productos. Es necesario reconocer que con este apoyo ella logra la compra de la mercadería y por ende es beneficiada en el mejoramiento de la condición económica de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Mercedes' Group

texts.en:
Mercedes coordinates the activities of a group of five women, all of whom are operating businesses in the Los R. community of San Cristobal. Mercedes sells tablecloths, curtains, bed sheets and the like to the women of the community. The entrepreneur has five sons who range from thirteen to twenty years old. Mercedes explains that this activity is the principal source of income of the family. Her husband is currently unemployed. With her loan, the businesswoman will buy more goods to offer to her customers in order to increase her revenue and improve her family’s living conditions.

The members of Mercedes’ group are: Adargiza R. G., to sell clothing in bulk; Lucrecia Carmona M., to invest in the buy of clothing for her business; Juana Yabelin S., to add new styles of shoes to her stock; Olga J., to buy clothing for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of curtains, bed sheets and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Francisca Isabel N. M. is a married woman who works with the help of her husband in clothing sales, which has given them good results and a good income, and she has been able to improve the business. She sells clothes in the town of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega by traveling through the streets, and thus exposing herself to the physical exhaustion brought about by the sun.

Now Señora N. has seen good results thanks to her great efforts by going out to sell her merchandise in the community. Presently her need is the prompt acquisition of clothes to sell. It is for this reason she seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the merchandise to sell and in this way continue to sustain her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Francisca Isabel N. M. es una mujer casada que ha venido desempeñando buena labor con la ayuda de su esposo en su trabajo de venta de ropa el cual le ha dado buenos resultados ya que ha obtenido buenos ingresos y ha mejorado en parte la condición de su negocio. Su venta de ropa la lleva a cabo en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega vendiendo ambulantemente por las calles de la comunidad exponiéndose al desgaste físico proporcionado por el sol.

Hoy en día, la señora N. ha visto buenos resultados gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por salir a vender su mercadería fuera de la comunidad. Actualmente la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la pronta adquisición de la ropa para la venta. Es por ello que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir de sus proveedores su mercadería para venderla y así continuar con el sustento de su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Andrez

texts.es:
Andrez' family is comprised of two people, he and his wife (who is currently pregnant). Andrez runs a transportation business - he transports people by motorcycle in his town, but considers that he possesses a "medium" skill level, because there are others who are engaged in the same business.

This loan request is for the purchase of a new bike. The price varies depending on the year, make and engine capacity. His credit history is very favorable, and all previous loans have been paid off in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La familia de Andrez está compuesta por dos personas, él y su esposa que actualmente está embarazada. Andrez se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en la zona de Warnes como mototaxista, su nivel de competencia es medio debido a que hay otras personas que se dedican a la misma actividad. La presente solicitud es para la compra de una nueva moto, el precio de la misma varia dependiendo el año, la marca y la cilindrada. Sus antecedentes crediticios son muy buenos ya que los créditos que obtuvo con anterioridad los canceló de manera puntual.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his transportation business. (Compra de moto nueva)

loans.name: Mario Eugenio

texts.es:
A business in carpentry is something that requires a lot of dedication and experience if you want to develop work/pieces that are accurately made and intricate. In the town of Cinco Pinos (city of Chinandega), Mr. Mario Lopez works at constructing furniture for the home. He works in his own shop and has managed to improve it by buying the machinery necessary in order to carry out his work.

Now, he has gone to Ceprodel to apply for a loan which will enable him to purchase more wood for the production of furniture. This business allows him to support his home's expenses and family, which consists of his wife and two children whom he loves a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de carpintería es una labor que requiere de mucha dedicación por lo que se necesita tener muy alta experiencia para elaborar las piezas con mucha exactitud y destreza. En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Mario L. se dedica a la elaboración de muebles para el hogar teniendo su propio establecimiento que ha logrado mejorar por lo que ha adquirido la maquinaria necesaria para llevar a cabo esta labor.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir la madera para la elaboración de muebles. Con este negocio él lleva el sustento a su hogar de habitación compuesto por su esposa y sus dos hijos a los que ama mucho.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to make more furniture. (Compra de la madera para la elaboracion de los muebles)

loans.name: Nimio

texts.es:
Mr. Nimio Cardenas manufactures tiles and panel doors, in the Cinco Pinos area of the city of Chinandega. He has his own shop, equipped with an oven to bake the products and ample space to carry out the drying and hardening process.

He has been devoted to this business for several years, during which he has managed to improve the business and increase production levels. He presently faces financial difficulties and is thus seeking Ceprodel’s support. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for the manufacturing of tiles and panel doors, to be sold to his loyal local clients.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega el caballero Nimio C. se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de cuarterones y tejas, teniendo su propio establecimiento donde posee un horno para quemar el producto en proceso y además un local amplio donde se lleva a cabo el proceso de secado y endurecimiento.

Se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace varios años, en el cual ha logrado salir adelante llevando a cabo mayores niveles de producción en el negocio. Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa es la urgencia de acceso al recurso económico por lo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las tejas y cuartones para comercializarlas a sus fieles clientes en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to manufacture tiles and panel doors.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
There are six people in Ignacio's family: his five children who are ages 15,13,12, 9, and 7 years old, and himself. Ignacio has been a widower for some time.

He collects plastics, fish baits, glass, iron, and other recyclable materials. In the marketplace, he is assessed to be a worker of mediocre competence since there are others who do the same work.

The loan he needs presently is to buy more basic material whose prices are still minimal. Ignacio already solicited other loans previously and paid them off in a punctual and responsible manner. Thus, he has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

La familia de ignacio está compuesta por seis personas, sus cinco hijos que son de 15, 13, 12, 9 y 7 años respectivamente y él. Ignacio quedo viudo hace un tiempo atrás.

Se dedica a la recolección de plásticos , cebo, vidrio, fierros y otros materiales los cuales los entrega a las recicladoras. La competencia de Ignacio en el mercado es de nivel medio ya que también hay otras personas que se dedican a esta actividad.

el presente prestamo lo requiere para la adquisición de materia prima en general cuyos precios son mínimos. ignacio ya solicitó con anterioridad otros créditos los cuales canceló de manera puntual y responsable por lo que tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is an obstetrician (childbirth physician). Thanks to her studies she has been able to obtain a position with a state institution. During the morning she attends to patients in the emergency room and in the afternoon she gives her time to medical attention in her own doctor's office. Just recenlty, she started selling medical and beauty products also. She works mostly with women, and for fifteen years she has given women gynecology services and family planning.

At first she worked only in the emergency room but her dream was to have her own office, and with determination and effort she achieved it. Now her goal is to complement her office with a small pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gloria es de profesión obstreta. Gracias a sus estudios ella ha podido obtener un puesto de trabajo en una institución del estado. Durante las mañanas ella atiende a pacientes en una posta medica y por las tardes, dedica su tiempo a la atención medica en su propio consultorio y, desde hace muy poco tiempo, a la venta de productos medicinales y de belleza también. Su trato es básicamente con mujeres, ella se encarga de darles atención en ginecología y en planificación familiar desde hace quince años. Al inicio ella solo trabaja en la posta medica pero su sueño era tener un consultorio propio es por eso que a base de empeño y esfuerzo lo consiguió, ahora sus meta es complementar su consultorio con una farmacia-bazar.

loans.use: Add more products to her mini pharmacy.

loans.name: Mirian Vanessa

texts.es:
Miriam and her husband are rural teachers and they also are dedicated to business in transportation and retail in a neighborhood shop.

The couple has two kids who are 8 and 4 years old. Miriam is pregnant again and there will be three children soon.

The salary that they receive as rural teachers is not sufficient, which is why they are required to work in additional activities like the neighborhood shop and the income from renting two light trucks for transportation from La Belgica (sugar refinery) to Warnes and back. Now they also rent four cars that bring in a daily income.

Her competition in the different jobs comes from the quantity of people who are also dedicated to these same activities.

The present loan is for working capital for her neighborhood shop with the goal of increasing her merchandise. She had previous loans which she paid back responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Miriam y su esposo son profesores rurales, también se dedican al negocio del transporte y cuentan con una tienda de barrio.

La pareja tienen dos hijos de 8 y 4 años respectivamente, Miriam se encuentra embarazada por lo que pronto serán tres hijos.

Los sueldos que reciben como maestros rurales no son suficientes por lo que requieren trabajar en otras actividades extra como son la tienda de barrio y los ingresos que genera el alquiler y uso de dos vagonetas haciendo el transporte de La Belgica (ingenio azucarero) - Warnes - La Belgica. Ahora también se dedican a la rente de cuatro motos de las cuales reciben ingresos diariamente.

Su competencia en los diferentes rubros es media por la cantidad de personas que también se dedican a las mismas actividades.

El presente crédito es para capital de trabajo para su tiendita de barrio, esto con el fin de incrementar la mercadería de la misma. Tuvo anteriores créditos los cuales cumplió responsablemente.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Angelica Norma

texts.es:
For twenty years Angélica has been working as a travelling sales person in the city center. At first she began working for a boss; however, as time passed, she felt she was becoming familiar enough with the business to make herself independent. And that's what she did; with a little bit of money, she began to make her own salary.

Presently she has two kids with her husband who also works as a sales person. In the mornings, Angélica is dedicated to household chores, mainly preparing the meals for the kids until school.

She and her husband, thanks to the economic income that they have enjoyed from their sales business, have two cars they rent out for use as taxis. They have lots of expectations for their business; they hope to buy in the near future two more cars to establish their business of taxi services.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Desde los veinte años Angélica trabaja como cambista ambulante en el centro de la ciudad. Al inicio ella empezó trabajando para un señor; no obstante, conforme pasaba el tiempo, ella sentía que iba conociendo lo suficiente de este negocio como para independizarse. Y así lo hizo, junto un poco de dinero y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta.

Actualmente, ella tiene dos hijos con su esposo quien también trabaja como cambista. Por las mañanas, Angélica se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, preparando principalmente los alimentos para sus hijos, aún escolares.

Ella y su esposo, a parte de gozar del ingreso económico de su oficio de cambista, tienen dos autos que los alquilan para ser trabajados como taxis. Con este negocio tienen muchas expectativas, pues esperan comprar dentro de poco dos autos más para establecer su empresa de servicios de taxi.

loans.use: Invest more in her business

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 32 years old and dedicated to painting and repairing automobiles. He is married to Silvia and has one son. Currently they live in a home that he rents and is located at Avenida 2 de Agosto.

Pedro has been fixing autos for several years and so he has lots of experience in this field. This is the main reason why he has a steady and loyal group of clients, causing the competition to be less of an issue for him.

The current loan is for acquiring materials and general items needed in a body shop. He has good previous credit and this equipment for his garage will allow him to attend to a greater quantity of clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Pedro de 32 años de edad se dedica al pintado y chaperío de automoviles, está casado con Silvia y tienen un hijo. Actualmente viven en un domicilio que alquila y que se encuentra ubicado por la avenida 2 de agosto.

Pedro se dedica al arreglo de vehículos desde hace varios años atrás, por lo que tiene mucha experiencia en su rubro. Esta es la razón principal por lo que cuenta con clientela fija y leal, haciendo que el impacto de la competencia sea menor.

El presente crédito es para la adquisición de materiales y accesorios de chaperio en general. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios además que el equipamiento de su taller le permitirá atender a una mayor cantidad de clientes.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es:
Together with her family, Yuly opened a small gym. A year ago, together with her husband, who works as a production supervisor at a factory, she decided to invest in a business that had the opportunity to grow. Little by little she has implemented her location with more machines. She tells us that all of the workers that help her at her gym are her family. One of her objectives when she opened her gym was to give work to her loved ones. Luckily, thanks to her effort and that of all of her family, the gym is going very well, and now, she has planned to open another one. For now, she has some machines, and she only needs the location. She also helps attend to her inlaws' store when she has time.

Her two children, who are 15- and 4-years-old, are Yuly and her husband's principal motive for getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Junto a su familia, Yuly abrió un pequeño gimnasio. Hace un año junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como supervisor de producción en una fábrica, decidió invertir en un negocio que tuviera la oportunidad de crecer. Poco a poco han ido implementando su local con más máquinas e inmuebles. Ella cuenta que todos los trabajadores que la ayudan en su gimnasio con su familia, pues uno de sus objetivos al abrir su gimnasio fue darles trabajo a sus seres queridos. Felizmente, gracias a su esfuerzo y al de toda la familia el gimnasio va bien y ahora, tiene planeado abrir uno más. Por ahora, ya tiene algunas maquinas solo le falta conseguir un local. Por otro lado, cuando tiene tiempo, también ayuda a atender en la bodega de sus suegros.

Sus dos hijos de quince y cuatro años son el principal motivo de Yuly y su esposo para progresar.

loans.use: To buy what's necessary to open her new gym location

loans.name: Gavino

texts.es:
Gavino sells groceries in the mobile markets on Virgen de Lujan avenue and Virgen de Cotoca avenue also. He also has a space in his home for selling cakes and snacks.

Gavino lives alone with his two kids who are older and have their own incomes.

He has been deciated to these businesses since five years ago and the competition in this business is raised due to the quantity of people selling the same things. His time in the business has allowed him to form a fixed group of clients who search for him to acquire the products that they need.

The current loan is for the acquisition of more merchandise. The prices vary on the type of the product and the market prices. This is his fourth loan with this institution and he has always proven to be a responsible and punctual person in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Gavino vende abarrotes en las ferias móviles de la avenida Virgen de Lujan y Virgen de Cotoca también cuenta con un puesto de pastillas y gaseosas en su domicilio.

Gavino vive sólo con sus dos hijos que son mayores de edad y cuentan con ingresos propios.

Se dedica a estos negocios desde hace mas de 5 años atrás y si bien la competencia en este rubro es elevada por la cantidad de personas que venden los mismos artículos, su antiguedad le permitió hacerse de clientela fija que lo buscan para adquirir sus productos que son de la canasta familiar.

La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de mayor mercadería y los precios de la misma varia dependiendo del tipo de producto y sobre todo de los precios que fija el mercado. Esta es su cuarta secuencia con la institución y siempre demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta, 37 years old, works selling party supplies, and at the same time she has a car which she runs as a taxi. Asunta is married and has two children. At the moment the family lives far apart. Her husband works as a contracted construction worker. Asunta has been making and selling party supplies for eight years, and her husband has been in his job for a long time also. There is competition in both fields, but the advantage of both is the length of time in which they have developed their expertise. This has allowed them to gain customers and good reputations. This loan is to buy a car to use as a taxi, and also to for its maintenance. This is Asunta’s fourth loan with the organization and she is always on time with payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Asunta de 37 años de edad se dedica a la venta de cotillón y paralelamente tiene un vehículo el cual lo alquila como taxi. Asunta es casada y tiene dos hijos, actualmente la familia vive en un lugar muy alejado. El esposo de Asunta trabaja como albañil contratista. Asunta elabora trabajos de cotillón y realiza esta actividad desde hace más de ocho años, al igual su esposo trabaja hace muchos años como albañil. Para ambas actividades existe competencia pero la ventaja de ambos es el tiempo de antiguedad que tienen desarrollando sus actividades, tiempo en el cuál lograron ganar clientela y prestigio. La presente solicitud es para la compra de un motor para el vehiculo que renta y también para su mantenimiento. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de la cliente en la institución y demostró ser puntuel en sus pagos.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a car

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Agrocapital, a partner of ACDI/VOCA - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
At seventy two years old, Evaristo is still committed to working. He is retired in the eyes of the government following thirty years working in a textiles factory. However, he prefers to spend his time working rather than resting at home. This is why, for five years, in the mornings, he has been selling sweets from a wheelbarrow outside a school. He decided to go into this line of work as he already had some experience in the field. Before working in the textiles factory he worked for several other people selling sweets. Of course, he was selling from something a bit bigger than a wheelbarrow in those days. On the other hand, in his house he also sells fizzy drinks, as well as other types of soft drink. He plans to work as long as his health allows him to, which is why he is looking to invest more money into his business. Today Evaristo lives with his wife, and his children have all moved out of the family home and live independently.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

A sus setenta y dos años de edad Evaristo es un hombre que aun se caracteriza por su empeño a la hora de trabajar. Él ya tiene el titulo del gobierno como jubilado gracias a su trabajo de casi treinta años en una fabrica de textil; sin embargo, él prefiere ocupar su tiempo trabajando en algo a quedarse descansado en su casa, es así que desde hace cinco años vende golosinas en un carretilla en los exteriores de un colegio por las mañanas. Se le ocurrió vender golosinas, puesto que ya había tenido experiencia en este negocio. Antes de trabajar en la fabrica textil contrató a un numero de personas para que vendan golosinas. En ese entonces contaba con más de una carretilla. Por otro lado, en su casa vende gaseosas y otras bebidas. Tiene planeado trabajar hasta cuando la salud se lo permita, aun así el busca invertir más en este negocio. Actualmente Evaristo vive solo con su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes.

loans.use: To stock more drinks to sell from home

loans.name: Mary Nora

texts.es:
Following her divorce from her husband, Mary realized that she needed to work to support herself. Despite receiving maintenance from her ex-husband, she no longer wants to rely on anyone else. This is what prompted her to look for different ways to earn money. She began selling clothes and dairy products, going from house to house, however it was not enough to rent a premises and open a shop or even to become a traveling seller. These days she has a secure client base, but she wants to invest more money in stock to sell to even more people. On the other hand, for two years now, Mary has been working together with a group of female friends preparing snacks and dinners for large events. This extra income has enabled her to support her two young children, aged eleven and nine. In the future, she plans to open a clothes shop and create a secure job for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una vez que se divorció de su esposo, Mary se vio en la necesidad de trabajar por cuenta propia. A pesar de que recibía la pensión de su ex esposo ya no quiso depender de nadie. Fue así que se animó a buscar diversas formas de cómo ganarse algún dinero. Empezó vendiendo ropa y productos lácteos ofreciéndolos casa por casa, pues no tenia lo suficiente como para alquilar un local para tienda o incluso para vender como ambulante. Hoy cuenta con un numero seguro de clientes, pero asegura que le gustaría invertir más en mercadería para vender a mas personas. Por otro lado, Mary, desde hace dos años, trabaja junto con un grupo de amigas preparando almuerzos o cenas para eventos grandes. Gracias a este trabajo a podido seguir manteniendo a sus hijos menores de once y nueve años. Mas adelante, ella planea poner una tienda de ropa y tener un trabajo estable.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business, selling clothes and dairy products.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel has a mechanics workshop where he offers his welding, bodywork and painting services. He personally runs the workshop whilst his wife sells clothes. Abel has been working in this same business for more than 20 years, which is why he has such vast experience in the field. Competence in this field is important, but Abel’s experience goes a long way which means he has a secure client base. This loan is to purchase a ramp for his worhsop, the price of which depends on the market. This is Abel’s third loan with the organisation and he is always on time with payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Abel tiene un taller de mecánica en el cuál presta sus servicios de soldadura, chaperío y pintura. el cliente atiende personalmente el taller, mientras que su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa. Abel se dedica a este negocio desde hace más de 20 años por lo que su experiencia en el rubro es elevada. La competencia en este rubro es elevada pero la experiencia de Abel tiene mucho peso ya que gracias a ella cuenta con clientela fija que perfiere sus servicios. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de una rampla para equipar el taller, el precio de la misma es variable dependiendo del mercado. Este es el tercer préstamo con la institución y siempre registro un comportamiento bueno en sus pagos.

loans.use: Workshop equipment

loans.name: Mir Abbas

texts.en: Mir Abbas lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated, married, and the father of two daughters. He was in Pakistan for a long time. He came back 2 years ago and opened a clothing shop where he sells children's clothes. He needs to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import more new designs of clothes for children to attract more customers and make a good income to support his family and make a better life in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To import more new designs of children's clothing

loans.name: Agha Gul

texts.en: Agha Gul lives with his own family in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is uneducated and he works in agriculture. He wants to improve his business but he doesn't have the means to do so at present so he wants to take a loan. He has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and buy more seeds for his land to make good income so that he can offer his children a better education. He is happy that people can help him solve his problem with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, etc.

loans.name: Shoub

texts.en: Shoub lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan.He is married and he has a carpentry shop in a busy place In Kabul. He has a good number of clients; people love his work. He need to complete his stock so he has requested an individual loan to complete his carpentry stock so as to make good monthly income for his family.  He is happy to be able to help them better.

loans.use: To complete his carpentry stock

loans.name: Raza

texts.en: Raza lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He has a metal shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. He is a very talented young man, so during these 5 years he has filled lots of contracts and made a big shop. He needs to complete his stock so he wants to take an individual loan to further his business with more success. He is happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete materials necessary for his business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, one of whom has asthma. He lives in a rented house and has an carpentry shop. He applied to get $1200 to purchase wood, a machine for cutting the wood, and new tools to help him in his work. He wants to increase his income to provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood and machine for cutting the wood

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 39 years old he has three children who are students. His old father lives with him and he is responsible of his treatment. He has a small general store and applied to get $1200 to purchase a new ice box and some new goods, make new shelves and paint the shop. He wants to expand his project and increase his income, and provide a good life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new ice box and some new goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and other goods to keep producing food for a small cafe.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is twenty-eight years old and a proud single mother of a four-year old daughter.  She sells a collection of earrings, necklace, rings and other silver jewels.  Michelle mentions that she wants to add hair care products to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and her income.  This way, the entrepreneur will be able to face her financial responsibilities and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of silver jewelry to resell in her community.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia, 47, is married with no child and lives with her husband in the Herrera community of Santo Domingo. For more than eight years, she has been operating a cafeteria which is well-known and visited by people of the community.

Francia plans on offering new typical Dominican dishes to her customers. This way, she’ll attract new people to her business and she’ll be able to increase her revenue. Francia hopes her business will allow her and her husband enjoy their golden years.

loans.use: To purchase many goods to keep operating a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is thirty-two years old, and she and her husband have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom go to school.

Martha has been selling beauty products for more than eight years. She has her showcase in her house, and from there she operates the business. The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to add perfumes and shoes to her stock so as to attract new people and increase her sales volume.

The entrepreneur’s business supports her children’s studies.

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and beauty products for a small business.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
Jade T. is an active and hard-working entrepreneur who lives in the Gelo community of San Cristobal, where she makes a living selling women’s clothing.  Since the entrepreneur doesn’t have a store from which to operate the business, she regularly visits her friends and other women of the nearby neighborhood.
Jade wants to buy some ‘a la mode’ clothing and other customer- recommended attire with her loan.  This way, she will augment her revenue and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Gladis Mercedes

texts.en:
Gladis Mercedes is a hard-working and active woman who lives in the Gelo community of San Cristobal, where she has been operating a small dress-making shop for more than fifteen years.  Gladis Mercedes explains that her well-established clientèle is very satisfied with her quality of work. Currently, the entrepreneur is asking for a loan to buy a decorative sewing machine which will allow her to improve her production of baby blankets and wedding gowns.
Gladis Mercedes hopes that her business’ growth will help her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of a used sewing machine to improve her production quality.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bulk-buy goods for a grocery store.

loans.name: Denia María

texts.en:
Denia María, 38 years old and the mother of five school-going children, sells shoes, pants, blouses and underwear in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal.  
The entrepreneur explains that while it is hard to support five children, she hopes that her business’ growth will help her face all financial issues and proviD. a comfortable lifestyle for her family.
With her loan, Denia María will buy more goods to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and consequently her revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra, 37 years old and a proud mother of two daughters (10 and 16 years old), owns and operates a small clothing business in her hometown of Batey of Palavé community in San Cristobal.
The entrepreneur humbly explains that while she is currently operating her business from home, she plans to put money asiD. in order to rent or buy a small local store in a few years.  With her loan, Sandra hopes to increase revenue by buying more clothing in bulk to add to her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing in bulk for a small store.

loans.name: Manuela Altagracia

texts.en:
Manuela Altagracia, a 23-year-old mother of two daughters, lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal.  To make a living and take care of her children, Manuela Altagracia sells pants to women in her community.
The entrepreneur explains that she wants to buy a house in a few years, but in the meantime she’ll keep working hard to move her business forward and improve her family’s living conditions.
With her loan, Manuela Altagracia will buy new styles of pants to resell in her community.

loans.use: Purchase of pants to restock a small clothing store.

loans.name: María Bartolina

texts.en: María Bartolina is 52 years old and sells candies and Yaniqueques, a fried dough snack, in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal.  Each day, the entrepreneur sets out all of the treats on her display table, and passers-by stop along the sidewalk to enjoy her snacks. María Bartolina now needs funds to invest in her business and add a wider variety of candies and sweets to her stock. The entrepreneur explains that this business supports her five children, and she hopes the loan will enhance her enterprise’s growth and eventually enable her to buy some nicer furniture for her home.

loans.use: Purchase of candies, cakes and Yaniqueques for a small business.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa is a single mother of a boy of two years. She began working selling delicacies on foot in a market. At present, she cooks for workers of a school that is located next to her house and at an institute where she once studied. At first she only cooked for a few people, but later she became known and each time more people requested her services. Nowadays, aside from selling her food to order, she works preparing buffets for some events with a group of friends. On the other hand, always with the objective to be able to give her son everything that he needs, on Sundays she prepares tamales (a Peruvian dish made from crushed corn) to sell them in the mornings.

In the future, she plans to have a shoe store, since her mother was dedicated to shoe sales from her youth and succeeded very well.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Vanessa es madre soltera de un niño de dos años. Ella empezó trabajando vendiendo golosinas como ambulante en un mercado. Actualmente, ella cocina para trabajadores de un colegio que se ubica frente a su casa y de un instituto donde ella estudio alguna vez. Al inicio, solo cocinaba para pocas personas, pero luego se fue haciendo conocida y cada vez más personas solicitaban su servicio. Hoy en día, aparte de vender su comida a pedido, trabaja preparando buffets para algunos eventos con un grupo de amigas. Por otro lado, siempre con el objetivo de poder darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita, los domingos prepara tamales (plato peruano hecho a base de maíz molido) para venderlos en las mañanas

En un futuro, ella planea tener una tienda de zapatos, pues su mamá de joven se dedicaba a eso y le iba muy bien.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Thi Hoạch

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Hoạch is 55 years old (G. leader). She is requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy mash piglets to raise to increase her income. On top of raising pigs and working in her rice field, she also works as bricks transporter to increase her wage. She has 2 children, all grown up. Her husband is a retired cadre. He helps her out with her task. She likes SEDA because it allows her to make weekly payment, the paperwork is simple. Her family income is 120 USD a month, she will be able to pay back the loan.
Mrs N. Thị Kha is 42 years old. She requests a loan of 2.006.000 VND to raise poultry.
Mrs N. Thị Hường is 25 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to buy fertilizer for her rice field.
Mrs N. Thị Gái is 48 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to invest in her rice field.
Mrs N. Thị Ngợi is 55 years old. She needs a loan of 354.000 VND to invest in her rice field.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô N. Thị Hoạch (MS: 020024), năm nay 55 tuổi. Vay 2.006.000 VND vể để mua lợn chăn nuôi thêm. Bản thân cô làm ruộng và chăn nuôi, ngoài ra cô thường đi gánh gạch thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Cô có 2 con đã trưởng thành và đều đi làm. Chồng cô là một cán bộ về hưu, cũng giúp cô trong công việc chăn nuôi. Với cách thức vay trả tuần giúp cô tiết kiệm, còn có thủ tục nhanh thuận tiện nên cô rất thích vay ở chương trình, với mức thu nhập của gia đinh 120.000 VND/ tháng cô sẽ hoàn trả hết. Cô N. Thị kha (MS: 020025), năm nay 42 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi và phục vụ cho việc hút cát từ sông lên. Chị N. Thị Hường (MS: 020026, năm nay 25 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND để mua lân đạm bón lúa. Cô N. Thị Gái (MS: 020027), năm nay 48 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND để phục vụ cho việc làm nông nghiệp và đốt gạch ngói. Cô N. Thị Ngợi (MS: 020028), năm nay 55 tuổi, vay 354.000 VND phục vụ làm nông nghiệp.

loans.use: animal husbandry, agriculture

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.es:
For seven years Magnolia Cruz and her husband have had their workshop. They are specialists in sports clothes. They began like everyone, working first for other people; nevertheless, after a time and with the money they had saved, they decided to become independent. They bought the basic machines that they needed and they began to make clothes. Little by little, with the passing of the years they have come to perfect their work. They do not have a fixed inventory of their products. To sell the clothes that they produce they go to the stadiums when there are soccer matches and they even travel if necessary.

For Magnolia this work is not sufficient, in spite of the fact that it does not go badly. She also sells medicinal products, because she says that there are always seasons when they do not sell a lot and they need to be prepared. Even so, their goal is to progress and to continue growing their workshop.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Siete años tiene el taller confección de Magnolia Cruz y su esposo. Ellos son especialistas en ropa deportiva. Empezaron como todos, trabajando primero para otras personas; no obstante, al cabo de un tiempo y con un dinero ahorrado decidieron independizarse. Compraron las máquinas básicas que necesitaban y empezaron a confeccionar ropa. Poco a poco, con el paso de los años han sabido perfeccionar su trabajo. No tienen una tienda fija de sus productos. Para vender la ropa que producen se van a los estadios cuando hay partidos de fútbol e incluso viajan si es necesario.

Para Magnolia este trabajo no es suficiente, a pesar de que no les va mal, ella vende por otro lado productos medicinales, pues afirma que siempre hay temporadas que no venden mucho y necesitan estar preparados. Aun así, su meta es progresar y seguir creciendo con su taller de confección.

loans.use: To invest in her medicinal products sale business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Where there is an opportunity to sell her delicacies, Teresa is there. From Monday to Friday she sells delicacies from her small cart outside of a school. Weekends she is located inside a market and for seasons she has participated in fairs or in local holidays always selling her delicacies.
