Sadly, last week Teresa suffered from an automobile accident, which left her with a fracture of her arm. For that reason she has stopped working for a time. Happily she can count on the support of her husband who also works at the same thing that she does and who, these days, is her only company. For now, she hopes to recover and to be able to work again.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Donde sea que tenga la oportunidad de vender sus golosinas teresa esta ahí. De lunes a viernes ella vende en su pequeña carretilla golosinas afuera de un colegio. Los fines de semana se ubica dentro de un mercado y por temporadas participa en ferias o en fiestas patronales vendiendo siempre sus golosinas. Lamentablemente, la semana pasada Teresa sufrió de un accidente automovilístico, el cual la dejo con una fractura en su brazo, razón por la cual ha dejado de trabajar por un tiempo. Felizmente cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien también trabaja en lo mismo que ella y quien, por estos días, significa su única compañía. Por ahora, ella espera reestablecerse y poder volver a trabajar.

loans.use: To invest in her business of selling delicacies.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Since she was very small in her hometown, Julia helped her mom serving in her restaurant where she sold ceviche (a citrus-marinated seafood salad) and shellfish. Twenty years later Julia decided to move to Lima from Piura (a city on the north coast of Peru). Nevertheless, she was not the only one that moved to Lima. Little by little more piuranos kept arriving in the place where Julia lives and, as they kept arriving, they would ask her occasionally to prepare the dishes of food that she used to prepare with her mom.

This was how she began her business three years ago. A time later, she prepared the room dining room of her house to receive her clients. Nowadays, with the aid of her husband, who works as a construction laborer, she is building a space inside her house for her restaurant.

Her business grows larger all the time. Happily she can now count on the aid of her husband, her older daughter and a niece. Her objective is to grow this business more and to be able to hire more people to work with her.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde muy pequeña, en su ciudad natal, ayudó a su mamá atendiendo en su restaurante donde vendía ceviches y mariscos. Hace veinte años atrás Julia decidió mudarse a Lima desde Piura (ciudad en la costa norte del Perú). Sin embargo, ella no fue la única que se mudo a Lima, poco a poco iban llegando más piuranos al lugar donde Julia vive y, conforme iban llegando, le iban pidiendo de vez en cuando que prepare los platos de comida que solía preparar con su mamá.

Fue así que comenzó su negocio hace ya tres años. Un tiempo después ambientó la sala comedor de su casa para recibir a sus clientes y hoy en día, con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero de construcción, está construyendo un local dentro de su casa para su restaurante.

Su negocio se va haciendo cada vez más grande, felizmente cuenta ahora con la ayuda de su esposo, de su hija mayor y de una sobrina. Su objetivo es crecer mas en este negocio y poder contrata r a mas personas para que trabajen con ella.

loans.use: To buy implements necessary for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bi Bi Gul

texts.en: Bi Bi Gul lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and has one son and one daughter. Her husband died of an illness 7 years ago so she is supporting her family. She is a tailor and she has a good number of clients. She wants to expand her business so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines so as to make a good income to help her two children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Before becoming dedicated to selling clothes, Felicia occupied her time tending her wine cellar, but she had to abandon doing that because it did not go so well. That it is why, four years ago, she began selling clothes on foot in a market. Her husband works as a chauffeur for the department of transportation. Both are in charge of the maintenance of the home and of their children, who are of school age.

She feels content with her work. Nevertheless, at 52 years she has not yet lost the hope of fulfilling the dream to have a snack bar in her house. For this she doubles her efforts to work, but she needs to save a lot of money to begin to invest in her dream.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Antes de dedicarse a vender ropa, Felicia ocupaba su tiempo atendiendo en su bodega, sin embargo dejo de hacerlo porque no le iba tan bien. Es por eso que, hace cuatro años vende ropa como ambulante en un mercado. Su esposo trabaja como chofer para el ministerio de transportes. Ambos se ocupan del mantenimiento del hogar y de sus hijos aun en edad escolar.

Ella se siente tranquila con su trabajo, no obstante, a sus 52 años aún no pierde las esperanzas de cumplir el sueño de tener una fuente de soda en su casa, para esto se esfuerza el doble al momento de trabajar, pues necesita ahorrar un monto de dinero para empezar a invertir en su sueño.

loans.use: To invest in her clothing sale business.

loans.name: Parween

texts.en: Parween lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is educated, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a shopkeeper and she is a tailor. She wants to help her husband and her family so she has requested an individual loan to buy new machines for her small tailoring business so as to help her family and help her husband. She is happy with this  process of small loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Abdul Samat

texts.en: Abdul Samat lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married. He has a clothing shop where he works. He has good experience. He already took his first cycle loan and was able to expand his business. Now he has requested his second cycle individual loan to enlarge his shop further to attract more customers and make a good monthly income to help his family. He is very happy to be requesting his second cycle loan.

loans.use: To enlarge his small clothing shop

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en: Ashraf lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated, married, and the father of 2 sons. He is a tailor and he is a very hard worker. He needs to complete his business stock. He has requested an individual loan to enable him to make a good income and make a better future for his family. He is happy about this loan and he would like to thank Kiva lenders that help poor people.

loans.use: To purchase business necessities he lacks

loans.name: Gulbodin

texts.en: Gulbodin lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of 6 children. He is uneducated and he does agricultural work. His work is the only source of income for his family. He wants to expand his business by taking out an individual loan to complete his agriculture needs so as to take the best advantage of his land so that he can help all his children and give them a better education.

loans.use: To complete his agriculture needs

loans.name: Catherine's Tulivu Group

texts.en:
Catherine is 38 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 12, 10 and 9. Catherine sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business of batik making.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Asha's Tulivu Group

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and is single with 1 child, aged 9. Asha sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. She works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rehema and Salma, who have businesses of owning a shop and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Noacha's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Noacha is 39 years old and is single with 2 children, aged 16 and 15. Noacha is sells soap, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Moula, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Noacha's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Noacha is 39 years old and is single woman with 3 children, ages16 and15 years old. Noacha is a soap seller, she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 7am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Moula, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more soap for her business.

loans.name: Agatha's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Agatha is 37 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 14, 13 and 8. Agatha owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2006. She works every day from 10 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Lucy, who has a business dealing in used clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Julieth's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Julieth is 39 years old and is married with 4 children, aged 21, 18, 14 and 11. Julieth owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Agnes, who has a business dealing in used clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Amina's Endelevu Group

texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 16, 14 and 10. Amina is a charcoal seller, which she started doing in 2006. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Anna, Prisca, and Nest, who have businesses dealing in charcoal sales, food vending, and owning a shop.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
A. Adjoa sells used clothing. She is married and has 5 dependents. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the financial needs of the family, so she is working very hard to support her husband financially. She wishes to increase sales which will increase her income.

She is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony B. sells herbal medicine. He is a single parent of 2 children. His income is not enough to meet the financial needs of the family, so he wants to increase production and sale, but he lacks capital.

He is asking for $525 to buy materials for production.

loans.use: To buy materials for production.

loans.name: Hilda's Umbunga Group

texts.en:
Hilda is 27 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 7 and 4 years old. Hilda has been a tailor since 2006. She works every day from 10 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who has a business dealing in clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring (clothes) items for her business.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
B. George sells and rents bicycles. He is married and has 4 children. He is running out bicycles and he wants to increase sales.

He is asking for $525 to buy more bicycles to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles to sell and rent.

loans.name: Mema

texts.en:
Mema is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 3 years old. Mema is a tailor and she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Ayawavi K. was born on January 28, 1969 in Lomé. She has been dealing in teakwood poles since 2005. Her primary customers are carpenters and masons. She acquires her poles from the prefectures of Zio and Yoto. For the moment, she has a corner on this market in the neighborhood where her business is located.

The loan of US$ 1200 she is requesting will allow her to purchase 500 teakwood poles.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame K. Ayawavi est née le 28 janvier 1969 à Lomé. Elle exerce le commerce de perche en teck depuis 2005. Ses principaux clients sont les menuisiers et les maçons. Elle a l’habitude d’acheter ses perches dans la préfecture de zio et de yoto. Elle détient pour l’instant le monopole dans le quartier dans lequel elle vend.

Le crédit de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 500 pieds de perches en teck.

loans.use:
purchase of 500 poles of teakwood

Achat de 500 perches en tecks

loans.name: Tabia's Arimpya Group

texts.en:
Tabia is 34 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 9 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 12, 9 and 2 years old. Tabia owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Vaileth, who has a business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Oga Mawuéna

texts.fr:
Mr. Oga Mawuéna V. was born on October 28, 1974 in Tsévié, a town located 35 kilometers from Lomé. He is married and is the father of three children. In the year 2000, he opened a store selling automobile tires in the part of Lomé known as Agbalépédo. His customers are mostly auto mechanics. He is now planning to open a second store in a neighborhood called Adidoadé.

He is requesting his first loan in the amount of US$ 1200 which will allow him to acquire 42 tires with which he plans to stock his second store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur V. Oga Mawuéna est née le 28 octobre 1974 à Tsévié, ville située à 35 Km de Lomé. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Il a ouvert en 2000 son magasin de vente de pneus de véhicule dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Ses clients son généralement des mécaniciens à quatre (4) roues. Actuellement, il a un projet d’ouverture d’un second magasin dans le quartier d’Adidoadé.

Le premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir quarante deux (42) pneus qu’il disposera dans son second magasin en création.

loans.use:
purchase of 42 automobile tires

Achat de 42 pneus de véhicules

loans.name: Anna's Food Vending Group

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 49, 21and 8 years old. Anna owns a small food vending store and she is a clothes seller, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Edithar, who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas B. sells cosmetics and beauty supplies. She is not yet married and has no children. She is a young woman who is focused on developing herself and expanding her business. She wishes to increase sales, but lacks capital.

She is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Maria owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 1991. Every day, she works from 7 am to 6.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Amina's Tunda Group

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 3 years old. Amina is a maize seller, and she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $210 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Halima and Aeshi, who have businesses dealing in tailoring and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more maize for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child. Grace owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Aziza's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Aziza is 35 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 12 and 10 years old. Aziza owns a small kiosk and she is a potato chips seller, which she started in 1991. Everyday, she works from 6 am to 6.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (Irish potatoes, cooking oil) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Consolatha, who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (Irish potatoes, cooking oil) for her business.

loans.name: Joyce's Tumshukuru Mungu Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and is a divorced woman with 6 children, ages 6 to 20 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 6 years old. Joyce owns a small food vending store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 9.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Stella, who has business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a married woman with 2 children, ages 10 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, age 4 years old. Elly owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2003. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $350 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abiba T. was born in 1962 in Kourbongou in the prefecture of Tône (in the far north of Togo). She is married and is the mother of 6 children. She is in the cereal business in the Agoè open-air market. She has been in this business since 1983. She buys her millet, corn, and dried beans in the Kara region. Her customers re-sell the cereals as retailers.

She is requesting her first loan of US$ 1200 which will allow her to purchase 14 sacks of dried beans to add to her inventory of cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame T. Abiba est née en 1962 à Kourbongou dans la préfecture de Tône (A l’extrême nord du Togo). Elle est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce de céréales dans le marché d’Agoè. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 1983. Elle achète le mil, le maïs et du haricot dans la région de la Kara. Ses clients sont les revendeuses qui achètent et revendent en détail.

Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA lui permettra d’acheter 14 sacs de haricot pour augmenter son stock de céréales.

loans.use:
Purchase of 14 sacks of dried beans

Achat de 14 sacs d'haricot

loans.name: Fatuma'ushindi B Group

texts.en:
Fatuma Said, age 32, is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 4. She has a business selling clothes from door to door and a vegetable business. She works from 10am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly income of approximately $85.

Fatuma has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. to improve her business. She hopes for a new loan to open a retail shop. Fatuma will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell clothes, food, plastics and fish.

In the picture, Fatuma is the first person on the left..

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Reyna Leonidas

texts.en:
Reyna Leonidas is 25 years old and the proud mother of four children, three of whom attend school.  She sells homemade breakfasts to people of the Los Roche community in San Cristobal.  Although maintaining the cash flow is sometimes challenging, this entrepreneur expects her new sandwiches and hamburgers to help in moving her business forward and repaying the loan.
Reyna  Leonidas’ enterprise supports her children’s education and the family’s well-being.

loans.use: To buy goods to prepare sandwiches and hamburgers for a small business.

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.en:
Cristobalina is a young entrepreneur and mother of a unique three-year old son. Each day, she goes to a butcher shop to bulk-buy meat and then resells it to people in her community.
Shortly after her son’s birth, Cristobalina had to leave her studies to take care of him, but would like to resume her education and one day become a professional.
She will use her loan to buy more meat to increase her sales volume and move her business forward with this goal in mind.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh meat to resell in her community.

loans.name: Mirian Cristina

texts.en:
Mirian Cristina is a young and budding entrepreneur who makes a living selling women’s clothing in her hometown of Los Roche community in San Cristobal.
Mirian explains that she wants to become a professional in order to lift herself out of poverty and achieve a better position in society.
With her loan, she will buy more goods to continue satisfying her customers’ needs and augment her income.

loans.use: To acquire clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa, a low-income entrepreneur and mother of three children, lives in the Los Roche community of San Cristobal, where her husband works for a construction company.  To augment family income, Santa sells a collection of beauty products such as hand and body lotions, facial cleansing foam and the like.
In order to make her products better-known and increase her sales volume, this entrepreneur plans to use her loan to purchase a showcase to display her products.
Santa hopes her business will allow her and her family to enjoy a better lifestyle

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for a small business.

loans.name: Tayo

texts.fr:
Madame Tayo A. was born November 13, in Lome Togo, married with 2 children. She launched her business in 2005, fabricating medical products which are used at hospitals primary for burn victims. She transforms basic ingredients such as Ethanol and other chemicals into the final product which she also resells. Her sister and 2 younger brothers help out with the business. Her first credit was for 500 000CFA (~$1200) which already allowed her to purchases many raw ingredients, such as Ethanol and other creams. Due to the price increases recently in this sector for these raw materials she is seeking another loan to purchase additional raw materials to increase her supply. She plans to use these funds to purchase raw mint crystals which is a primary ingredient in her fabrication.

- translated on site by Kiva Rep, April 17, 2008

Madame A. Tayo est née le 13 novembre 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a crée en 2005, une entreprise de fabrication et de vente d’Ethanol, de pommade et de produits chimiques qui sont utiliser à l'hôpital pour les patients accidenté. Elle est aidée par sa sœur et ses deux petits frères. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle vient de solder lui a permis d’acquérir les bouteilles d’Ethanol et de boites de pommades. Compte tenu de l’augmentation du prix des matières premières qui entrent dans la fabrication de ses produits chimiques, madame A. Tayo sollicite encore un crédit pour l’achat d’un tonneau de menthe pour la fabrication de médicaments.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients to make Hospital medical creams

loans.name: Charity's Mpakani Group

texts.en:
Charity K., age 40, is married with one son who is 17 years old. She has a business selling animal feed and chips that she began 3 years ago. She works from 8am to 6pm on animal feed and then up to 10pm on her chips business each day. She is able to make a monthly profit of about $204.

Charity has taken out one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. to buy equipments for her chips business. She hopes for a new loan to improve her animal feed business. Charity will share this loan with her sub-group members dealing who have shops, a café and a grocery store, and sell animal feed, poultry, electrical equipment, and fish.

In the picture, Charity is is the first person on the right in front row.

loans.use: To improve her animal feed business

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 32 years old and the single mother of a unique school-going 12-year-old son.  After her husband left, Joseline had to quickly find a way to survive and take care of her son, so she started a small business selling perfumes, shoes, silver jewels and other goods.  In a few years, she hopes she will have earned sufficient money to rent or buy a small shop.
With her loan of $175, this entrepreneur will purchase more goods to add to her stock, her goal being to maintain a comfortable life for her son.

loans.use: To acquire perfumes, jewels and shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en: Elnura A.  is renting a small shop next to her house where she sells bed sheets, blankets, and women's and children's clothes. She has 3 children. Her husband was in hospital for 2 weeks and had surgery. She had to spend money from her shop's working capital on her husband's expenses. Now she needs a loan to purchase inventory. Her son is 21 years old and also supports them as much as he can. He is a painter and works in the construction of small houses.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 5 and 3 years old. Neema is a egg seller, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7 am to 5 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $120 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.use: To buy more egg for her business.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 32 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 8 to 15 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other person, age 55 years old. Hidaya is a clothes seller, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 4.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rufat

texts.en:
Rufat A. has a truck that he uses for providing transportation service mostly to people who want to move bricks, sand, and other construction materials. He is married and has 5 children. Rufat is an Internally Displaced Person from Khankendi and the IDP community from Khankendi knows him well and respects him.

When they were displaced after the war with Armenia, small new settlements for refugees were built, and Rufat has been transporting construction materials for free as a volunteer. Now he earns his living with this truck. He needs this loan to do some repairs and purchase used tires that are in better shape.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and repairs

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 4 to 20 years old. Roda is a clothes seller, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 4-20 years old. Roda is a clothes seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Guleyfa

texts.en: Guleyfa E. is an Internally Displaced Person from Zangilan. Her family had been breeding cattle in their small farm in Zangilan. After the war they lost everything, moved to Baku, and bought a small shop in front of their house where they started selling meat. She can’t use her fridge to store meat for even a day because it’s old and broken and it’s hard to find spare parts for them, plus they are very expensive to order. She needs this loan to purchase new display-fridge.

loans.use: Purchase of fridge to display meat for sale

loans.name: Wary's Nkura Group

texts.en:
Wary is 39 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 20 and 16 years old. Wary is a food seller, and she started in 1999. Every day, she works from 6 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items (rice, meat, tomatoes and maize flour) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Elizabeth K. and Elizabeth Y., who have businesses dealing in fruit sales and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items (rice, meat, tomatoes and maize flour) for her business

loans.name: Huru

texts.en: Huru A. is an Internally Displaced Person and she had been working as a hairdresser in Aghdam where she came from. Now she rents a small place close to her house. She believes that she can turn this place into the best beauty salon in the neighborhood in the close future. She needs this loan to change the lights and add some equipment, because she presently has only scissors, combs, and a hair dryer. Huru is married and has two children. Her husband is a bus driver.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment to upgrade her little business

loans.name: Hudoiberdy

texts.ru:
Hudoiberdy Y. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 49 years old, married and has 9 children. He is in the business of raising cattle. He purchases young animals, raises them and resells them on the market. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. This business is the only source of income for his family. In order to help his business grow, Hudoiberdy needs additional financing. He has come to Kiva in order to obtain a loan. He plans to repay the loan withing a 6 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Ятимов Худойберды проживает в городе Яван.Клиенту 49 лет. Он женат и имеет 9 детй.Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Имеет налаженное хозяйство . Он покупает молодых телят , откармливает и перепродает на тех же рынках. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Для того , чтобы развивать бизнес ему необходимо дополнительное финансирование. Поэтому он обратился в нашу организацию, чтобы пролучить кредит. Погасить кредит он планирует за 6 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 21 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 1 year old. Paulina owns a small stock of chickens, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy more chicken to increase her stock.

loans.name: Abdu's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Abdu O. , age 27, is single. He has a furniture business that he began 6 years ago. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and has been able to make a monthly profit of around $68.

Abdu has taken one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to improve his furniture business. Abdu will share this loan with his subgroup members who have stores and salons, a dry cleaning business, and sell snakes and charcoal.

Abdu is the tallest person in the photograph. He is wearing red and is in the back row.

loans.use: to increase on business

loans.name: Daima's Juhudi Group

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (sugar, juice, margarine, cooking oil and soap) for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more items (sugar, juices, margarine, cooking oil and soap) for her shop.

loans.name: Diouldé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Diouldé M. is a woman who has a little shop right in front of her house. Her aim is to help her husband support their family. She is asking for a short-term loan so that she can consolidate her little business venture.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame Diouldé M. est une femme qui fait du petit commerce devant son domicile pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges du ménage. Elle sollicite un prêt pour consolider ses activités.

loans.use:
to add to her business capital

renforcement fonds de roulement pour ses activites commerciales

loans.name: Francis Kwabena

texts.en:

He is asking for $525 to buy more raw materials for production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Maîmouna

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Maîmouna D. est une couturière experimentee ; elle a une clientele composee essentiellement de femmes ; elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des tissus et un peu de mercerie.

loans.use:
purchase of cloth and various sewing supplies to develop her business

achat de tissus et fournitures diverses pour developper ses activites

loans.name: Christina's Chapakazi Group

texts.en:
Christina is 43 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 7 to 23 years old. Christina is a snack seller, and she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 7 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more snack items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Jesca and Damari, who have businesses dealing in tailoring.

loans.use: To buy more snacks items for her business.

loans.name: Judith's Paradise Group

texts.en:
Judith is 37 years old and is married woman with 3 children, ages 9 to 21 years old. She and her husband also take care of 13 other children, ages 15 to 25 years old. Judith is a food seller, and she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 9 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam, Suzana and Stelah, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales and vegetables sales.

loans.name: Catherine's Ashok D Group

Catherine Ngingo, age 52, is a divorcee with two children, ages 27 and 25. She has a shop that she began 11 years ago. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $833.

Catherine hopes for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have shops, and sell soft drinks and beer.

In the picture, Catherine is the first person on the right.

loans.name: Anna's Agape Group

texts.en:

Anna is a clothes (vitenge and khanga) seller, and she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 6 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (vitenge and khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (vitenge and khanga) for her business.

loans.name: Elishakaria

texts.en:
Elishakaria P. is a widow with 2 children, aged 25 and 20 years old. Elishakaria sells green bananas and milk. Every day, she works from 9 am to 6.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her milk stock and to buy more bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more animals and more bananas

loans.name: Mardon

texts.ru:
Mardon O. and his family live in the city of Yavan. Mardon is married and has 6 children. He has a plot of land on which he raises cattle. He purchases young animals, raises them for a bout 1 month, and then resells them. Mardon would like to increase turnover of the business in order to increase his family's income. The loan will also help further advance the development of businesses in the area. Mardon plans to repay the loan within a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Одинаев Мардон житель города Яван. Живет со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 6 детей. Имеет дехканское хозяйство. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Скупает мелко-рогатый скот. После откормки , которая длится около 1 месяца продает. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 30 лет. Сейчас Мардон хочет увеличить товарооборот , который поможет увеличить доходы его семьи. Кроме того развитие его бизнеса в частности сможет помочь развитию всего сектора. Для этого Мардон планируент получить кредит, который сможет погасить в течении 15 месяцев.

He is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Elinipa

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

Покупает молодых телят , откармливает и продает на тех же рынках. loans.name: Ebu

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru:
Abdukodir M. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 56, married, and has children. He is in the business of agriculture. He owes a piece of land that he plants with seeds of wheat and potatoes. He sells his crops at a local market. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. For this new season, Abdukodir needs seeds and fertilizers, which he cannot afford due to his difficult financial position. For this reason, he decided to apply for a loan. He is planning to pay off his credit in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзомуродов Абдукодир житель города Яван. Женат и имеет 56 детей. Занимается растениеводством. Имеет землю , которую засеивает пшеницей и картофелем. Урожай продает на сельском рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Для засева в новом сезоне Абдукодиру необходимо купить семена и удобрения , а в связи с тяжелым финансовым положением он не может это сделать. Поэтому он решил получить кредит, который поможет сделать это ему. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 6 месяцев

Evaline is 45 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages16 to 27 years old. Eveline is a animal feed, vegetables and fruits seller, and she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

loans.name: Kiboswa Safina Group

texts.en:
Evaline N. is an average Kenyan woman aged 40 who is married with 2 children. She also cares for 2 orphan children of her late sister. Evaline started her second-hand clothing business 8 years ago after working as a house helper for 10 years.

Evaline deals in ladies' and children’s wear. She purchases her bails of clothes every Sunday from Kibuye market which is well-known for its wholesale clothing business. With the little profit that she gets from her business, Evaline is still able to clothe, feed, and educate her children and relatives with the help of her husband who works as a mechanic in Kisumu town.

With the help of her loan, Evaline would like to diversify her business. Evaline’s long-term business vision is to expand her business into a boutique.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business.

Sara S. is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged 3 to 14 years old. Sara sells vegetables, maize and milk. She started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7.30 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables and maize for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Priskila's Peace Group

texts.en:
Priskila is 31 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 11, 8 and 4 years old. Priskila is a milk seller, and she started in 2001. Every day, she works from 6 am to 8 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in milk sales.

loans.use: To buy more milk for her business.

loans.name: Maria's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14, 11 and 8 years old. Maria owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8 am to 11 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $160 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in vegetables sales and food sales to the market, and one is a shop owner.

loans.name: Euniles's Nyota Njema Group

texts.en:
Eunile is 29 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 8, 6 and 4 years old. Eunile owns a small stock of animals, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Eunile now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in clothing sales, a beauty salon, a general shop and used clothes sales.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.name: Laheli

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year old Laheli N.. She is married and has four children aged one, three, six, and eight. In 2002, Laheli established her second-hand clothing business. Laheli has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed, and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam. Retailers then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything western or modern. Some argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Assy

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year old Assy M.. She is married and has two children aged three and eight. In 2005, Assy established her crop wholesale business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of crops in bulk, for retail.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29 year old Aziza M.. She is married and has three children aged five, eight, and ten. In 2005, Aziza established her general store business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 22 year old Hadija M.. She is married and has one child aged two. In 2007, Hadija established her rice business. She requires a loan in order to purchase stock of crops in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.name: Mying Jubel 2045-1 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mary I.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Mary is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 4 children ranging from ages 4 to 12 and her children go to school. Each week, Mary makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Mary is joined in her small group by Susan N., Marther N., William K., and Jusinta J.. Susan N. sells bread and wants to expand her business. Marther N. sells bread and wants a loan to expand her business. William K. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Jusinta J. sells beer and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Rafatu

texts.en: Mrs. Rafatu E. lives in the Okoko area in Lagos State Nigeria and has 3 children. At 40-years old, she is happy with her business of selling of Amala, semovita, eba and elubo (plantain powder) within her community.  Has been in this business of food production for the past 8 years. Rafatu requests a loan of $450 to enable her buy more elubo, semovita and garri for so she can produce more food to sell. Elubo is a local food and is made from dried plantain or yam while eba is made from garri and garri is made from cassava.

loans.use: To buy more stock for food production

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 48 year old Tabitha M.. She is married and has four children aged 14, 20, 24, and 30. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her nephews. In 2007, Tabitha established her soap business. She requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of soap in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of soap in bulk.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a small entrepreneur from Kharkov. She started a venture selling footwear at the Barabashova market seven years ago. She usually purchases inventory wholesale from a Chinese factory. Presently, Yelena’s turnover capital is about $9000, and her monthly net profit is about $1500. 

Yelena is requesting a loan to increase her selection of merchandise for the coming summer season which will help her respond to customer demand. Because her clientele is continuously growing, she hopes to open a new vending spot and further develop her trade.  At this stage in her business development, it is important for Yelena to offer a wide variety of items in order to establish a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending location and additional seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is a widow with a 19-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Kharkov where she runs a small venture selling footwear in the local Barabashovo market. She sells high-quality merchandise, and her kiosk has affordable rent in a favorable location. Yelena is a workaholic. She works in the worst weather conditions and is ready to sacrifice her time and rest to achieve even higher results. She has been in this trade for 8 years. Currently, her daily income is around $10-40. 

Yelena has benefited a lot from loans from Nadiya Ukraine. She has requested an additional small loan to help pay her overhead and purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. Yelena is very prompt with her loan payments. We are happy to provide this timely financial support which is so crucial for her as her small venture is the only source of income for her and her daughter.

loans.use: To increase stock and support overhead

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 22 year old Rose K.. She is married and has a one year old child. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her sisters. In 2003, Rose established her market stall business. Rose has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requires a new loan in order to purchase stock of crops in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for resale at the market.

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is a small business owner from Ordzhonikidze, a city in the central part of Ukraine. He works to support his family by selling clothing at a busy outdoor market in Ordzhonikidze. Igor has been in business for about three years and makes around $700 per month. Eventually he would like to open a second vending location to increase his sales and profits.

Igor has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to add to his working business capital. He has developed a good reputation and credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to assist Igor with the success of his business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu I. 26-years old, married with one child, and hails from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and sundry items. Idowu has been in her business for the past 8 years. She requests a loan of $450 so she can buy more drinks and goods for sale. This will help her expand her business so she can supply more customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and goods for sale

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is an experienced entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. For the past seven years, she has had her own small business selling clothing at the Ordzhonikidze central market. She currently sells a nice selection of clothing at affordable prices. Economic expansion in Ukraine has improved the lives of many people and has lead to increased demand for products such as the clothing Lubov sells. In the future, she would like to continue working to develop her business and possibly open a second sales location.

Lubov has requested a short-term loan to increase her business capital and help purchase new inventory to sell. She has developed a good reputation as a client with Nadiya Ukraine, and we are happy to have this opportunity to continue assisting her with her business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana has a business selling second hand clothing at a busy market in the town of Nadvirna in western Ukraine. She has been in business for four years and has developed a successful enterprise, selling a good variety of clothes at reasonable prices. Oksana’s decision to start her business was influenced by her sister who also sells second hand clothing. Oksana is not married. Her business has been a good source of income for her to support herself.

Oksana has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a new supply of second hand clothing inventory for her business. This is a busy time of year for clothing vendors like Oksana. The ability to purchase a bulk supply of clothing will help her maximize her profits and continue to earn a good income.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima owns a successful clothing sales business at the central market in Ordshonikidze, Ukraine. She has a small booth in a good, visible location at the market where each day she sets up an attractive clothing display for passing customers. Rima is divorced. Her business provides an important source of income for her. She makes around $700 in a typical month.

Rima has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to add to her working business capital and help purchase new inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Hubaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Hubaldo S. rents a home on Luís Espinal street in the Chuquiaguillo zone of the city of La Paz. He is legally separated from his wife and owns a car that he uses as a public taxi, generating income this way.

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase tires and repair his vehicle because without these things, he cannot work, this being his only source of income. He would like to leave his car in excellent condition so that he can go back to work as usual.

He has good credit history and qualifies for a new loan. He has been a member of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Hubaldo vive en alquiler en la calle Luís Espinal de la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz; está separado de la esposa, tiene un auto el cual hace trabajar como taxi de servicio publico generando así sus ingresos de subsistencia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar llantas y reparar su movilidad ya que con las fallas que tiene no puede trabajar y es su único medio de ingresos. Lo que quiere es poner su taxi en buenas condiciones y trabajar con normalidad.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase tires for taxi

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year old Bupe M.. She is married and has four children aged between 6 and 19. In 2000, Bupe established her grocery business. She requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of fish, oil, and cloth in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish, oil, and cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year old Christina K.. She is widowed and has two children aged 14 and 19. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her sister's children. In 2007, Christina established her clothing business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase dresses, shirts, and trousers for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing

loans.name: Uchena

texts.en: Uchena O. is 30-years old, married and has 3children.She hails from Okoko Lagos State Nigeria. She sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. Uchena acquired has been in her business since 2005. Uchena is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Ms. Maria R. has three grown-up children, but lives alone because they are all married. She lives in Kilómetro 7 in the Alto San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz. Maria sells different kinds of products, including: appliances, clothing, provisions, auto supplies, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her capital and purchase more merchandise for her business, since the demand for her products has been climbing steadily. She must now purchase more merchandise to keep her shop well-stocked.

Her good credit history qualifies her as a good customer, so she is able to request a new loan. She has been a member of IMPRO since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria tiene tres hijos pero vive sola porque ellos ya se casaron; su domicilio es en el Kilómetro 7 D. la zona D. Alto San Pedro D. la ciudad D. La Paz. Maria se dedica a la venta D. productos D. diferentes clases, como ser artefactos eléctricos, ropa, víveres, insumos para automóviles, etc. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo y comprar más mercadería para su negocio, pues la demanda por sus productos ha ido en aumento paulatinamente y ahora necesita comprar más para poder tener un buen stock D. mercadería.

Su antecedente histórico la califica como buena cliente y pueD. acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente D. IMPRO desD. el año 2006.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: appliances, clothing, provisions, auto supplies, etc.

loans.name: Mbumi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 36 year old Mbumi Z.. She is married and has two children aged 3 and 18. She also has two dependents, who live with her because they are her niece and nephew. In 2000, Mbumi established her clothing business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year old Sophia D.. She is married and has two children aged 3 and 8. She also has one dependent, who lives with her because she is her sister. In 2002, Sophia established her general store business. She requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Ms. Vicenta H. lives in her own home with her children on Mario Alborta street in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. She is legally separated from her husband.

She sells different types of products by special order, such as electronics, toys, provisions, etc. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her capital, since she currently has many orders but does not have enough capital to purchase more merchandise. Vicenta has already obtained a loan through Kiva, which has been repaid before the due date.

She has an excellent credit history and qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Vicenta vive en casa propia con sus hijos; está separada del esposo, su domicilio esta en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.

La actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de diferentes clases como ser artefactos eléctricos, juguetes, víveres, etc. todo a pedido; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que tiene muchos pedidos y no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar más stock de mercadería. Vicenta ya obtuvo un crédito a través de Kiva, el cual ha sido pagado antes de su fecha de vencimiento.

Su antecedente histórico es bueno y califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as: appliances, toys, provisions, etc.

loans.name: Taifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year old Taifa K.. She is married and has four children aged between 6 and 16. In 2000, Taifa established her general store business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.
